original: rigs kyi bu mo la la zhig gis sems can gcig cig bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la bzhag na de'i bsod nams ches mang du 'phel lo //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo la la zhig gis sems can gcig cig bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la bzhag na de'i bsod nams ches mang du 'phel lo //
translated: If some son or daughter of good family were to establish a single sentient being in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, their merit would increase much more.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems can gcig po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la 'jog pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi gdung mi gcod pa'i don du zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can gcig po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la 'jog pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi gdung mi gcod pa'i don du zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because establishing a single sentient being in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is for the sake of not cutting off the lineage of the Buddhas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: @96a * // koo shi ka byang chub sems dpa' las byung ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bar rnams yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @96a * // koo shi ka byang chub sems dpa' las byung ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bar rnams yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Kauśika, it is because from the bodhisattvas come the tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas.

original: koo shi ka rnam grangs des na 'di ltar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: koo shi ka rnam grangs des na 'di ltar rig par bya ste /
translated: Kauśika, by this one of many explanations it should be known that

original: 'jig rten lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams mchod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bkur ba tsam gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams mchod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bkur ba tsam gsum pa yin no //
translated: the world with its gods, humans, and asuras should worship the bodhisattvas.” This is the third praise.

original: koo shi ka gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am /🔽rigs kyi bu mo la la zhig gis 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can rnams dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam nas /
analyzed: koo shi ka gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am / rigs kyi bu mo la la zhig gis 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can rnams dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam nas /
translated: Furthermore, Kauśika, if a son or daughter of noble family were to establish the sentient beings of Jambudvīpa in the ten virtuous deeds,🔽🔽

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi bar la bkod par gyur na /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi bar la bkod par gyur na /
translated: “Furthermore, Kauśika, if a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family were to establish the sentient beings of Jambudvīpa in the ten wholesome actions, up to establishing them in the fruit of a pratyekabuddha,

original: koo shi ka de ji snyam du sems /🔽rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: koo shi ka de ji snyam du sems / rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: what do you think, Kauśika?

original: rigs kyi bu mo de'i bsod nams de'i rgyus mang du 'phel lam /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de'i bsod nams de'i rgyus mang du 'phel lam /
translated: Would the merit of that son of a good family or daughter of a good family be great on that account?”

original: brgya byin gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis gsol pa /
translated: Śatakratu said,

original: bcom ldan 'das mang ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mang ngo //
translated: “It would be, Blessed One.

original: bde bar gshegs pa mang ngo //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa mang ngo //
translated: It would be, Sugata.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /🔽koo shi ka de bas kyang rigs kyi bu'am /🔽rigs kyi bu mo gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bris shing glegs bam du byas te /🔽chung ngu na bri ba'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba / koo shi ka de bas kyang rigs kyi bu'am / rigs kyi bu mo gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bris shing glegs bam du byas te / chung ngu na bri ba'am /
translated: The Lord said,

original: bklags pa'i phyir gzhan la byin na bsod nams ches mang du 'phel lo //
analyzed: bklags pa'i phyir gzhan la byin na bsod nams ches mang du 'phel lo //
translated: “Kauśika, a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family who writes out this perfection of wisdom and makes it into a book and gives it to others, even just for the purpose of reading it aloud, would have even more merit than that.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las zag pa med pa'i chos rnams rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir ro //🔽gang la bslabs shing rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las zag pa med pa'i chos rnams rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir ro // gang la bslabs shing rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Because in this perfection of wisdom the dharmas of the unentangled are taught in detail.

original: rigs kyi bu mo dag la yang dag par skyon med par zhugs par gyur to //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo dag la yang dag par skyon med par zhugs par gyur to //
translated: Having trained in it, sons and daughters of good family have entered into perfect purity,

original: 'jug go // 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jug go // 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: are entering, will enter.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid kyi bar du thob po //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid kyi bar du thob po //
translated: Up to the state of arhatship they have attained,

original: 'thob po // 'thob par 'gyur ro //🔽rang byang chub thob po //
analyzed: 'thob po // 'thob par 'gyur ro // rang byang chub thob po //
translated: are attaining, will attain.

original: 'thob po // 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'thob po // 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: They have attained, are attaining, will attain the enlightenment of a pratyekabuddha.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams yang dag pa'i skyon med par zhugs par gyur to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams yang dag pa'i skyon med par zhugs par gyur to //
translated: Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas have entered into perfect purity,

original: 'jug go // 'jug par 'gyur ro //🔽bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //🔽mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: 'jug go // 'jug par 'gyur ro // bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so // mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: are entering, will enter.

original: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They have fully awakened, are fully awakening, will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: koo shi ka zag pa med pa'i chos de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: koo shi ka zag pa med pa'i chos de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: “Kauśika, what are those uncontaminated dharmas?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang /
translated: the perfections, the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, the four noble truths, the four immeasurable aspirations, the four formless absorptions, the eight liberations,

original: @96b mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: @96b mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang /
translated: the nine serial absorptions, emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness, the clairvoyances, internal emptiness, external emptiness, and internal and external emptiness,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang /
translated: the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities, all the meditative stabilizations, all the dhāraṇī gateways, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos gzhal du med pa'i bar du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las rgya cher bstan to //🔽koo shi ka rnam grangs des kyang rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos gzhal du med pa'i bar du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las rgya cher bstan to // koo shi ka rnam grangs des kyang rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, up to the immeasurable buddhadharmas have been extensively taught by the tathāgatas, the arhats, the perfectly awakened ones in this perfection of wisdom.

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bris shing glegs bam du byas te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bris shing glegs bam du byas te /
translated: “Kauśika, because of this one of many explanations, a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family who writes out this perfection of wisdom and makes it into a book

original: bri ba dang / bklag pa'i phyir gzhan la byin na de'i bsod nams ches mang du 'phel bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bri ba dang / bklag pa'i phyir gzhan la byin na de'i bsod nams ches mang du 'phel bar shes par bya'o //
translated: If one gives it to others to write out and to read, one should know that one’s merit increases even more.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: koo shi ka shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las chos thams cad rgya cher bstan te /
analyzed: koo shi ka shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las chos thams cad rgya cher bstan te /
translated: Kauśika, it is because all dharmas are revealed in this perfection of wisdom in detail.

original: de dag yod pas rgyal rigs s'a chen po rnams dang / bram ze'i rigs s'a la chen po rnams dang / khyim bdag gi rigs s'a la chen po rnams yod do //
analyzed: de dag yod pas rgyal rigs s'a chen po rnams dang / bram ze'i rigs s'a la chen po rnams dang / khyim bdag gi rigs s'a la chen po rnams yod do //
translated: Because of them, there are great warrior-noble families, great brahmin families, and great householder families.

original: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams yod do //
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams yod do //
translated: There are gods of the Catur­mahā­rāja­kāyika realm.

original: sum cu rtsa gsum dang / 'thab bral dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed dang / tshangs 'khor dang / tshangs pa bdun na 'don dang / tshangs pa chen po dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar gyi lha rnams yod do //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum dang / 'thab bral dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed dang / tshangs 'khor dang / tshangs pa bdun na 'don dang / tshangs pa chen po dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar gyi lha rnams yod do //
translated: There are gods of the Trayas­triṃśa, Yāmā, Tuṣita, Nirmāṇa­rata, Para­nirmita­vaśa­vartin, Brahmakāyika, Brahmapurohita, Mahābrahma, up to Āsaṃjñika realms.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad yod do //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad yod do //
translated: There are all the perfections.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yod do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yod do //
translated: the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening exist,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu yod do //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu yod do //
translated: the four noble truths exist, the eight liberations exist, the nine serial absorptions exist,

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa drug yod do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa drug yod do //
translated: the six clairvoyances exist,

original: stong pa nyid thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams yod do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams yod do //
translated: all the emptinesses exist, all the meditative stabilizations exist, and the dhāraṇī gateways exist,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yod do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yod do //
translated: the ten tathāgata powers exist, the four fearlessnesses exist, the four detailed and thorough knowledges exist, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha exist,

original: @97a * // byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po yod do //
analyzed: @97a * // byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po yod do //
translated: great love exists, and great compassion exists,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yod do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yod do //
translated: and the knowledge of all aspects exists.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa yod do //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa yod do //
translated: Stream enterers exist,

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams yod do //
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams yod do //
translated: there are pratyekabuddhas;

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams yod do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams yod do //
translated: and there are tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas.

original: koo shi ka 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can rnams rang byang chub kyi bar la bkod pa lta zhog gi / koo shi ka gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can ji snyed pa de dag rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: koo shi ka 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can rnams rang byang chub kyi bar la bkod pa lta zhog gi / koo shi ka gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can ji snyed pa de dag rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: “Kauśika, let alone establishing the sentient beings of Jambudvīpa up to pratyekabuddhahood, Kauśika, if a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family were to establish all the sentient beings of a four-continent world-realm up to pratyekabuddhahood,

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang la las dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang / rang byang chub kyi bar la rab tu bkod na /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang la las dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang / rang byang chub kyi bar la rab tu bkod na /
translated: and if another son of a good family or daughter of a good family were to establish a single sentient being in the ten wholesome actions, up to in pratyekabuddhahood,

original: koo shi ka de ji snyam du sems /🔽rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: koo shi ka de ji snyam du sems / rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: what do you think, Kauśika?

original: rigs kyi bu mo de'i bsod nams de'i rgyus mang du 'phel lam /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de'i bsod nams de'i rgyus mang du 'phel lam /
translated: Would that son of a good family or daughter of a good family generate a lot of merit on that basis?”

original: brgya byin gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis gsol pa /
translated: Śatakratu replied,

original: bcom ldan 'das mang ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mang ngo //
translated: “A lot, Bhagavat.

original: bde bar gshegs pa mang ngo //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa mang ngo //
translated: A lot, Sugata.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: koo shi ka de bas kyang rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: koo shi ka de bas kyang rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: “Kauśika, a son of a good family or

original: rigs bu mo gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bris shing glegs bam du byas te /
analyzed: rigs bu mo gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bris shing glegs bam du byas te /
translated: a daughter of a good family who writes out this perfection of wisdom and makes it into a book

original: chung ngu na phri ba dang / bklag par bya ba'i phyir gzhan la byin na bsod nams mang du 'phel lo //
analyzed: chung ngu na phri ba dang / bklag par bya ba'i phyir gzhan la byin na bsod nams mang du 'phel lo //
translated: and gives it to others to read and recite will have even more merit.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: koo shi ka de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las skyes pa ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos thams cad dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad do //
analyzed: koo shi ka de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las skyes pa ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos thams cad dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad do //
translated: Kauśika, it is because all the dharmas of śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, bodhisattvas, and all the buddhas arise from the perfection of wisdom.

original: koo shi ka gling chen po bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can rnams dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang / rang byang chub nyid kyi bar las bkod pa lta zhog gi / koo shi ka stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can ji snyed yod pa de dag rigs kyi bu'am /🔽rigs kyi bu mo gang la las dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la rab tu bkod pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang /
analyzed: koo shi ka gling chen po bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can rnams dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang / rang byang chub nyid kyi bar las bkod pa lta zhog gi / koo shi ka stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can ji snyed yod pa de dag rigs kyi bu'am / rigs kyi bu mo gang la las dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la rab tu bkod pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang /
translated: “Kauśika, aside from the arrangement of the beings in the world systems in the great trichiliocosm on the ten wholesome actions, up to and on the Pratyekabuddha’s awakening, Kauśika, whatever son of a good family or daughter of a good family establishes as many beings as there are in the world systems of a chiliocosm on the ten wholesome actions, and on the fruit of entering the stream, the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, arhatship,🔽and on the Pratyekabuddha’s awakening,

original: rang byang chub la rab tu bkod pa bas kyang rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rang byang chub la rab tu bkod pa bas kyang rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: and whatever other son of a good family or daughter of a good family establishes a single being in the utmost, right, and complete enlightenment, the latter would generate incalculably more goodness than the former.

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bris shing glegs bam du byas nas chung du na bri ba dang / bklag pa'i phyir gzhan la byin na bsod nams ches mang du 'phel lo //🔽@97b koo shi ka stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can rnams rang byang chub kyi bar la bkod pa lta zhog gi / koo shi ka stong gnyis pa bar ma'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can ji snyed pa de dag rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bris shing glegs bam du byas nas chung du na bri ba dang / bklag pa'i phyir gzhan la byin na bsod nams ches mang du 'phel lo // @97b koo shi ka stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can rnams rang byang chub kyi bar la bkod pa lta zhog gi / koo shi ka stong gnyis pa bar ma'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can ji snyed pa de dag rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: “Kauśika, if a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family were to write out this perfection of wisdom and make a book of it and then give it to others to write out and to read, their merit would increase much more than that.

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang la las dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang / rang byang chub kyi bar la rab tu bkod na /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang la las dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang / rang byang chub kyi bar la rab tu bkod na /
translated: “Kauśika, let alone beings in a world system of a billion worlds, if a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family were to establish as many beings as there are in a double-thousand small middle world system in the ten wholesome actions, up to and establish them in a pratyekabuddha’s awakening,

original: koo shi ka de ji snyam du sems /🔽rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: koo shi ka de ji snyam du sems / rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: what do you think, Kauśika?

original: rigs kyi bu mo de'i bsod nams de'i rgyus mang du 'phel lam /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de'i bsod nams de'i rgyus mang du 'phel lam /
translated: Would that son of a good family or daughter of a good family on the basis of that root of merit generate a lot of merit?”

original: brgya byin gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis gsol pa /
translated: Śatakratu replied,

original: bcom ldan 'das mang ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mang ngo //
translated: “A lot, Lord.

original: bde bar gshegs pa mang ngo //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa mang ngo //
translated: A lot, Sugata.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: koo shi ka de bas kyang rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: koo shi ka de bas kyang rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: “Kauśika, a son of a good family or

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bris shing glegs bam du byas te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bris shing glegs bam du byas te /
translated: a daughter of a good family who writes out this perfection of wisdom and makes it into a book

original: chung du na bri ba dang / bklag pa'i phyir gzhan la byin na bsod nams ches mang du 'phel lo //🔽koo shi ka stong gnyis pa bar ma'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can rnams rang byang chub kyi bar la bkod pa lta zhog gi / koo shi ka stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can ji snyed pa de dag rigs kyi
analyzed: chung du na bri ba dang / bklag pa'i phyir gzhan la byin na bsod nams ches mang du 'phel lo // koo shi ka stong gnyis pa bar ma'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can rnams rang byang chub kyi bar la bkod pa lta zhog gi / koo shi ka stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can ji snyed pa de dag rigs kyi
translated: and gives it to others, even just for the purpose of writing it out and reading it, would have even more merit.🔽“Kauśika, let alone establishing the sentient beings of a middle-sized universe in a two-thousand-fold world system up to in a pratyekabuddha’s awakening,🔽Kauśika, if a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family were to establish all the sentient beings of a great billion-world universe in the ten wholesome actions and up to in a pratyekabuddha’s awakening,

original: bu'am / rigs kyi bu mo la las dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang / rang byang chub kyi bar la rab tu bkod pa bas kyang rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: bu'am / rigs kyi bu mo la las dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang / rang byang chub kyi bar la rab tu bkod pa bas kyang rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: and if another son of a good family or daughter of a good family were to give a copy of this perfection of wisdom to another, saying, ‘Come here, son of a good family!

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bris shing glegs bam du byas te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bris shing glegs bam du byas te /
translated: “Son of a good family, a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family who writes out this perfection of wisdom and makes it into a book🔽

original: chung du na bri ba dang / bklag pa'i phyir gzhan la byin na bsod nams ches mang du 'phel lo //🔽koo shi ka stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can rnams rang byang chub kyi bar la bkod pa lta zhog gi / koo shi ka phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed rnams na sems can ji snyed🔽yod pa de dag thams cad rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: chung du na bri ba dang / bklag pa'i phyir gzhan la byin na bsod nams ches mang du 'phel lo // koo shi ka stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can rnams rang byang chub kyi bar la bkod pa lta zhog gi / koo shi ka phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed rnams na sems can ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: “Kauśika, if a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family were to write out this perfection of wisdom and make it into a book, and then give it to others to write out and to read, their merit would increase much more than that.🔽“Kauśika, let alone beings in the great billionfold world system, if all the beings in the world systems in the ten directions as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river were to be established in the state of a worthy one, or were to be established in a pratyekabuddha’s awakening, Kauśika, if a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family were to establish all those beings in the ten directions as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river in the ten wholesome actions, and were to establish them in a pratyekabuddha’s awakening,

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang la las dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la rab tu bkod pa dang / rang byang chub kyi bar la rab tu bkod ba bas rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang la las dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la rab tu bkod pa dang / rang byang chub kyi bar la rab tu bkod ba bas rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: and if another son of a good family or a daughter of a good family were to establish a single being in the state of a worthy one,🔽the latter would produce merit that increases much more than the former.

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bris shing glegs bam du byas nas chung du na bri ba dang / bklag pa'i phyir gzhan la byin na /🔽koo shi ka de bas kyang rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bris shing glegs bam du byas nas chung du na bri ba dang / bklag pa'i phyir gzhan la byin na / koo shi ka de bas kyang rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: “Kauśika, a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family who writes out this perfection of wisdom and makes it into a book and gives it to others, even just for the purpose of writing it out and reading it,

original: rigs kyi bu mo 'di'i bsod nams ches mang du 'phel lo //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo 'di'i bsod nams ches mang du 'phel lo //
translated: Kauśika, that son of a good family or daughter of a good family will on that account create a lot more merit.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las zag pa med pa'i chos rnams rgya @98a * //🔽cher bstan te /🔽de dag la bslabs shing rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las zag pa med pa'i chos rnams rgya @98a * // cher bstan te / de dag la bslabs shing rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Because in this perfection of wisdom the dharmas without outflows are taught extensively,

original: rigs kyi bu mo de dag yang dag pa'i skyon med par zhugs par gyur to //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de dag yang dag pa'i skyon med par zhugs par gyur to //
translated: and having trained in them, those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family have entered into the secure state,

original: 'jug go 'jug par 'gyur ro //🔽dgra bcom pa nyid kyi bar du thob par gyur to //
analyzed: 'jug go 'jug par 'gyur ro // dgra bcom pa nyid kyi bar du thob par gyur to //
translated: are entering, and will enter;

original: 'thob po // 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'thob po // 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: have attained, are attaining, and will attain the state of a worthy one;

original: rang byang chub thob par gyur to //
analyzed: rang byang chub thob par gyur to //
translated: have attained, are attaining, and will attain individual enlightenment;

original: 'thob po // 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'thob po // 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: and have attained, are attaining, and will attain

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyang byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par zhugs par gyur to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyang byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par zhugs par gyur to //
translated: and the bodhisattva mahāsattvas have entered into the secure state of a bodhisattva.

original: 'jug go 'jug par 'gyur ro //🔽bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //🔽mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: 'jug go 'jug par 'gyur ro // bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so // mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: have entered, will enter,

original: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: have attained, are attaining, will attain supreme, perfect enlightenment.

original: koo shi ka zag pa med pa'i chos de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: koo shi ka zag pa med pa'i chos de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: “Kauśika, what are those uncontaminated dharmas?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang /
translated: the perfections, the powers of the tathāgatas, the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, the emptiness of internal phenomena, the emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena,

original: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang /
analyzed: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang /
translated: the emptiness of emptiness, up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature, the immeasurable, the formless absorptions,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos gzhal du med pa'i bar dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las rgya cher bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos gzhal du med pa'i bar dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las rgya cher bstan to //
translated: the ten powers of the tathāgatas, up to the immeasurable buddhadharmas have been extensively taught by the tathāgatas, the arhats, the perfectly awakened ones in the perfection of wisdom.

original: koo shi ka rnam grangs des kyang rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: koo shi ka rnam grangs des kyang rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: “Kauśika, because of this one of many explanations, a son of a good family or

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bris shing glegs bam du byas te bri ba dang / bklag pa'i phyir gzhan la byin na de bas de'i bsod nams mang du 'phel par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bris shing glegs bam du byas te bri ba dang / bklag pa'i phyir gzhan la byin na de bas de'i bsod nams mang du 'phel par shes par bya'o //
translated: “Kauśika, a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family who writes out this perfection of wisdom and makes it into a book and gives it to others to write out and to read, should know that their goodness grows much more than that.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: koo shi ka de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las chos thams cad rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: koo shi ka de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las chos thams cad rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: Kauśika, it is because all dharmas are taught extensively in this perfection of wisdom.

original: de dag yod bas rgyal rigs s'a la chen po dang / bram ze'i rigs s'a la chen po dang / khyim bdag gi rigs s'a la chen po rnams yod do //
analyzed: de dag yod bas rgyal rigs s'a la chen po dang / bram ze'i rigs s'a la chen po dang / khyim bdag gi rigs s'a la chen po rnams yod do //
translated: Because of their existence, there are great sāla tree–like royal families, great sāla tree–like brahmin families, and great sāla tree–like business families.

original: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams yod do //
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams yod do //

analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar gyi lha rnams yod do //

original: @98b pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yod do //
analyzed: @98b pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yod do //

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yod do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yod do //
translated: There are thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yod do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yod do //
translated: up to the knowledge of all modes exists.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu rnams yod do //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu rnams yod do //
translated: The fruit of entering the stream exists,🔽the fruit of the once-returner, the fruit of the non-returner,

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas yod do ;
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas yod do ;
translated: the fruit of the saint, the pratyekabuddha,

original: / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams yod do //🔽koo shi ka gzhan yang 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can ji snyed pa de dag rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams yod do // koo shi ka gzhan yang 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can ji snyed pa de dag rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: and the Tathagata, Arhat, perfectly accomplished Buddha exists.

original: rigs kyi bu mo la la zhig gis bsam gtan bzhi la bkod /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo la la zhig gis bsam gtan bzhi la bkod /
translated: Moreover, Kausika, if some son or daughter of good family were to establish all the beings in Jambudvipa in the four trances,

original: tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa lnga la bkod na /
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa lnga la bkod na /
translated: in the four Unlimited, in the four formless attainments, and in the five superknowledges,

original: koo shi ka de ji snyam du sems /🔽rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: koo shi ka de ji snyam du sems / rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: what do you think, Kausika,

original: rigs kyi bu mo de'i bsod nams de'i rgyus mang du 'phel lam /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de'i bsod nams de'i rgyus mang du 'phel lam /
translated: would that son or daughter of good family on the strength of that beget much merit?

original: brgya byin gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis gsol pa /
translated: Sakra: Incalculably,🔽Subhuti: much, Kausika,

original: bcom ldan 'das mang ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mang ngo //
translated: much.

original: bde bar gshegs pa mang ngo ;
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa mang ngo ;
translated: “Sugata, there are many.”

original: / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽koo shi ka de bas kyang rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / koo shi ka de bas kyang rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: The Bhagavān said,

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bris shing glegs bam du chud par byas te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bris shing glegs bam du chud par byas te /
translated: “Kauśika, a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family who writes out this perfection of wisdom and makes it into a book and

original: chung du na bri ba dang / bklag pa'i phyir gzhan la byin na bsod nams ches mang du 'phel lo //
analyzed: chung du na bri ba dang / bklag pa'i phyir gzhan la byin na bsod nams ches mang du 'phel lo //
translated: gives it to others, even if it is just for the purpose of writing it out and reading it, will have a lot more merit than that.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las zag pa med pa'i chos rnams rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las zag pa med pa'i chos rnams rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because the uncontaminated dharmas are taught extensively in this perfection of wisdom.

original: koo shi ka gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: koo shi ka gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: “Furthermore, Kauśika, a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang la las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dzin par 'gyur ba dang / 'chang bar 'gyur ba dang / klog par 'gyur ba dang / kun chub par byed par 'gyur ba dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed par 'gyur ba ni rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang la las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dzin par 'gyur ba dang / 'chang bar 'gyur ba dang / klog par 'gyur ba dang / kun chub par byed par 'gyur ba dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed par 'gyur ba ni rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: “Ānanda, any sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage who hold this perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind, read it aloud, master it, and properly pay attention to it will have these benefits.

original: rigs kyi bu mo de'i bsod nams ches mang du 'phel bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de'i bsod nams ches mang du 'phel bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: “Son of a good family or daughter of a good family who takes up this perfection of wisdom, bears it in mind, reads it aloud, masters it, and properly pays attention to it will increase much more in merit

original: 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can rnams dang / gling bzhi pa rnams dang / stong gnyis pa bar ma'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa dang /
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can rnams dang / gling bzhi pa rnams dang / stong gnyis pa bar ma'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa dang /
translated: than those who establish the sentient beings of Jambudvīpa, the sentient beings of the four continents, and the sentient beings of all the worlds in a billion-world universe in the ten wholesome actions, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless states,

original: mngon par shes pa rnams la bkod pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams la bkod pas ni ma yin no //
translated: and the superknowledges.

original: de la tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa ni 'di yin te /

original: gnyis la spyod pa ma yin pa'i blos shes rab kyi pha rol tu @99a * //
analyzed: gnyis la spyod pa ma yin pa'i blos shes rab kyi pha rol tu @99a * //

original: tu phyin pa 'di 'dzin par 'gyur /🔽'chang bar 'gyur /🔽klog par 'gyur /
analyzed: tu phyin pa 'di 'dzin par 'gyur / 'chang bar 'gyur / klog par 'gyur /
translated: They will take up this perfection of wisdom,🔽they will bear it in mind,🔽they will study it,

original: kun chub par byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: kun chub par byed par 'gyur /
translated: they will master it,

original: tshul bzhin du yid la byed par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin du yid la byed par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: and they will properly pay attention to it.🔽With a mind that does not engage in duality they will take up the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality,

original: gnyis la spyod pa ma yin pa'i blos bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / gnyis la spyod pa ma yin pa'i blos sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'dzin par 'gyur /🔽'chang bar 'gyur /🔽klog par 'gyur /
analyzed: gnyis la spyod pa ma yin pa'i blos bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / gnyis la spyod pa ma yin pa'i blos sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'dzin par 'gyur / 'chang bar 'gyur / klog par 'gyur /
translated: and with a mind that does not engage in duality they will take up the perfection of generosity,🔽they will bear it in mind,🔽they will study it,

original: kun chub par byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: kun chub par byed par 'gyur /
translated: they will master it,

original: tshul bzhin du yid la byed par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin du yid la byed par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: and they will properly pay attention to it.

original: gnyis la spyod pa ma yin pa'i blos nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du tshul bzhin du yid la byed par 'gyur ba'o /🔽// / bam po sum cu bzhi pa /
analyzed: gnyis la spyod pa ma yin pa'i blos nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du tshul bzhin du yid la byed par 'gyur ba'o / // / bam po sum cu bzhi pa /
translated: “With a mind that does not engage with duality, they will properly pay attention to inner emptiness, outer emptiness, inner and outer emptiness, up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: gnyis la spyod pa ma yin pa'i blos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam rnams tshul bzhin du yid la byed par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis la spyod pa ma yin pa'i blos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam rnams tshul bzhin du yid la byed par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “With a mind that does not engage with duality, they will properly pay attention to the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of awakening, and the path.

original: gnyis la spyod pa ma yin pa'i blos sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid tshul bzhin du yid la byed par 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba ni bkur pa tsam bzhi pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis la spyod pa ma yin pa'i blos sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid tshul bzhin du yid la byed par 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba ni bkur pa tsam bzhi pa yin no //
translated: “With a mind that does not engage with duality, they will properly pay attention to the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha and to omniscience.” This is the fourth kind of homage.

original: koo shi ka gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: koo shi ka gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: “Moreover, Kauśika, a son of a good family or🔽

original: rigs kyi bu mo la la zhig gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don gzhan la rnam grangs du mas rgya cher ston par byed /🔽'chad par byed /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo la la zhig gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don gzhan la rnam grangs du mas rgya cher ston par byed / 'chad par byed /
translated: “Furthermore, Kauśika, if a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family were to teach the meaning of the perfection of wisdom to others in many ways in detail,🔽were to explain it,

original: rnam par 'byed /
analyzed: rnam par 'byed /
translated: were to analyze it,

original: gsal bar byed na /
analyzed: gsal bar byed na /
translated: were to make it clear,

original: de la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don 'di yin te /
translated: then the meaning of the perfection of wisdom is this:

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gnyis su med par mthong gi gnyis su ni ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gnyis su med par mthong gi gnyis su ni ma yin pa ste /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is seen as nondual, not as dual;

original: mtshan mar ma yin /
analyzed: mtshan mar ma yin /
translated: not as a sign,

original: mtshan ma med par ma yin /
analyzed: mtshan ma med par ma yin /
translated: not as signless;

original: 'ong bar ma yin /🔽'gro bar ma yin /
analyzed: 'ong bar ma yin / 'gro bar ma yin /
translated: not as coming,🔽not as going;

original: dbri bar ma yin /
analyzed: dbri bar ma yin /
translated: not as subtracted,

original: bsnan par ma yin /
analyzed: bsnan par ma yin /
translated: not as added;

original: kun nas nyon mongs par ma yin /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs par ma yin /
translated: not as afflicted,

original: rnam par byang bar ma yin /
analyzed: rnam par byang bar ma yin /
translated: not as purified;

original: skye bar ma yin /
analyzed: skye bar ma yin /
translated: not as produced,

original: 'gag par ma yin /
analyzed: 'gag par ma yin /
translated: not as stopped;

original: len par ma yin /🔽dor bar ma yin /🔽gnas par ma yin /
analyzed: len par ma yin / dor bar ma yin / gnas par ma yin /
translated: not as taken up,🔽not as put down;🔽not as abiding,

original: mi gnas par ma yin /🔽yang dag par ma yin /
analyzed: mi gnas par ma yin / yang dag par ma yin /
translated: not as not abiding;🔽not as real,

original: yang dag pa ma yin par ma yin /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin par ma yin /
translated: not as unreal;

original: ldan par ma yin /
analyzed: ldan par ma yin /
translated: not as endowed,

original: mi ldan par ma @99b yin ;🔽bag tsam ma yin /
analyzed: mi ldan par ma @99b yin ; bag tsam ma yin /
translated: not as not endowed,🔽not as a mere trifle,

original: bag tsam ma yin par ma yin /🔽cha so so bar ma yin /
analyzed: bag tsam ma yin par ma yin / cha so so bar ma yin /
translated: not as not a mere trifle,🔽not as individual parts,

original: cha so so ba ma yin par ma yin /🔽chos nyid ma yin /
analyzed: cha so so ba ma yin par ma yin / chos nyid ma yin /
translated: not as not individual parts,🔽not as the intrinsic nature,

original: chos nyid ma yin par ma yin /🔽de bzhin nyid ma yin /
analyzed: chos nyid ma yin par ma yin / de bzhin nyid ma yin /
translated: not as not the intrinsic nature,🔽not as suchness,

original: de bzhin nyid ma yin par ma yin /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ma yin par ma yin /
translated: not as not suchness,

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' ma yin /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' ma yin /
translated: not as the very limit of reality,

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' ma yin par ma yin te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' ma yin par ma yin te /
translated: not as not the very limit of reality.

original: rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Son of a good family or

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di'i don gzhan la rgya cher ston par byed /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di'i don gzhan la rgya cher ston par byed /
translated: daughter of a good family who teaches the meaning of this perfection of wisdom extensively to others,🔽explains it,🔽divulges it,

original: 'chad pa dang / rnam par 'byed pa dang / gsal bar byed na 'di nyid bsod nams mang du 'phel gyi /🔽bdag 'ba' zhig 'dzin par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'chad pa dang / rnam par 'byed pa dang / gsal bar byed na 'di nyid bsod nams mang du 'phel gyi / bdag 'ba' zhig 'dzin par 'gyur /
translated: and elucidates it, will increase in merit much more than that.🔽I alone will take it up,

original: 'chang bar 'gyur /🔽klog par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'chang bar 'gyur / klog par 'gyur /
translated: I alone will bear it in mind,🔽I alone will read it aloud,

original: kun chub par byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: kun chub par byed par 'gyur /
translated: I alone will master it,

original: tshul bzhin du yid la byed par 'gyur bas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bkur ba tsam lnga pa yin no //🔽koo shi ka gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: tshul bzhin du yid la byed par 'gyur bas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bkur ba tsam lnga pa yin no // koo shi ka gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: But not by proper mental attention. This is the fifth praise.

original: rigs kyi bu mo la la zhig bdag nyid kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dzin par 'gyur /🔽'chang bar 'gyur /🔽klog par 'gyur /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo la la zhig bdag nyid kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dzin par 'gyur / 'chang bar 'gyur / klog par 'gyur /
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, if a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family, having taken up this perfection of wisdom,🔽having borne it in mind,🔽having recited it,

original: kun chub par byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: kun chub par byed par 'gyur /
translated: having mastered it,

original: tshul bzhin du yid la byed par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: tshul bzhin du yid la byed par 'gyur zhing /
translated: having properly paid attention to it,

original: gzhan la yang rgya cher ston par byed /🔽'chad par byed /
analyzed: gzhan la yang rgya cher ston par byed / 'chad par byed /
translated: were to teach it extensively to others,🔽were to explain it,

original: rnam par 'byed par byed /
analyzed: rnam par 'byed par byed /
translated: were to analyze it,

original: gsal bar byed na 'di nyid de bas bsod nams shin tu mang du 'phel lo //
analyzed: gsal bar byed na 'di nyid de bas bsod nams shin tu mang du 'phel lo //
translated: were to make it clear, then this one would have an increase in merit that is much greater than that.

original: brgya byin gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis gsol pa /
translated: Śatakratu said,

original: bcom ldan 'das de de ltar lags so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de de ltar lags so //
translated: Blessed One, that is so!

original: bde bar gshegs pa de de ltar lags so //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa de de ltar lags so //
translated: Well-Gone, that is so!

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: koo shi ka rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: koo shi ka rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Kauśika, a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family

original: rigs kyi bu mos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de ltar don dang ldan la yi ge dang ldan par bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de ltar don dang ldan la yi ge dang ldan par bstan par bya ste /
translated: “Noble sons and daughters should teach the perfection of wisdom in that way, with its meaning and with its letters.

original: koo shi ka de ltar ston pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: koo shi ka de ltar ston pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Kauśika, the noble sons and daughters who teach in that way

original: rigs kyi bu mo de ni bsod nams kyi phung po tshad med grangs med /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de ni bsod nams kyi phung po tshad med grangs med /
translated: will have immeasurable, incalculable, and immeasurable heaps of merit.”

original: gzhal du med pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bkur ba tsam drug pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhal du med pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bkur ba tsam drug pa yin no //
translated: This is the sixth mere homage.

original: koo shi ka gal te rigs kyi bu'am ;
analyzed: koo shi ka gal te rigs kyi bu'am ;
translated: “Kauśika, if noble sons or noble daughters

original: rigs kyi bu mo phyogs bcu'i phyogs re re zhing 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med pa rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas tshad med grangs med /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo phyogs bcu'i phyogs re re zhing 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med pa rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas tshad med grangs med /
translated: were to make offerings to the immeasurable, incalculable, immeasurable tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas in each of the ten directions,

original: gzhal du med pa dag la nam 'cho'i bar du me tog dang / spos dang / dri dang / phreng ba dang / @100a * //
analyzed: gzhal du med pa dag la nam 'cho'i bar du me tog dang / spos dang / dri dang / phreng ba dang / @100a * //
translated: with flowers, incense, perfumes, garlands,

original: byug pa dang / phye ma dang / na bza' dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan rnams dang / bde ba'i yo byad rnams kyis rim gror bya ba dang / bla mar bya ba dang / bsti stang du bya ba dang /
analyzed: byug pa dang / phye ma dang / na bza' dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan rnams dang / bde ba'i yo byad rnams kyis rim gror bya ba dang / bla mar bya ba dang / bsti stang du bya ba dang /
translated: and with ointments, powders, clothes, parasols, victory banners, and flags, and with all the requisites for happiness,

original: mchod par byas pa bas koo shi ka rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: mchod par byas pa bas koo shi ka rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: then, Kauśika, a son of a good family or

original: rigs kyi bu mo la la zhig gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gzhan la rgya cher don dang ldan /🔽yi ge dang ldan par rnam grangs du mar go bar byas /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo la la zhig gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gzhan la rgya cher don dang ldan / yi ge dang ldan par rnam grangs du mar go bar byas /
translated: a daughter of a good family who, in addition, teaches this perfection of wisdom to others in detail,🔽explains it,

original: yang dag par rab tu gsal bar byas /
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu gsal bar byas /
translated: makes it clear,

original: rnam par bsgoms par byas /
analyzed: rnam par bsgoms par byas /
translated: makes it intelligible,🔽makes it evident,

original: rnam par grol bar byas yang dag par bstan par byas na /
analyzed: rnam par grol bar byas yang dag par bstan par byas na /
translated: and demonstrates it,

original: rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: that son of a good family or

original: rigs kyi bu mo 'di nyid kyi bsod nams ches mang du 'phel lo //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo 'di nyid kyi bsod nams ches mang du 'phel lo //
translated: that daughter of a good family will create a lot more merit.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la bslabs te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la bslabs te /
translated: It is because having trained in this perfection of wisdom,

original: 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas of the past,🔽the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas of the future,

original: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: and the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas of the present have fully awakened, will fully awaken, and are fully awakening to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bkur ba tsam bdun pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bkur ba tsam bdun pa yin no //
translated: This is the seventh praise.

original: koo shi ka gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: koo shi ka gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: “Furthermore, Kauśika, some son of a good family

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang la las bskal pa grangs med gzhal du med par sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang la las bskal pa grangs med gzhal du med par sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: or some daughter of a good family, for countless, immeasurable eons, would practice the perfection of giving, the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance,

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis spyod pa bas /🔽mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gzhan la rgya cher yang dag par rab tu gsal bar byed /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis spyod pa bas / mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gzhan la rgya cher yang dag par rab tu gsal bar byed /
translated: who practice the perfection of meditative stabilization and the perfection of wisdom,

original: rjod par byed /
analyzed: rjod par byed /
translated: if they were to teach others extensively, in detail, and perfectly, without apprehending anything,🔽and if they were to describe, demonstrate, and make them understood,

original: mtshon par byed na de'i bsod nams ches mang du 'phel lo //
analyzed: mtshon par byed na de'i bsod nams ches mang du 'phel lo //
translated: then the merit of those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family would be much greater.

original: koo shi ka de la dmigs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: koo shi ka de la dmigs pa gang zhe na /
translated: “Kauśika, what is that?

original: byang chub sems dpa' dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa gtong zhing 'di snyam du sbyin pa gtong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa gtong zhing 'di snyam du sbyin pa gtong ngo //
translated: When bodhisattvas give gifts while apprehending something, thinking, ‘I am giving a gift,’

original: sbyin pa ni 'di gtong ngo ;
analyzed: sbyin pa ni 'di gtong ngo ;
translated: ‘This is the gift I am giving,’🔽‘I am giving this to this person,’

original: /'di la sbyin par bya'o snyam na des sbyin pa de ltar btang bas sbyin pa nyid du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: /'di la sbyin par bya'o snyam na des sbyin pa de ltar btang bas sbyin pa nyid du 'gyur gyi /
translated: then, by giving that gift, they have given a gift, but

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: it is not the perfection of giving.

original: 'di ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: 'di ni tshul khrims so //
translated: ‘This is morality,’

original: bdag ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa'o //
translated: ‘I am moral,’

original: sems can 'di rnams la bsrung bar bya'o snyam na /
analyzed: sems can 'di rnams la bsrung bar bya'o snyam na /
translated: ‘I will protect these sentient beings,’

original: 'di ni tshul khrims nyid du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'di ni tshul khrims nyid du 'gyur gyi /
translated: This is the morality itself.

original: tshul @100b khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tshul @100b khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: This is morality, but it is not the perfection of morality.

original: bdag ni bzod pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni bzod pa sgom pa'o //
translated: “I am cultivating patience.”

original: bzod pa ni 'di'o //🔽pha rol la bzod par bya'o snyam na 'di ni bzod pa nyid du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: bzod pa ni 'di'o // pha rol la bzod par bya'o snyam na 'di ni bzod pa nyid du 'gyur gyi /
translated: “This is patience.”🔽“I should be patient with others.”

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: This is patience, but it is not the perfection of patience.

original: bdag ni brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
analyzed: bdag ni brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
translated: “I am making an effort.”

original: 'di ni brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: 'di ni brtson 'grus so //
translated: “This is effort.”

original: 'di rnams kyi don du'o snyam na /🔽'di ni brtson 'grus nyid du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi don du'o snyam na / 'di ni brtson 'grus nyid du 'gyur gyi /
translated: “It is for their sake.”

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: This is effort, but it is not the perfection of effort.

original: bdag ni bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: bdag ni bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: “I am absorbed in meditation.”

original: bsam gtan 'di'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan 'di'o //
translated: “This is meditation.”

original: 'di la ni mnyam par gzhag go snyam na /🔽'di ni bsam gtan nyid du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'di la ni mnyam par gzhag go snyam na / 'di ni bsam gtan nyid du 'gyur gyi /
translated: “I am concentrated on this.”

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: This is meditation, but it is not the perfection of meditation.

original: bdag ni shes rab sgom mo //
analyzed: bdag ni shes rab sgom mo //
translated: “I am cultivating wisdom.”

original: shes rab ni 'di'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni 'di'o //
translated: “This is wisdom.”

original: 'di rnams kyi don du'o snyam na shes rab nyid du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi don du'o snyam na shes rab nyid du 'gyur gyi /
translated: If he thinks, “I will attain the perfection of wisdom for the sake of these,” then wisdom itself will be his.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ma yin no //🔽koo shi ka rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ma yin no // koo shi ka rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: But it will not be the perfection of wisdom.

original: rigs kyi bu mo de ltar dmigs pa la spyod pas ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de ltar dmigs pa la spyod pas ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Kauśika, a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family who practices with an object in this way will not complete the perfection of giving.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not complete the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, or the perfection of wisdom.

original: brgya byin gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis gsol pa /
translated: Śakra, Lord of the Gods, then said to Subhūti,

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar spyod na sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar spyod na sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur /
translated: “Subhūti, how should a bodhisattva great being practice to complete the perfection of giving?

original: ji ltar tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur /🔽ji ltar bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur / ji ltar bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur /
translated: How will the perfection of morality be fulfilled?🔽How will the perfection of patience be fulfilled?

original: ji ltar brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur /
translated: How will the perfection of perseverance be fulfilled?

original: ji ltar bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur /
translated: How will the perfection of concentration be fulfilled?

original: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur /
translated: How will the perfection of wisdom be fulfilled?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said:

original: koo shi ka 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa gtong pa'i tshe /🔽yongs su gtong ba mi dmigs /
analyzed: koo shi ka 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa gtong pa'i tshe / yongs su gtong ba mi dmigs /
translated: Here, Kauśika, when a bodhisattva-mahāsattva practices generosity,🔽he does not apprehend the one who gives,

original: sbyin pa mi dmigs /
analyzed: sbyin pa mi dmigs /
translated: he does not apprehend the gift,

original: len pa mi dmigs pa 'di ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes brjod do //🔽tshul khrims mi dmigs /
analyzed: len pa mi dmigs pa 'di ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes brjod do // tshul khrims mi dmigs /
translated: he does not apprehend the recipient. This is called the perfection of generosity.🔽He does not apprehend morality,

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa mi dmigs /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa mi dmigs /
translated: he does not apprehend one who possesses morality,

original: sems can mi dmigs pa 'di ni tshul khrims kyi pha @101a * //
analyzed: sems can mi dmigs pa 'di ni tshul khrims kyi pha @101a * //
translated: This nonapprehension of sentient beings is the morality.🔽

original: rol tu phyin pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: rol tu phyin pa zhes brjod do //
translated: This non-apprehension of sentient beings is called the perfection of morality.

original: bzod pa mi dmigs /
analyzed: bzod pa mi dmigs /
translated: This non-apprehension of patience,

original: bzod par bya ba mi dmigs /
analyzed: bzod par bya ba mi dmigs /
translated: non-apprehension of what is to be patiently accepted,

original: bzod pa po mi dmigs pa 'di ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: bzod pa po mi dmigs pa 'di ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes brjod do //
translated: and non-apprehension of the patient one is called the perfection of patience.

original: brtson 'grus mi dmigs /
analyzed: brtson 'grus mi dmigs /
translated: This non-apprehension of effort,

original: brtson par bya ba mi dmigs /
analyzed: brtson par bya ba mi dmigs /
translated: non-apprehension of what is to be striven for,🔽and non-apprehension of body and mind is called the perfection of effort.

original: lus dang sems mi dmigs pa 'di ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes brjod do //🔽bsam gtan mi dmigs /
analyzed: lus dang sems mi dmigs pa 'di ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes brjod do // bsam gtan mi dmigs /
translated: This non-apprehension of concentration,

original: bsam gtan bsgom pa mi dmigs /
analyzed: bsam gtan bsgom pa mi dmigs /
translated: non-apprehension of the cultivation of concentration,

original: bsgom par bya ba mi dmigs pa 'di ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: bsgom par bya ba mi dmigs pa 'di ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes brjod do //
translated: and non-apprehension of what is to be cultivated is called the perfection of concentration.

original: shes rab mi dmigs /
analyzed: shes rab mi dmigs /
translated: This non-apprehension of wisdom,

original: shes rab dang ldan pa mi dmigs /
analyzed: shes rab dang ldan pa mi dmigs /
translated: non-apprehension of one who possesses wisdom,

original: sems can mi dmigs pa 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: sems can mi dmigs pa 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes brjod do //
translated: and non-apprehension of sentient beings is called the perfection of wisdom.

original: koo shi ka de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: koo shi ka de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Kauśika, a bodhisattva great being who practices like that will complete the perfection of generosity.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //🔽bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro // bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will complete the perfection of morality.🔽They will complete the perfection of patience.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will complete the perfection of perseverance.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will complete the perfection of concentration.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will complete the perfection of wisdom.

original: koo shi ka rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: koo shi ka rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Kauśika, a son of a good family or

original: rigs kyi bu mo de ltar mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di don dang ldan yi ge dang ldan par bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de ltar mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di don dang ldan yi ge dang ldan par bstan par bya'o //
translated: a daughter of a good family should teach this perfection of wisdom with its meaning and with its letters in that way, without apprehending anything.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'di don dang ldan yi ge dang ldan par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'di don dang ldan yi ge dang ldan par brjod par bya'o //
translated: “Similarly, Kauśika, you should teach this perfection of meditative stabilization, this perfection of perseverance, this perfection of patience, this perfection of morality, and this perfection of giving with their meaning and with their letters.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽koo shi ka ma 'ongs pa'i dus na rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / koo shi ka ma 'ongs pa'i dus na rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Why is that?

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang la las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ston pa 'byung ba'i phyir te /🔽der rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang la las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ston pa 'byung ba'i phyir te / der rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Kauśika, it is because in the future there will be sons of a good family or daughters of a good family who will teach a counterfeit perfection of wisdom.

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu zhugs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan de thos nas chud zos par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu zhugs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan de thos nas chud zos par 'gyur te /
translated: There, Kauśika, sons of a good family or daughters of a good family who have set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening will hear that counterfeit perfection of wisdom and will waste away.

original: de dag la yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di don dang ldan yi ge dang ldan par bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag la yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di don dang ldan yi ge dang ldan par bstan par bya'o //
translated: For them, too, this perfection of wisdom should be taught, both in its meaning and in its letter.

original: brgya byin gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis gsol pa /
translated: Śatakratu then said:

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi @101b pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan de gang lags /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽koo shi ka 'di la rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi @101b pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan de gang lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / koo shi ka 'di la rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: “What, O Lord, is a counterfeit of the perfection of wisdom?

original: rigs kyi bu mo dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bstan to snyam zhing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ston par byed do //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bstan to snyam zhing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ston par byed do //
translated: The Lord: Here, Kauśika, sons and daughters of good family, thinking that this is the perfection of wisdom, teach a counterfeit of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de la 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan te /
analyzed: de la 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan te /
translated: And this is a counterfeit of the perfection of wisdom:

original: gzugs ni mi rtag go zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: gzugs ni mi rtag go zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur /
translated: “Form is impermanent.”

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa mi rtag go zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur zhing gang de ltar spyod pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do zhes rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa mi rtag go zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur zhing gang de ltar spyod pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do zhes rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: They will teach that form, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are impermanent.

original: rigs kyi bu mo rnams la ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo rnams la ston par 'gyur te /
translated: They will teach to sons of a good family and daughters of a good family:🔽‘Those who practice like this practice the perfection of wisdom.’

original: de dag kyang gzugs mi rtag ces bya bar ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang gzugs mi rtag ces bya bar ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will teach that form is impermanent.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa mi rtag go zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa mi rtag go zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Similarly, they will teach that feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are impermanent.

original: de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will teach a counterfeit of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de dag mig mi rtag go zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag mig mi rtag go zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur /
translated: They will teach that the eyes are impermanent.

original: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid mi rtag go zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid mi rtag go zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur /
translated: Similarly, they will teach that the ears, nose, tongue, body, and thinking mind are impermanent.

original: gzugs mi rtag go zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: gzugs mi rtag go zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur /
translated: He would teach that form is impermanent.

original: de bzhin du sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos mi rtag go zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos mi rtag go zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur /
translated: He would teach that sound, smell, taste, texture, and mental objects are impermanent.

original: sa'i khams mi rtag go zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: sa'i khams mi rtag go zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur /
translated: He would teach that the earth element is impermanent.

original: de bzhin du chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams mi rtag go zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur /
