analyzed: de bzhin du chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams mi rtag go zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur /
translated: He would teach that the water element, the fire element, the wind element, the space element, and the consciousness element are impermanent.

original: mig gi khams mi rtag go zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: mig gi khams mi rtag go zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur /
translated: He would teach that the eye constituent is impermanent.

original: rna ba'i khams dang / sna'i khams dang / lce'i khams dang / lus kyi khams dang / yid kyi khams mi rtag go zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: rna ba'i khams dang / sna'i khams dang / lce'i khams dang / lus kyi khams dang / yid kyi khams mi rtag go zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur /
translated: He would teach that the ear constituent, the nose constituent, the tongue constituent, the body constituent, and the thinking-mind constituent are impermanent.

original: gzugs kyi khams mi rtag ces bya bar ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams mi rtag ces bya bar ston par 'gyur /
translated: He would teach that the form constituent is impermanent.

original: sgra'i khams dang / dri'i khams dang / ro'i khams dang / reg gi khams dang / chos kyi khams mi rtag ces bya bar ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: sgra'i khams dang / dri'i khams dang / ro'i khams dang / reg gi khams dang / chos kyi khams mi rtag ces bya bar ston par 'gyur /
translated: the element of sound, the element of smell, the element of taste, the element of touch, and the element of mental objects.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams mi rtag ces bya bar ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams mi rtag ces bya bar ston par 'gyur /
translated: He will teach that the element of visual consciousness is impermanent.

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams mi rtag @102a * //🔽ces bya bar ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams mi rtag @102a * // ces bya bar ston par 'gyur /
translated: He will teach that the element of auditory consciousness, the element of olfactory consciousness, the element of gustatory consciousness, the element of tactile consciousness, and the element of mental consciousness are impermanent.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i khams mi rtag ces bya bar ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i khams mi rtag ces bya bar ston par 'gyur /
translated: He will teach that the element of visual contact is impermanent.

original: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i khams dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa'i khams dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa'i khams dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i khams dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i khams mi rtag ces bya bar ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i khams dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa'i khams dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa'i khams dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i khams dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i khams mi rtag ces bya bar ston par 'gyur /
translated: the element of the composite of ear-contact, the element of the composite of nose-contact, the element of the composite of tongue-contact, the element of the composite of body-contact, and the element of the composite of mind-contact are impermanent.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba mi rtag ces bya bar ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba mi rtag ces bya bar ston par 'gyur /
translated: They will teach that feeling conditioned by the composite of eye-contact is impermanent.

original: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba mi rtag ces bya bar ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba mi rtag ces bya bar ston par 'gyur /
translated: Similarly, they will teach that feeling conditioned by the composite of ear-, nose-, tongue-, body-, and mind-contact is impermanent.

original: gzugs sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi sdug go zhes bya bar chos ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: gzugs sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi sdug go zhes bya bar chos ston par 'gyur /
translated: They will teach the doctrine that forms are suffering, that they are without self, and that they are impure.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa'o zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa'o zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur /
translated: They will teach that feelings, perceptions, formative predispositions, and consciousness are suffering, that they are without self, and that they are impure.

original: sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa'o zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa'o zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur /
translated: the earth element, the water element, the fire element, the wind element, the space element, and the consciousness element are suffering, are without self, and are impure.

original: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa'o zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa'o zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur /
translated: They will teach that form, sound, smell, taste, texture, and mental objects are suffering, are without self, and are impure.

original: mig sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa'o zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: mig sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa'o zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur /
translated: They will teach that the eyes are suffering, are without self, and are impure.

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa'o zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa'o zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur /
translated: They will teach that the ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind are suffering, are without self, and are impure.

original: gzugs kyi khams dang / sgra'i khams dang / dri'i khams dang / ro'i khams dang / reg gi khams dang / chos kyi khams sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa'o zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams dang / sgra'i khams dang / dri'i khams dang / ro'i khams dang / reg gi khams dang / chos kyi khams sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa'o zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur /
translated: the element of form, the element of sound, the element of smell, the element of taste, the element of touch, and the element of mental objects are suffering, are without a self, and are impure.

original: mig gi khams sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa'o zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: mig gi khams sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa'o zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur /
translated: He will reveal that the element of the eyes, the element of sights, and the element of visual consciousness are suffering, are without a self, and are impure.

original: rna ba'i khams dang / sna'i khams dang / lce'i khams dang / lus kyi khams dang / yid kyi khams sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa'o zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: rna ba'i khams dang / sna'i khams dang / lce'i khams dang / lus kyi khams dang / yid kyi khams sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa'o zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur /
translated: He will reveal that the element of the ears, the element of sounds, and the element of auditory consciousness; the element of the nose, the element of smells, and the element of olfactory consciousness; the element of the tongue, the element of tastes, and the element of gustatory consciousness; the element of the body, the element of tangibles, and the element of tactile consciousness; and the element of the mind, the element of mental phenomena, and the element of mental consciousness are suffering, are without a self, and are impure.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa'o zhes bya bar @102b ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa'o zhes bya bar @102b ston par 'gyur /
translated: He will reveal that the element of visual consciousness is suffering, is without a self, and is impure.

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang /
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang /
translated: the ear-consciousness element, the nose-consciousness element, the tongue-consciousness element, the body-consciousness element, and the thinking-mind-consciousness element are suffering, selfless,

original: mi sdug pa'o zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: mi sdug pa'o zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur /
translated: and unpleasant.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa dang / mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa'o zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa dang / mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa'o zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur /
translated: They will teach that eye contact and the feeling that arises from the condition of eye contact are suffering, selfless,🔽and unpleasant.

original: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba sdug bsngal ba dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba sdug bsngal ba dang /
translated: Similarly, they will teach that ear, nose, tongue, body, and thinking-mind contact, and the feeling that arises from the condition of ear, nose, tongue, body, and thinking-mind contact are suffering,

original: bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa'o zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa'o zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur te /
translated: selfless, and unpleasant.

original: de ltar de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way they will teach a counterfeit of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan dang /
translated: Similarly they will teach a counterfeit of the perfection of concentration, of the perfection of perseverance, of the perfection of patience, of the perfection of morality,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: and of the perfection of giving.

original: de ltar gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa'o zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: de ltar gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa'o zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur /
translated: In this way they will teach that form, feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness are impermanent, painful, without self, and foul.

original: mig dang / gzugs dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar du mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa'o zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur /🔽de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar du mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa'o zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: mig dang / gzugs dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar du mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa'o zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur / de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar du mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa'o zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur /
translated: and the eye, form, and eye-consciousness elements are impermanent, painful, empty, and not-self.🔽Similarly, he will teach that the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind-consciousness elements are impermanent, painful, empty, and not-self.

original: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa'o zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa'o zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur /
translated: In this way he will teach that the perfection of wisdom is impermanent, painful, empty, and not-self.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mi rtag pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mi rtag pa dang /
translated: “Similarly, they will teach that the transcendent perfection of meditative concentration, the transcendent perfection of perseverance, the transcendent perfection of tolerance, the transcendent perfection of moral discipline, and the transcendent perfection of generosity are impermanent,

original: @103a * // sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa'o zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: @103a * // sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa'o zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur /
translated: suffering, empty, and devoid of selfhood.🔽“Similarly, they will teach that the immeasurables, the concentrations, and the formless absorptions are impermanent,

original: de bzhin du tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa'o zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa'o zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur te /
translated: suffering, empty, and devoid of selfhood.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe de ltar ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe de ltar ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: “When practicing the transcendent perfection of wisdom, they will teach in this way.”

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa'o zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa'o zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur /
translated: He will teach that the applications of mindfulness are impermanent, suffering, selfless, and unpleasant.

original: de bzhin du yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam rnams mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa'o zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam rnams mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa'o zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur /
translated: Similarly, he will teach that the correct exertions, the supports for miraculous ability, the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment, and the path are impermanent, suffering, selfless, and unpleasant.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i bar du mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa'o zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i bar du mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa'o zhes bya bar ston par 'gyur te /
translated: When he practices the perfection of wisdom, he will teach that the knowledge of all aspects is impermanent, suffering, selfless, and unpleasant.

original: gang de ltar spyod pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'o zhes de ltar brjod pa 'di ni koo shi ka shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan no //🔽koo shi ka gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: gang de ltar spyod pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'o zhes de ltar brjod pa 'di ni koo shi ka shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan no // koo shi ka gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Kauśika, those who practice like that are practicing the perfection of wisdom.

original: rigs kyi bu mo de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston na 'di ltar ston te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston na 'di ltar ston te /
translated: Kauśika, moreover, when those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family teach the perfection of wisdom, they teach like this:🔽‘Come here, son of a good family! You should cultivate the perfection of wisdom like this.

original: tshur rigs kyi bu khyod kyis de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgoms shig / khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms na sa dang po la gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshur rigs kyi bu khyod kyis de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgoms shig / khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms na sa dang po la gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: When you cultivate the perfection of wisdom, you will stand on the first level.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ; bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms na sa dang po la gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ; bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms na sa dang po la gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, if they cultivate the perfection of meditative stability, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of moral discipline, and the perfection of generosity, they will stand on the first level.

original: sa bcu pa'i bar la gnas par 'gyur ro zhes de yang mtshan ma'i tshul dang dmigs pa'i tshul gyis ston te /
analyzed: sa bcu pa'i bar la gnas par 'gyur ro zhes de yang mtshan ma'i tshul dang dmigs pa'i tshul gyis ston te /
translated: They will stand on the second level, and so on up to: they will stand on the tenth level.

original: de dus kyi 'du shes kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dus kyi 'du shes kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will cultivate the perfection of wisdom with the notion of time.

original: koo shi ka de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan no //🔽koo shi ka gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: koo shi ka de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan no // koo shi ka gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Kauśika, that is the counterfeit of the perfection of wisdom.

original: rigs kyi bu mo de dag 'di ltar ston to /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de dag 'di ltar ston to /
translated: “Furthermore, Kauśika, those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family demonstrate like this:

original: tshur rigs kyi bu khyod kyis de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgoms shig / khyod kyis @103b shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms na nyan thos kyi sa las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshur rigs kyi bu khyod kyis de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgoms shig / khyod kyis @103b shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms na nyan thos kyi sa las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you cultivate the perfection of wisdom, you will transcend the śrāvaka level.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'da' bar 'gyur ro zhes ston te /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'da' bar 'gyur ro zhes ston te /
translated: You will transcend the pratyekabuddha level.”

original: koo shi ka de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan no //🔽koo shi ka gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am /🔽rigs kyi bu mo de dag theg pa chen po pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: koo shi ka de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan no // koo shi ka gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am / rigs kyi bu mo de dag theg pa chen po pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Kauśika, that is the counterfeit of the perfection of wisdom.

original: rigs kyi bu mo de dag la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston na 'di ltar ston te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de dag la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston na 'di ltar ston te /
translated: “Furthermore, Kauśika, when those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family teach those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family in the Great Vehicle the perfection of wisdom, they teach it like this:🔽‘Come here, son of a good family! You should cultivate the perfection of wisdom.

original: tshur rigs kyi bu khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgoms shig / khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms na byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshur rigs kyi bu khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgoms shig / khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms na byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you cultivate the perfection of wisdom, you will enter into the secure state of a bodhisattva.

original: koo shi ka gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: koo shi ka gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: “Furthermore, Kauśika, when those sons of a good family or

original: rigs kyi bu mo de dag la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston na 'di ltar ston te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de dag la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston na 'di ltar ston te /
translated: daughters of a good family teach the perfection of wisdom to others, they should teach it like this:

original: tshur rigs kyi bu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgoms shig / khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms na mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshur rigs kyi bu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgoms shig / khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms na mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: ‘Come here, son of a good family! Meditate on the perfection of wisdom! When you meditate on the perfection of wisdom, you will attain the patient acceptance of the fact that dharmas are not produced.

original: khyod kyis de ltar mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pa la gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: khyod kyis de ltar mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pa la gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: When you attain the patient acceptance of the fact that dharmas are not produced in that way, you will stand in the bodhisattva’s clairvoyances.

original: khyod de ltar mngon par shes pa la gnas na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la rim gro dang / bla ma dang / bsti stang dang / mchod pa dang / rjed pa dang / bkur sti'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes de ltar ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: khyod de ltar mngon par shes pa la gnas na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la rim gro dang / bla ma dang / bsti stang dang / mchod pa dang / rjed pa dang / bkur sti'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes de ltar ston par 'gyur te /
translated: When you stand in the clairvoyances in that way, you will go from buddhafield to buddhafield in order to honor, venerate, respect, make offerings to, revere, and worship the lord buddhas.’

original: koo shi ka de ltar ston pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: koo shi ka de ltar ston pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: “Kauśika, those sons of a good family or

original: rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ston to //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ston to //
translated: those daughters of a good family who teach in that way teach a counterfeit perfection of wisdom.

original: koo shi ka gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: koo shi ka gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: “Furthermore, Kauśika, those sons of a good family or

original: rigs kyi bu mo de dag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag la 'di ltar ston te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de dag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag la 'di ltar ston te /
translated: those daughters of a good family teach those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family in the Bodhisattva Vehicle like this:

original: rigs kyi bu dag su shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dzin par 'gyur /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag su shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dzin par 'gyur /
translated: ‘Sons of a good family, those who take up the perfection of wisdom,

original: 'chang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'chang bar 'gyur /
translated: who take it up,

original: klog par 'gyur /
analyzed: klog par 'gyur /
translated: who read it aloud,

original: kun chub par byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: kun chub par byed par 'gyur /
translated: who master it,

original: tshul bzhin du yid la byed par 'gyur ba de'i bsod nams kyi phung po tshad med grangs med gzhal du med par 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes zer te /
analyzed: tshul bzhin du yid la byed par 'gyur ba de'i bsod nams kyi phung po tshad med grangs med gzhal du med par 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes zer te /
translated: and who properly pay attention to it will increase their immeasurable, innumerable, incalculable heap of merit.’

original: koo shi ka de ltar ston par 'gyur ba'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ston to //
analyzed: koo shi ka de ltar ston par 'gyur ba'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ston to //
translated: “Kauśika, those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family who teach in that way teach a counterfeit perfection of wisdom.

original: koo shi ka gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am /🔽rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i @104a * //🔽theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: koo shi ka gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am / rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i @104a * // theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: “Furthermore, Kauśika, those sons of a good family and🔽those daughters of a good family teach those sons of a good family

original: rigs kyi bu mo de dag la 'di ltar ston te /🔽tshur rigs kyi bu khyod kyis 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis thugs dang po bskyed pa nas phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de dag la 'di ltar ston te / tshur rigs kyi bu khyod kyis 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis thugs dang po bskyed pa nas phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba
translated: in the vehicle of the bodhisattvas as follows:🔽‘Come here, son of a good family!🔽You should rejoice in all the wholesome roots of the tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas of the past, future, and present, from the time of their first producing the thought of awakening up until their passing into complete nirvāṇa in the element of nirvāṇa without any remainder of the aggregates,

original: gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus te rjes su yi rang bar gyis la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su sngos shig ces zer te /
analyzed: gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus te rjes su yi rang bar gyis la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su sngos shig ces zer te /
translated: and you should transform them into unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.’

original: de ltar ston par 'gyur ba'i rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: de ltar ston par 'gyur ba'i rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Those sons of a good family or

original: rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ston to //🔽brgya byin gyis gsol pa /🔽bcom ldan 'das rigs kyi bu'am /🔽rigs kyi bu mo de dag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ston to // brgya byin gyis gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das rigs kyi bu'am / rigs kyi bu mo de dag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage reveal a simulated perfection of wisdom.

original: rigs kyi bu mo de dag la ji ltar ston na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan mi ston pa lags /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽koo shi ka 'di la rigs kyi bu'am /🔽rigs kyi bu mo de dag theg pa chen po la yang dag par rab tu zhugs pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de dag la ji ltar ston na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan mi ston pa lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / koo shi ka 'di la rigs kyi bu'am / rigs kyi bu mo de dag theg pa chen po la yang dag par rab tu zhugs pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Śatakratu then inquired, “Lord, when sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage teach those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage who follow the vehicle of the bodhisattvas, how do they not reveal a simulated perfection of wisdom?

original: rigs kyi bu mo de dag la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ltar ston te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de dag la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ltar ston te /
translated: ” The Blessed One replied, “Kauśika, in this regard, those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage teach those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage who have set out in the Great Vehicle as follows:🔽‘Come, son of enlightened heritage! You should cultivate the perfection of wisdom.

original: tshur rigs kyi bu khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgoms shig / gzugs mi rtag ces bya bar ma lta zhig / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: tshur rigs kyi bu khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgoms shig / gzugs mi rtag ces bya bar ma lta zhig / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Do not look upon form as impermanent. And why is that?

original: gzugs ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /
translated: Form is empty of intrinsic nature.

original: gzugs kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni dngos po med pa'o //
translated: The intrinsic nature of form is non-entity.

original: dngos po med pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs rtag ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: dngos po med pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs rtag ces bya ba'am /
translated: That which is non-entity is the perfection of wisdom.🔽That which is the perfection of wisdom is not apprehended as form being permanent or

original: mi rtag ces bya bar mi dmigs so //
analyzed: mi rtag ces bya bar mi dmigs so //
translated: impermanent.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar gzugs nyid kyang med na rtag pa'am /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar gzugs nyid kyang med na rtag pa'am /
translated: It is because form itself does not exist, so how could it be permanent or🔽impermanent?

original: mi rtag par lta ga la 'gyur zhes ston pa'i phyir te /🔽koo shi ka de ltar ston pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: mi rtag par lta ga la 'gyur zhes ston pa'i phyir te / koo shi ka de ltar ston pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, it is said:

original: rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan mi ston to //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan mi ston to //
translated: Kauśika, those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family who teach in that way do not teach a counterfeit perfection of wisdom.🔽Similarly, do not view feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness as impermanent.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa mi rtag ces bya bar ma lta zhig / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa mi rtag ces bya bar ma lta zhig / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rnam par shes pa ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir te /
translated: because consciousness is empty of a basic nature.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin @104b gang yin pa de ni dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin @104b gang yin pa de ni dngos po med pa'o //
translated: The basic nature of consciousness is non-existent.

original: dngos po med pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de la ni rnam par shes pa rtag ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: dngos po med pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de la ni rnam par shes pa rtag ces bya ba'am /
translated: That which is non-existent is the perfection of wisdom.🔽In the perfection of wisdom one does not apprehend a consciousness described as ‘permanent’

original: mi rtag ces bya bar mi dmigs so //
analyzed: mi rtag ces bya bar mi dmigs so //
translated: or as ‘impermanent.’

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽de ni 'di ltar de la rnam par shes pa nyid kyang med na rtag pa'am /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / de ni 'di ltar de la rnam par shes pa nyid kyang med na rtag pa'am /
translated: If you ask why,🔽Kauśika, it is because consciousness itself is not there, so how could it be permanent

original: mi rtag par lta ga la 'gyur zhes ston pa'i phyir te /🔽koo shi ka de ltar ston pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: mi rtag par lta ga la 'gyur zhes ston pa'i phyir te / koo shi ka de ltar ston pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: or impermanent?”🔽Kauśika, those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family who teach that

original: rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan mi ston to //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan mi ston to //
translated: do not teach a counterfeit perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du so so ba dang / bsdus pa'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams dang / pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du so so ba dang / bsdus pa'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams dang / pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang /
translated: Similarly, the individual and combined aggregates, elements, sense fields, dependent originations, all perfections, all emptinesses, all meditative stabilizations,

original: gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang /
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang /
translated: all dhāraṇī gateways, thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, eight liberations, nine serial absorptions, immeasurables, concentrations, and formless absorptions,

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa drug dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa drug dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la bya'o //
translated: It is the emptiness, the signless, the wishless, the six superknowledges, the ten tathāgata powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.🔽“Come here, son of a good family! You should cultivate the perfection of wisdom.

original: tshur rigs kyi bu khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgoms shig / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mi rtag ces bya bar ma lta zhig / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: tshur rigs kyi bu khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgoms shig / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mi rtag ces bya bar ma lta zhig / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Do not look upon the knowledge of all aspects as impermanent. And why?

original: de ni 'di ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the knowledge of all aspects is empty of a basic nature.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni dngos po med pa'o //
translated: The basic nature of the knowledge of all aspects is not a thing.

original: dngos po med pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: That which is not a thing is the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de la ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rtag ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de la ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rtag ces bya ba'am /
translated: In this perfection of wisdom, the knowledge of all modes is not something permanent.

original: mi rtag ces bya bar mi dmigs so //
analyzed: mi rtag ces bya bar mi dmigs so //
translated: In that perfection of wisdom the knowledge of all modes is not apprehended as permanent or impermanent.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽de ni 'di ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang med na rtag pa'am /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / de ni 'di ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang med na rtag pa'am /
translated: And why?

original: mi rtag pa lta ga la yod ces ston pa'i phyir te /🔽koo shi ka de ltar ston pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: mi rtag pa lta ga la yod ces ston pa'i phyir te / koo shi ka de ltar ston pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Because the knowledge of all modes is not, how much less can it be permanent or impermanent.

original: rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan mi @105a * //🔽ston to // koo shi ka gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am /🔽rigs kyi bu mo de dag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan mi @105a * // ston to // koo shi ka gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am / rigs kyi bu mo de dag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Kausika, those sons and daughters of good family who teach the perfection of wisdom as I have explained it, they do not teach a counterfeit of the perfection of wisdom.

original: rigs kyi bu mo de dag la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ltar ston te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de dag la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ltar ston te /
translated: Moreover, Kausika, those sons and daughters of good family who teach the perfection of wisdom to the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, should teach it to them in such a way that they will think:

original: tshur rigs kyi bu khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgoms shig /
analyzed: tshur rigs kyi bu khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgoms shig /
translated: 'Come here, son of good family! You should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: chos gang la yang lta bar ma byed cig / chos gang la yang gnas par ma byed cig / de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la chos gang la yang blta bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: chos gang la yang lta bar ma byed cig / chos gang la yang gnas par ma byed cig / de ci'i phyir zhe na / de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la chos gang la yang blta bar bya ba'am /
translated: Do not look at any dharma! Do not stand on any dharma!🔽And why?🔽Because in the perfection of wisdom there is no dharma to be looked at,

original: gang la yang gnas par bya ba'i chos med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang la yang gnas par bya ba'i chos med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or on which to stand.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: koo shi ka de ni 'di ltar chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis stong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: koo shi ka de ni 'di ltar chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis stong ba'i phyir te /
translated: Kauśika, it is because all dharmas are empty of their own intrinsic nature.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i chos gang yin pa de ni dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i chos gang yin pa de ni dngos po med pa'o //
translated: A dharma that is empty of its own intrinsic nature is not a thing.

original: dngos po med pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: That which is not a thing is the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de la ni blang ba'am /🔽dor ba'am / skye ba'am /🔽'gag pa'am / chad pa'am /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de la ni blang ba'am / dor ba'am / skye ba'am / 'gag pa'am / chad pa'am /
translated: In the perfection of wisdom there is nothing to be taken up or put down,🔽nothing to be produced or stopped,

original: rtag pa'am / don gcig pa'am /
analyzed: rtag pa'am / don gcig pa'am /
translated: nothing to be diminished or augmented,

original: don du ma yod pa'am /
analyzed: don du ma yod pa'am /
translated: nothing to be defiled or purified,🔽nothing to be increased or decreased.

original: 'gro ba'i chos gang yang med do zhes ston te /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i chos gang yang med do zhes ston te /
translated: There is no dharma of a worldling at all.”

original: koo shi ka de ltar ston pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: koo shi ka de ltar ston pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Kauśika, those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family who teach like that

original: rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan mi ston to //🔽koo shi ka de bas na rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan mi ston to // koo shi ka de bas na rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: do not teach a counterfeit perfection of wisdom.

original: rigs kyi bu mos de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mos de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don bstan par bya ste /
translated: Kauśika, therefore sons of a good family or daughters of a good family should teach the meaning of the perfection of wisdom like that.

original: de ltar ston pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: de ltar ston pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family who teach like that

original: rigs kyi bu mo de dag gi bsod nams kyi phung po ni ches mang du 'phel bar 'gyur gyi /🔽rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de dag gi bsod nams kyi phung po ni ches mang du 'phel bar 'gyur gyi / rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: increase a lot more in their merit than

original: rigs kyi bu mo snga ma dag ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bkur ba tsam brgyad pa yin no //🔽koo shi ka gzhan yang 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can ji snyed pa de dag rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo snga ma dag ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bkur ba tsam brgyad pa yin no // koo shi ka gzhan yang 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can ji snyed pa de dag rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family who do not teach like that.

original: rigs kyi bu mo la la zhig gis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la bkod na /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo la la zhig gis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la bkod na /
translated: Kauśika, moreover, if some son of a good family or daughter of a good family were to establish all the sentient beings in Jambudvīpa in the result of stream enterer,🔽what do you think, Kauśika?

original: koo shi ka de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: koo shi ka de ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Kauśika, what do you think?

original: rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Would that son of a good family or

original: rigs kyi bu mo de'i bsod nams mang du 'phel lam /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de'i bsod nams mang du 'phel lam /
translated: daughter of a good family generate a lot of merit?”

original: brgya byin gyis gsol pa /🔽bcom ldan 'das mang ngo/ pa /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das mang ngo/ pa /
translated: Śatakratu replied,🔽“Blessed One, it would be a lot.

original: bcom ldan 'das mang ngo //🔽bde bar gshegs pa mang ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mang ngo // bde bar gshegs pa mang ngo //
translated: Blessed One, it would be a lot.🔽Well-Gone One, it would be a lot.

original: bde bar gshegs pa mang ngo //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa mang ngo //
translated: Well-Gone One, it would be a lot.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: koo shi ka de bas kyang rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: koo shi ka de bas kyang rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: “Kauśika, a son of a good family or

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di don dang ldan pa yi ge dang ldan par rnam grangs du @105b mas gzhan la rgya cher brjod par 'gyur /🔽ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di don dang ldan pa yi ge dang ldan par rnam grangs du @105b mas gzhan la rgya cher brjod par 'gyur / ston par 'gyur /
translated: a daughter of a good family who, in addition to that, explains this perfection of wisdom to others in detail,🔽teaches it,🔽elucidates it,

original: rnam par 'grel par 'gyur /🔽yang dag par ston par byed par 'gyur /🔽yang dag par rab tu gsal bar byed par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: rnam par 'grel par 'gyur /🔽yang dag par ston par byed par 'gyur /🔽yang dag par rab tu gsal bar byed par 'gyur zhing /
translated: expounds it,🔽and illuminates it in terms of its meaning and its letters,

original: 'di skad du tshur rigs kyi bu khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zung shig / kun chub par gyis shig chongs shig / lhogs shig / tshul bzhin du yid la gyis shig / ji skad du bstan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin
analyzed: 'di skad du tshur rigs kyi bu khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zung shig / kun chub par gyis shig chongs shig / lhogs shig / tshul bzhin du yid la gyis shig / ji skad du bstan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin
translated: If he were to say, ‘Come here, son of good family! Take up the perfection of wisdom, study it, bear it in mind, recite it, wisely attend to it, and make sure that you progress as it has been taught in the perfection of wisdom.

original: pa la nan tan du gyis shig ces bsgo na ches de'i bsod nams mang du 'phel lo //
analyzed: pa la nan tan du gyis shig ces bsgo na ches de'i bsod nams mang du 'phel lo //
translated: ’ then his merit would increase even more.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: koo shi ka shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las rgyun du zhugs pa rnams dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu rnams yod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: koo shi ka shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las rgyun du zhugs pa rnams dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu rnams yod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, Kauśika, from this perfection of wisdom the stream-enterers and the fruits of stream-entry come about.

original: koo shi ka 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can thams cad rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la bkod pa lta zhog gi / gling chen po bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la bkod pa lta zhog gi /
analyzed: koo shi ka 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can thams cad rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la bkod pa lta zhog gi / gling chen po bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la bkod pa lta zhog gi /
translated: “Let alone all the beings in the Rose Apple Continent established in the fruit of stream-entry, Kauśika, let alone all the beings in the four-continent world system established in the fruit of stream-entry,

original: stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la bkod pa lta yang zhog / stong gnyis pa bar ma'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la bkod pa lta yang zhog /
analyzed: stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la bkod pa lta yang zhog / stong gnyis pa bar ma'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la bkod pa lta yang zhog /
translated: “Set aside the case of all the sentient beings in a chiliocosm, who have been caused to enter into the result of stream enterer.🔽“Set aside the case of all the sentient beings in a dichiliocosm, who have been caused to enter into the result of stream enterer.🔽“Set aside the case of all the sentient beings in a great trichiliocosm, who have been caused to enter into the result of stream enterer.🔽“Kauśika, set aside the case of all the sentient beings in the eastern direction, in world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river, who have been caused to enter into the result of stream enterer.

original: koo shi ka stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la bkod pa lta yang zhog / koo shi ka shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi sems can🔽ji snyed pa de dag thams cad rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: koo shi ka stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la bkod pa lta yang zhog / koo shi ka shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi sems can🔽ji snyed pa de dag thams cad rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: “Kauśika, set aside the case of all the sentient beings in the eastern direction, in world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river, who have been caused to enter into the result of stream enterer.

original: rigs kyi bu mo la las rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la bkod par byas pa dang / de bzhin du lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / phyogs mtshams rnams dang / steng dang / 'og gi 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi sems can ji snyed pa de dag thams cad rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo la las rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la bkod par byas pa dang / de bzhin du lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / phyogs mtshams rnams dang / steng dang / 'og gi 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi sems can ji snyed pa de dag thams cad rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: “Son of a good family, if some people established as many beings as there are atomic particles in the great trichiliocosm in the result of Stream Enterer,🔽and if some others set up one single being in the result of a Solitary Buddha, the latter would produce merit immeasurably greater than the former.🔽

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang la las zhig gis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la bkod na /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang la las zhig gis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la bkod na /
translated: “If, Kauśika, a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family were to establish all the sentient beings of all the world systems in all the ten directions as many as there are in the three-thousand great one, in the fruit of a once-returner,

original: koo shi ka de ji snyam du sems /🔽rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: koo shi ka de ji snyam du sems / rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: then, Kauśika, what do you think?

original: rigs kyi bu mo de'i bsod nams de'i rgyus mang du 'phel lam /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de'i bsod nams de'i rgyus mang du 'phel lam /
translated: Would that son of a good family or daughter of a good family on the strength of that beget much merit?”

original: brgya byin gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis gsol pa /
translated: Śatakratu, head of the gods, said,🔽“It would be a lot,

original: bcom ldan 'das mang ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mang ngo //
translated: Blessed One.

original: bde bar gshegs pa mang ngo //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa mang ngo //
translated: It would be a lot, Sugata.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽koo shi ka de bas kyang rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / koo shi ka de bas kyang rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang gis shes @106a * //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang gis shes @106a * //
translated: “Kauśika, a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family🔽who establishes just one sentient being in the result of a non-returner

original: rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di don dang ldan /
analyzed: rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di don dang ldan /
translated: This perfection of wisdom is endowed with meaning,🔽and if one were to explain it in detail to others, teach it, make the meaning clear,

original: yi ge dang ldan par gzhan la rgya cher brjod de bstan pa dang / don yang dag par rab tu gsal bar byas pa dang / rnam par bkrol zhing rnam par phye ste gsal bar byas /
analyzed: yi ge dang ldan par gzhan la rgya cher brjod de bstan pa dang / don yang dag par rab tu gsal bar byas pa dang / rnam par bkrol zhing rnam par phye ste gsal bar byas /
translated: unravel it, reveal it,

original: yang dag par bstan par byas pa dang / 'di skad du tshur rigs kyi bu khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zung shig / kun chub par gyis shig / chongs shig / lhogs shig / tshul bzhin du yid la gyis shig / ji skad bstan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin🔽pa la nan tan du gyis shig ces bsgo na /
analyzed: yang dag par bstan par byas pa dang / 'di skad du tshur rigs kyi bu khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zung shig / kun chub par gyis shig / chongs shig / lhogs shig / tshul bzhin du yid la gyis shig / ji skad bstan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la nan tan du gyis shig ces bsgo na /
translated: and demonstrate it, saying: 'Come here, son of good family! You should take up the perfection of wisdom, master it, keep it, read it aloud, understand it correctly, and practice the perfection of wisdom as it has been taught.'

original: ches de'i bsod nams mang du 'phel lo //
analyzed: ches de'i bsod nams mang du 'phel lo //
translated: If one were to do that, his merit would increase even more.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: koo shi ka shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las rgyun du zhugs pa rnams yod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bkur ba tsam dgu pa yin no //
translated: This is the ninth mere respect.

original: 'di dag gis ni bkur ba tsam gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni bkur ba tsam gsungs pa yin no //
translated: By these [verses], he speaks of mere praise.

original: koo shi ka gzhan yang 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can ji snyed pa de dag rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo la la zhig gis lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la bkod zhes bya ba ni bsngags pa tsam dang po yin no //
analyzed: koo shi ka gzhan yang 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can ji snyed pa de dag rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo la la zhig gis lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la bkod zhes bya ba ni bsngags pa tsam dang po yin no //
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, if some son of good family or daughter of good family were to establish in the fruit of once-returning as many beings as there are in Jambudvīpa, this is the first mere praise.

original: ji snyed pa phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la bkod ces bya ba ni bsngags pa tsam gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: ji snyed pa phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la bkod ces bya ba ni bsngags pa tsam gnyis pa yin no //
translated: If they were to establish in the fruit of non-returning as many beings as there are in Jambudvīpa, this is the second mere praise.

original: ji snyed pa dgra bcom pa nyid la rab tu bkod na /
analyzed: ji snyed pa dgra bcom pa nyid la rab tu bkod na /
translated: If they were to establish in arhatship as many beings as there are in Jambudvīpa,

analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de'i bsod nams de'i rgyus mang du 'phel lam /
translated: Would that son of good family or daughter of good family on that account generate a lot of merit?

original: brgya byin gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis gsol pa /
translated: Śakra said:

original: bcom ldan 'das mang ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mang ngo //
translated: “Bhagavān, it is a lot.

original: bde bar gshegs pa mang ngo //🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽koo shi ka de bas kyang rigs kyi bu'am /🔽rigs kyi bu mo gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di don dang ldan /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa mang ngo // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / koo shi ka de bas kyang rigs kyi bu'am / rigs kyi bu mo gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di don dang ldan /
translated: Sugata, it is a lot.”🔽The Bhagavān said, “Kauśika, a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family who gives this perfection of wisdom to others in detail, teaches it, reveals it, transmits it, recites it, teaches it, explains it, and illuminates it in its meaning and in the words, and says, ‘Come here, son of a good family!

original: yi ge dang ldan par gzhan la rgya cher brjod de bstan pa dang / yang dag par rab tu gsal bar byas pa dang / rnam par bkrol zhing rnam par phye ste gsal ba dang / yang dag par bstan par byas pa dang / 'di skad du tshur rigs kyi bu khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zung shig /
analyzed: yi ge dang ldan par gzhan la rgya cher brjod de bstan pa dang / yang dag par rab tu gsal bar byas pa dang / rnam par bkrol zhing rnam par phye ste gsal ba dang / yang dag par bstan par byas pa dang / 'di skad du tshur rigs kyi bu khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zung shig /
translated: You should take up this perfection of wisdom.🔽You should master it, bear it in mind, read it aloud, and be attentive to it in the right way.

original: kun chub par gyis shig / chongs shig / lhogs shig / tshul bzhin du yid la gyis shig / ji ltar bstan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la na tan du gyis shig ces bsgo na /

translated: You should make an effort to practice the perfection of wisdom as it has been taught,’

original: ches de'i bsod nams mang du 'phel lo //
analyzed: ches de'i bsod nams mang du 'phel lo //
translated: would have a lot more merit.”🔽“Bhagavān, if a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family teaches this perfection of wisdom to others in detail,

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

translated: Kauśika, it is because the result of being tied to one more rebirth, the result of no longer being subject to rebirth, and the state of a worthy one exist because of this perfection of wisdom.🔽“Kauśika, let alone all the beings in Jambudvīpa who have been caused to enter into the result of being tied to one more rebirth, the result of no longer being subject to rebirth, and the state of a worthy one,🔽if a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family were to cause all the beings in a four-continent world-system to enter into the result of being tied to one more rebirth, the result of no longer being subject to rebirth, and the state of a worthy one,

translated: and if another son of a good family or daughter of a good family were to cause the beings in a world-system with a thousand world-realms to enter into the result of being tied to one more rebirth, the result of no longer being subject to rebirth, and the state of a worthy one,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / koo shi ka de bas kyang rigs kyi bu'am /

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang gis @107b shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di don dang ldan /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang gis @107b shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di don dang ldan /
translated: “Kauśika, a son of a good family or daughter of a good family who takes up this perfection of wisdom, bears it in mind, reads it aloud, masters it,

original: yi ge dang ldan par gzhan la rgya cher brjod de /
analyzed: yi ge dang ldan par gzhan la rgya cher brjod de /
translated: and having taken up the perfection of wisdom, he should study it, bear it in mind, recite it, learn it, spread it abroad,

original: bstan pa dang yang dag par rab tu gsal bar byed la rnam par bkrol zhing rnam par phye ste gsal ba dang yang dag par bstan par byas pa dang / 'di skad du khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zung shig /
analyzed: bstan pa dang yang dag par rab tu gsal bar byed la rnam par bkrol zhing rnam par phye ste gsal ba dang yang dag par bstan par byas pa dang / 'di skad du khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zung shig /
translated: make it known to others, repeat it, promulgate it, proclaim it, teach it, demonstrate it, explain it, expound it, and analyse it in detail, and make it clear to others.🔽He should say: ‘Take up this perfection of wisdom, O son of good family!

original: kun chub par gyis shig / chongs shig / lhogs shig / tshul bzhin du yid la gyis shig / ji ltar bstan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nan tan du gyis shig / rigs kyi bu khyod kyis ji lta ji ltar shes rab kyi pha
analyzed: kun chub par gyis shig / chongs shig / lhogs shig / tshul bzhin du yid la gyis shig / ji ltar bstan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nan tan du gyis shig / rigs kyi bu khyod kyis ji lta ji ltar shes rab kyi pha
translated: Study it, bear it in mind, recite it, learn it, spread it abroad, make it known to others, repeat it, promulgate it, proclaim it, teach it, demonstrate it, explain it, expound it, and analyse it in detail!

original: rol tu phyin pa ji skad du bstan pa la nan tan du byed par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar rigs kyi bu khyod kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rol tu phyin pa ji skad du bstan pa la nan tan du byed par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar rigs kyi bu khyod kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: In so far as, son of good family, you will apply yourself to the perfection of wisdom as it has been taught, in so far will you, son of good family, acquire the cognition of the all-knowing.

original: ji lta ji ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar cher yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pa yongs su rdzogs par byed par 'gyur ro //🔽ji lta ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pa yongs su rdzogs par byed par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar khyod bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bsgo na
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar cher yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pa yongs su rdzogs par byed par 'gyur ro // ji lta ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pa yongs su rdzogs par byed par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar khyod bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bsgo na
translated: The more you will approach the knowledge of all modes, the more you will complete the meditation on the perfection of wisdom.🔽The more you will complete the meditation on the perfection of wisdom, the more you will fully know supreme enlightenment.

original: / ches de'i bsod nams mang du 'phel lo //
analyzed: / ches de'i bsod nams mang du 'phel lo //
translated: If you were to teach this perfection of wisdom to the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, you would be doing a service to all beings.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: koo shi ka 'di las byung ba ni sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: koo shi ka 'di las byung ba ni sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: From this have come forth the Bodhisattvas, the great beings who have raised their thought to the utmost, right, and perfect enlightenment.

original: phyogs bcu'i phyogs re re zhing gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa'i sa la gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i phyogs re re zhing gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa'i sa la gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu
translated: Because all the bodhisattva great beings in the ten directions, as many as there are, in world systems equal to the number of sand particles in the Ganges River, who have generated the first level of the mind, all of them arise from just this perfection of wisdom.

original: phyin pa 'di nyid las nges par 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bsngags ba tsam lnga pa yin no //🔽gling bzhi pa'i sems can ji snyed pa dang zhes bya ba ni bsngags pa tsam drug pa yin no //
analyzed: phyin pa 'di nyid las nges par 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bsngags ba tsam lnga pa yin no // gling bzhi pa'i sems can ji snyed pa dang zhes bya ba ni bsngags pa tsam drug pa yin no //
translated: This is the fifth mere praise.🔽As many beings as there are in the four continents, this is the sixth mere praise.

original: stong spyi phud kyi sems can ji snyed pa dang zhes bya ba ni bsngags pa tsam bdun pa yin no //
analyzed: stong spyi phud kyi sems can ji snyed pa dang zhes bya ba ni bsngags pa tsam bdun pa yin no //
translated: As many beings as there are in a chiliocosm, this is the seventh mere praise.

original: stong gnyis pa bar ma dang / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i sems can ji snyed pa dang / koo shi ka gzhan yang phyogs bcu'i phyogs re re zhing gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can ji snyed pa de dag rigs kyi bu'am /🔽rigs kyi bu mo gang la la zhig gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs @108a * //
analyzed: stong gnyis pa bar ma dang / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i sems can ji snyed pa dang / koo shi ka gzhan yang phyogs bcu'i phyogs re re zhing gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can ji snyed pa de dag rigs kyi bu'am / rigs kyi bu mo gang la la zhig gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs @108a * //
translated: and, Kauśika, moreover, as many beings as there are in each of the ten directions in world-systems numerous as the sands of the Ganges River,

original: pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par bskul bar byas na /
analyzed: pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par bskul bar byas na /
translated: if some son of a good family or daughter of a good family were to incite them to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: koo shi ka de ji snyam du sems /🔽rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: koo shi ka de ji snyam du sems / rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Kauśika, what do you think?

original: rigs kyi bu mo de'i bsod nams de'i rgyus mang du 'phel lam /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de'i bsod nams de'i rgyus mang du 'phel lam /
translated: Would the merit of that son of a good family or daughter of a good family on that account increase much?”

original: brgya byin gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis gsol pa /
translated: Śatakratu said,

original: bcom ldan 'das mang ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mang ngo //
translated: “Much, Bhagavat!

original: bde bar gshegs pa mang ngo //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa mang ngo //
translated: Very much, Sugata!”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavat said,

original: koo shi ka de bas kyang rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: koo shi ka de bas kyang rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: “Kauśika, a son of a good family or daughter of a good family who has been urged on to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening by a bodhisattva, and who has been urged on to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening by a bodhisattva, and who has been urged on to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening by a bodhisattva, and who has been urged on to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening by a bodhisattva, and who has been urged on to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening by a bodhisattva, and who has been urged on to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening by a bodhisattva, and who has been urged on to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening by a bodhisattva, and who has been urged on to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening by a bodhisattva, and who has been urged on to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening by a bodhisattva, and who has been urged on to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening by a bodhisattva, and who has been urged on to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening by a bodhisattva, and who has been urged on to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening by a bodhisattva, and who has been urged on to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening by a bodhisattva, and who has been urged on to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening by a bodhisattva, and who has been urged on to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening by a bodhisattva, and who has been urged on to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening by a bodhisattva, and who has been urged on to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening by a bodhisattva, and who has been urged on to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening by a bodhisattva, and who has been urged on to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening by a bodhisattva, and who has been urged on

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di don dang ldan /🔽yi ge dang ldan par gzhan la rgya cher bstan pa dang / yang dag par bstan par byas pa'i bar dang / 'di skad du tshur rigs kyi bu khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zung shig / kun chub par gyis shig / chongs shig / lhogs shig / tshul bzhin du yid la gyis shig / ji ltar bstan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin🔽pa la nan tan du gyis shig / rigs kyi bu khyod ji lta ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ji skad bstan pa la nan tan du byed par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar rigs kyi bu khyod thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di don dang ldan / yi ge dang ldan par gzhan la rgya cher bstan pa dang / yang dag par bstan par byas pa'i bar dang / 'di skad du tshur rigs kyi bu khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zung shig / kun chub par gyis shig / chongs shig / lhogs shig / tshul bzhin du yid la gyis shig / ji ltar bstan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la nan tan du gyis shig / rigs kyi bu khyod ji lta ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ji skad bstan pa la nan tan du byed par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar rigs kyi bu khyod thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par
translated: “Moreover, Śāriputra, if sons of a good family or daughters of a good family teach this perfection of wisdom to others in detail, up to demonstrate it, and say, ‘Come here, son of a good family! You should take up the perfection of wisdom! You should master it! You should keep it! You should read it! You should properly pay attention to it! You should practice the perfection of wisdom just as it has been taught!

original: byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Son of a good family, just as you practice the perfection of wisdom just as it has been taught, just like that, son of a good family, you will attain the state of a knower of all aspects.

original: ji lta ji ltar thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar cher yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar cher yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The more you perfect the knowledge of all modes, the more you will perfect the meditation on the perfection of wisdom.

original: ji lta ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pa yongs su rdzogs par byed par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar khyod bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bsgo na
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pa yongs su rdzogs par byed par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar khyod bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bsgo na
translated: The more you perfect the meditation on the perfection of wisdom, the more you will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: / ches de'i bsod nams mang du 'phel lo //
analyzed: / ches de'i bsod nams mang du 'phel lo //
translated: If you were to tell him that, his merit would increase even more.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: koo shi ka 'di las byung ba ni sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: koo shi ka 'di las byung ba ni sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: From this have come forth the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, who have raised their thought for the first time.

original: phyogs bcu'i phyogs re re zhing gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa'i sa la gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i phyogs re re zhing gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa'i sa la gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa
translated: Because all the bodhisattva great beings in the ten directions, as many as there are in each of the world systems, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, on the stage of generating the thought for the first time, have emerged from just this perfection of wisdom.

original: 'di nyid las nges par 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bsngags pa tsam brgyad pa yin no //🔽koo shi ka gzhan yang 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can ji snyed pa de dag rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: 'di nyid las nges par 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bsngags pa tsam brgyad pa yin no // koo shi ka gzhan yang 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can ji snyed pa de dag rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: This is the eighth praise.

original: rigs kyi bu mo la la zhig gis phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la bkod pa bas rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo la la zhig gis phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la bkod pa bas rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: “Furthermore, Kauśika, if some son of a good family or daughter of a good family were to establish as many beings as there are in Jambudvīpa on the irreversible level,

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di don dang ldan /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di don dang ldan /
translated: and if some other son of a good family or daughter of a good family were to teach this perfection of wisdom to others,

original: @108b yi ge dang ldan par gzhan la rgya cher bstan pa dang / yang dag par bstan par byas pa'i bar dang / 'di skad du tshur rigs bu khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zung shig / kun chub par gyis shig / chongs shig / lhogs shig / tshul bzhin du yid la gyis shig / ji ltar bstan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa
analyzed: @108b yi ge dang ldan par gzhan la rgya cher bstan pa dang / yang dag par bstan par byas pa'i bar dang / 'di skad du tshur rigs bu khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zung shig / kun chub par gyis shig / chongs shig / lhogs shig / tshul bzhin du yid la gyis shig / ji ltar bstan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa
translated: you should master it, you should bear it in mind, you should recite it, you should keep it correctly in mind, and you should practice the perfection of wisdom as it has been taught.

original: la nan tan du gyis shig / ji lta ji ltar ji skad bstan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la nan tan du byed par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslabs par gyur na phyir
analyzed: la nan tan du gyis shig / ji lta ji ltar ji skad bstan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la nan tan du byed par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslabs par gyur na phyir
translated: To the extent that you practice the perfection of wisdom as it has been taught, to that extent you will train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: mi ldog pa la gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi ldog pa la gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: You will stand in irreversibility,
