analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du bstan par bya bar bshad pa ste /
translated: The emptiness of internal phenomena, and the other aspects of emptiness, up to and including the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities, should be taught.

original: des de ltar thos nas mi dang / kun tu mi skrag kun tu @114b skrag pa dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des de ltar thos nas mi dang / kun tu mi skrag kun tu @114b skrag pa dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: When they hear it, they will not be afraid, nor will they be terrified.

original: gal te dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa dang / sngon gyi rgyal ba la brten te dge ba'i rtsa ba bskrun pa dang / sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur ba yin na yang ngo //
analyzed: gal te dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa dang / sngon gyi rgyal ba la brten te dge ba'i rtsa ba bskrun pa dang / sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur ba yin na yang ngo //
translated: If they are accepted by a spiritual friend, if they have planted the roots of virtue in the presence of former victors, and if they have served many buddhas, then they will.

original: btsun pa rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya'o //
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya'o //
translated: “Venerable Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should dedicate the merit of rejoicing in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening in that way.”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: 'o na byams pa sems gang gis rjes su yi rangs nas yongs su sngo bar byed pa'i sems de ni zad cing 'gags pa dang bral zhing rnam par gyur ba dang / dngos po de dag dang / dmigs pa de dag dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang zad cing 'gags la bral zhing rnam par gyur na /
analyzed: 'o na byams pa sems gang gis rjes su yi rangs nas yongs su sngo bar byed pa'i sems de ni zad cing 'gags pa dang bral zhing rnam par gyur ba dang / dngos po de dag dang / dmigs pa de dag dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang zad cing 'gags la bral zhing rnam par gyur na /
translated: “Maitreya, if the mind that rejoices and dedicates is exhausted, ceases, departs, and changes, and if those things, those objects, and those roots of virtue are exhausted, cease, depart, and change,

original: rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i sems gang zhig dang / dngos po gang zhig dang / dmigs pa gang zhig dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba gang zhig bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya /
analyzed: rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i sems gang zhig dang / dngos po gang zhig dang / dmigs pa gang zhig dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba gang zhig bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya /
translated: What is the wholesome action that is to be dedicated to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?

original: ci sems gang gis sems yongs su bsngo bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: ci sems gang gis sems yongs su bsngo bar bya ba'am /
translated: Is it the mind by which the mind is to be dedicated?

original: de lta na ni sems gnyis phrad par 'gyur ba med la /
analyzed: de lta na ni sems gnyis phrad par 'gyur ba med la /
translated: In that case, two minds would not come together.

original: sems kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de yang yongs su bsngo bar mi nus so //
analyzed: sems kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de yang yongs su bsngo bar mi nus so //
translated: And the nature of mind cannot be dedicated.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: If bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni dngos po med pa'o //
translated: know that the perfection of wisdom is a non-entity,

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni dngos po med pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the perfection of meditative stability, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of tolerance, the perfection of moral discipline, and the perfection of generosity are non-entities.

original: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni dngos po med pa'o //
translated: Form, feeling, notion, co-producing factors, and consciousness are non-entities.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun ni dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun ni dngos po med pa'o //
translated: The thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening are non-entities.

original: tshad med pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad rnams dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu rnams ni dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: tshad med pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad rnams dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu rnams ni dngos po med pa'o //
translated: The immeasurables, the concentrations, the formless absorptions, the noble truths, the eight deliverances, and the nine serial absorptions are non-entities.

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa drug rnams ni dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa drug rnams ni dngos po med pa'o //
translated: emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, and the six superknowledges are non-entities.

original: @115a * // stong pa nyid thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad ni dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: @115a * // stong pa nyid thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad ni dngos po med pa'o //
translated: All emptinesses, all meditative stabilizations, and all dhāraṇī gateways are non-entities.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ni dngos po med pa'o zhes bya bar shes na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ni dngos po med pa'o zhes bya bar shes na /
translated: The ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are non-entities.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya'o //
translated: When they know that, bodhisattva great beings should dedicate the wholesome roots consisting of rejoicing to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: gal te de ltar yongs su bsngo na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de ltar yongs su bsngo na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they dedicate in this way, they will have dedicated to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pas gnas brtan rab 'byor la smras pa /🔽btsun pa rab 'byor ji ltar na theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pas gnas brtan rab 'byor la smras pa / btsun pa rab 'byor ji ltar na theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Then the bodhisattva great being Maitreya said to the elder Subhūti,

original: rigs kyi bu mos dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos ba yin /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mos dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos ba yin /
translated: “Venerable monk Subhūti, how do sons of a good family or daughters of a good family who have newly set out in the vehicle dedicate those wholesome roots to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?

original: ji ltar rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po yongs su bzung zhing yongs su bsngos pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po yongs su bzung zhing yongs su bsngos pa yin /
translated: How do they take hold of and dedicate the wholesome roots connected with rejoicing?”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: byams pa gal te theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: byams pa gal te theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
translated: “Maitreya, if those bodhisattva great beings who have newly set out in the vehicle practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de yang mi dmigs pa'i tshul dang / mtshan ma med pa'i tshul gyis 'dzin par 'gyur /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de yang mi dmigs pa'i tshul dang / mtshan ma med pa'i tshul gyis 'dzin par 'gyur /
translated: and that perfection of wisdom is apprehended by way of non-apprehension and by way of signlessness.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ; sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mi dmigs pa'i tshul dang /🔽mtshan ma med pa'i tshul gyis 'dzin par 'gyur na /🔽nang stong pa nyid la mos pa mang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ; sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mi dmigs pa'i tshul dang / mtshan ma med pa'i tshul gyis 'dzin par 'gyur na / nang stong pa nyid la mos pa mang bar 'gyur /
translated: Similarly, if the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of giving are apprehended by way of non-apprehension and by way of signlessness,🔽then they will have a lot of conviction about inner emptiness,

original: phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la mos pa mang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la mos pa mang bar 'gyur /
translated: and they will have a lot of conviction about outer emptiness, inner and outer emptiness, up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: tshad med pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams la mos pa mang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: tshad med pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams la mos pa mang bar 'gyur /
translated: They will have great interest in the immeasurables, the dhyānas, the formless absorptions, and the noble truths.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la mos pa mang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la mos pa mang bar 'gyur /
translated: They will have great interest in the eight aspects of liberation and the nine serial absorptions.

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med @115b pa dang / smon pa med pa la mos pa mang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med @115b pa dang / smon pa med pa la mos pa mang bar 'gyur /
translated: They will have great interest in emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness.

original: mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad la mos pa mang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad la mos pa mang bar 'gyur /
translated: They will have great interest in the higher knowledges, all the meditative stabilizations, and all the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la mos pa mang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la mos pa mang bar 'gyur /
translated: They will have great interest in the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four assurances, the four kinds of exact knowledge, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin par 'gyur /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin par 'gyur /
translated: They will be assisted by spiritual friends.

original: 'di'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: 'di'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: These spiritual friends will teach the perfection of wisdom, the perfection of meditative stability, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of moral discipline,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa don dang ldan yi ge dang ldan par ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa don dang ldan yi ge dang ldan par ston par 'gyur te /
translated: and the perfection of generosity, both in terms of their meaning and in terms of the words used to express them.

original: de yang byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par chud kyi bar du ci nas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: de yang byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par chud kyi bar du ci nas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba dang /
translated: And they will do so in such a way that the bodhisattvas will never be separated from the perfection of wisdom, and likewise, they will never be separated from the perfections, until they have entered the bodhisattva’s faultless state.

original: stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid dang /
translated: the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment, the noble truths, the immeasurables, the concentrations, the formless absorptions, emptiness,

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / rnam par thar ba brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / rnam par thar ba brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang /
translated: signlessness, and aspirationlessness, the eight aspects of liberation, the nine serial steps of meditative absorption, the five kinds of preternatural knowledge, all the meditative stabilities, all the dhāraṇī gateways,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba de ltar ston to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba de ltar ston to //
translated: the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four assurances, the four kinds of exact knowledge, and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas.

original: bdud kyi las rnams kyang ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdud kyi las rnams kyang ston par 'gyur te /
translated: “He teaches the activities of Māra,

original: des bdud kyi las de dag thos nas 'grib pa'am 'phel ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des bdud kyi las de dag thos nas 'grib pa'am 'phel ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having heard of these works of Māra, he will not be diminished or increased.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar bdud kyi las de dag la ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar bdud kyi las de dag la ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because those works of Māra are without essence.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par chud kyi bar du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par chud kyi bar du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Until he has entered into the secure state of the bodhisattvas, he will not be separated from the lord buddhas.

original: de dag la yang dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed par 'gyur ro //🔽dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gis kyang byang chub sems dpa'i rigs yongs su @116a * //
analyzed: de dag la yang dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed par 'gyur ro // dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gis kyang byang chub sems dpa'i rigs yongs su @116a * //
translated: He will plant wholesome roots with them.

original: 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: And through those wholesome roots he will be born into the bodhisattva’s lineage.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs de dang yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i bar du nam yang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs de dang yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i bar du nam yang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And he will never be separated from that bodhisattva’s lineage until he has attained unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa la gsar du zhugs pas phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa tshad med pa dag na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa la gsar du zhugs pas phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa tshad med pa dag na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva mahāsattvas who are beginners in the vehicle should have faith in the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas who dwell, remain, and live in the countless, immeasurable world systems of the ten directions,

original: chos ston pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das lam chad pa /
analyzed: chos ston pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das lam chad pa /
translated: the lord buddhas who are the bhagavāns, who have cut off the path,

original: 'jug pa chad pa /
analyzed: 'jug pa chad pa /
translated: who have cut off engagement,

original: spros pa dang srid par 'dren pa chad pa /
analyzed: spros pa dang srid par 'dren pa chad pa /
translated: who have cut off elaborations and the bringing about of existence,

original: mchi ma zad pa /🔽tsher ma bcom pa /
analyzed: mchi ma zad pa / tsher ma bcom pa /
translated: who have exhausted tears,🔽who have destroyed thorns,

original: khur shin tu bor ba /
analyzed: khur shin tu bor ba /
translated: who have put down their burdens,

original: bdag gi don rjes su thob pa /
analyzed: bdag gi don rjes su thob pa /
translated: who have attained their own welfare,

original: srid par sbyor ba yongs su zad pa /
analyzed: srid par sbyor ba yongs su zad pa /
translated: who have extinguished the fetters of existence,

original: yang dag par kun shes pas sems shin tu rnam par grol ba /
analyzed: yang dag par kun shes pas sems shin tu rnam par grol ba /
translated: who have liberated their minds through perfect understanding,

original: sems kyi dbang dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa de dag gis bsod nams mngon par 'du mdzad de dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang / rgyal rigs s'a la chen po rnams sam /
analyzed: sems kyi dbang dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa de dag gis bsod nams mngon par 'du mdzad de dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang / rgyal rigs s'a la chen po rnams sam /
translated: The Blessed Buddhas, who have perfected the control of mind, together with the community of śrāvakas, have accumulated merit, planted roots of virtue, and attained the highest, complete enlightenment.🔽The great sāla tree-like royal families,

original: bram ze'i rigs s'a la chen po rnams sam /
analyzed: bram ze'i rigs s'a la chen po rnams sam /
translated: the great sāla tree-like brahmin families,

original: khyim bdag gi rigs s'a la chen po rnams sam /
analyzed: khyim bdag gi rigs s'a la chen po rnams sam /
translated: the great sāla tree-like guild families,

original: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha'am /
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha'am /
translated: the Catur­mahā­rāja­kāyika gods,🔽the Trāyastriṃśa gods,🔽the Yāma gods,

original: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'am /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'am /
translated: the Tuṣita gods,

original: 'thab bral lam /🔽dga' ldan nam /
analyzed: 'thab bral lam / dga' ldan nam /
translated: the Nirmāṇarati gods,🔽the Paranirmitavaśavartin gods,🔽the Brahmakāyika gods,🔽the Brahmapurohita gods,🔽the Mahābrahma gods,🔽the Parīttābha gods,🔽the Apramāṇābha gods,🔽the Ābhāsvara gods,🔽the Parīttaśubha gods,🔽the Apramāṇaśubha gods,

original: 'phrul dga' 'am /🔽gzhan 'phrul dbang byed dam /
analyzed: 'phrul dga' 'am / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed dam /
translated: the Śubhakṛtsna gods,🔽the Anabhraka gods,🔽the Puṇyaprasava gods,🔽the Brhatphala gods,

original: tshangs rigs sam /🔽tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don nam /🔽tshangs chen nam /
analyzed: tshangs rigs sam / tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don nam / tshangs chen nam /
translated: and the Śuddhāvāsa gods,🔽 Translation: The Blessed Buddhas, who have perfected the control of mind, together with the community of śrāvakas, have accumulated merit, planted roots of virtue, and attained the highest, complete enlightenment.🔽The great sāla tree-like royal families,

original: 'od chung ngam /🔽tshad med 'od dam /
analyzed: 'od chung ngam / tshad med 'od dam /
translated: the great sāla tree-like brahmin families,🔽the great sāla tree-like guild families,🔽the Catur­mahā­rāja­kāyika gods,🔽the Trāyastriṃśa gods,🔽the Yāma gods,🔽the Tuṣita gods,🔽the Nirmāṇarati gods,🔽the Paranirmitavaśavartin gods,

original: 'od gsal lam /
analyzed: 'od gsal lam /
translated: the Brahmakāyika gods,🔽the Brahmapurohita gods,🔽the Mahābrahma gods,🔽the Parīttābha gods,🔽the Apramāṇābha gods,🔽the Ābhāsvara gods,

original: dge chung ngam /
analyzed: dge chung ngam /
translated: the Parīttaśubha gods,

original: tshad med dge 'am /
analyzed: tshad med dge 'am /
translated: the Apramāṇaśubha gods,

original: dge rgyas sam /
analyzed: dge rgyas sam /
translated: the Śubhakṛtsna gods,

original: sprin med dam /
analyzed: sprin med dam /
translated: the Anabhraka gods,

original: bsod nams 'phel lam /
analyzed: bsod nams 'phel lam /
translated: the Puṇyaprasava gods,

original: 'bras bu che ba'am /
analyzed: 'bras bu che ba'am /
translated: the Brhatphala gods,

original: gnas gtsang ma pa'am /
analyzed: gnas gtsang ma pa'am /
translated: and the Śuddhāvā

original: mi che ba'am /🔽mi gdung ba'am /🔽legs mthong ba'am /🔽rab lta ba'am /
analyzed: mi che ba'am / mi gdung ba'am / legs mthong ba'am / rab lta ba'am /
translated: or among the gods of the Heaven of No Haste,🔽or among the gods of the Heaven of Joy,🔽or among the gods of the Heaven of Good Vision,

original: 'og min gyi lha rnams kyi yang rung ste /
analyzed: 'og min gyi lha rnams kyi yang rung ste /
translated: or among the gods of the Highest Heaven,🔽all of those roots of virtue, having gathered them together, having combined them, having made them into one whole,🔽having rejoiced in them,🔽having rejoiced in the highest way,🔽having rejoiced in the most excellent way,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed ba de dag thams cad mngon par bsdus te gcig tu btul nas bsnyams te /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed ba de dag thams cad mngon par bsdus te gcig tu btul nas bsnyams te /
translated: having rejoiced in the most sublime way,🔽having rejoiced in the unsurpassed way,🔽having rejoiced in the supreme way,🔽having rejoiced in the most special way,🔽having rejoiced in the best way,🔽having rejoiced in the foremost way,🔽having rejoiced in the most excellent way,🔽having rejoiced in the most sublime way,🔽having rejoiced in the unsurpassed way,🔽having rejoiced in the supreme way,🔽having rejoiced in the most special way,🔽having rejoiced in the best way,🔽having rejoiced in the foremost way,🔽having rejoiced in the most excellent way,🔽having rejoiced in the most sublime way,🔽having rejoiced in the unsurpassed way,🔽having rejoiced in the supreme way,🔽having rejoiced in the most special way,🔽having rejoiced in the best way,

original: rjes su yi rang ba /🔽rab / dam pa /
analyzed: rjes su yi rang ba / rab / dam pa /
translated: having rejoiced in the foremost way,🔽having rejoiced in the most excellent way,🔽having rejoiced in the most sublime way,🔽having rejoiced in the unsurpassed way,🔽having rejoiced in the supreme way,🔽having rejoiced in the most special way,🔽having rejoiced in the best way,🔽having rejoiced in the foremost way,🔽having rejoiced in the most excellent way,

original: gtso bo mchog rab /
analyzed: gtso bo mchog rab /
translated: having rejoiced in the most sublime way,🔽having rejoiced in the unsurpassed way,

original: mchog phul du phyin pa /
analyzed: mchog phul du phyin pa /
translated: having rejoiced in the supreme way,🔽having rejoiced in the most special way,🔽having rejoiced in the best way,🔽having rejoiced in the foremost way,🔽having rejoiced in the most excellent way,🔽having rejoiced in the most sublime way,🔽having rejoiced in the unsurpassed way,

original: gong na med pa'i rjes su yi rang bas rjes su yi rang ste /
analyzed: gong na med pa'i rjes su yi rang bas rjes su yi rang ste /
translated: having rejoiced in the supreme way,🔽having rejoiced in the most special way,🔽having rejoiced in the best way,🔽having rejoiced in the foremost way,🔽having rejoiced in the most excellent way,🔽having rejoiced in the most sublime way,

original: rjes su yi rang nas kyang rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su @116b bsngo bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni dmigs su med pa'i yongs su bsngo ba yin no //
analyzed: rjes su yi rang nas kyang rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su @116b bsngo bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni dmigs su med pa'i yongs su bsngo ba yin no //
translated: having rejoiced in the unsurpassed way,

original: byams pas smras pa /
analyzed: byams pas smras pa /
translated: having rejoiced in the supreme way,🔽having rejoiced in the most special way,🔽having rejoiced in the best way,🔽having rejoiced in the foremost way,🔽having rejoiced in the most excellent way,🔽having rejoiced in the most sublime

original: btsun pa rab 'byor gal te theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag thams cad la sems shing bsams nas rjes🔽su yi rang ba'i rab kyis rjes su yi rang bar byas te /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor gal te theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag thams cad la sems shing bsams nas rjes su yi rang ba'i rab kyis rjes su yi rang bar byas te /
translated: Venerable Subhūti, if a bodhisattva great being who is a beginner, having reflected on and considered all the roots of virtue of the lord buddhas together with their saṅgha of hearers,🔽were to rejoice in them with the highest rejoicing,

original: rjes su yi rang ba gong na med pa'i bar gyis rjes su yi rang bas rjes su yi rang bar byas nas /
analyzed: rjes su yi rang ba gong na med pa'i bar gyis rjes su yi rang bas rjes su yi rang bar byas nas /
translated: were to rejoice in them with the highest form of rejoicing,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su sngo bar byed na /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su sngo bar byed na /
translated: and were to dedicate them to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'du shes phyin ci log tu mi 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'du shes phyin ci log tu mi 'gyur ba yin /
translated: how would that bodhisattva great being not have mistaken perception,

original: sems phyin ci log tu mi 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: sems phyin ci log tu mi 'gyur ba yin /
translated: not have mistaken mind,

original: lta ba phyin ci log tu mi 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: lta ba phyin ci log tu mi 'gyur ba yin /
translated: and not have mistaken view?

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,🔽“Kauśika, it is so!

original: byams pa gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa de dag las kyang de la sangs rgyas su 'du shes par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: byams pa gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa de dag las kyang de la sangs rgyas su 'du shes par mi 'gyur /
translated: Maitreya, if a bodhisattva great being does not even conceive of those blessed buddhas and their communities of śrāvakas as buddhas,

original: nyan thos su 'du shes par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: nyan thos su 'du shes par mi 'gyur /
translated: does not conceive of them as śrāvakas,

original: dge ba'i rtsa bar 'du shes par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa bar 'du shes par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: and does not conceive of them as roots of virtue,

original: sems gang gis yongs su bsngo ba'i sems de la yang sems kyi 'du shes su mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: sems gang gis yongs su bsngo ba'i sems de la yang sems kyi 'du shes su mi 'gyur na /
translated: and if he does not conceive of the mind by which he dedicates,

original: de ltar yongs su bsngo ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la 'du shes phyin ci log tu 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: de ltar yongs su bsngo ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la 'du shes phyin ci log tu 'gyur ba med do //
translated: then the bodhisattva great being who dedicates in this way does not have a distorted perception,

original: sems phyin ci log tu 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: sems phyin ci log tu 'gyur ba med do //
translated: does not have a distorted mind,

original: lta ba phyin ci log tu 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: lta ba phyin ci log tu 'gyur ba med do //
translated: and does not have a distorted view.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag kyang /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag kyang /
translated: If a bodhisattva great being does not even conceive of those blessed buddhas,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems kyis sems shing mtshan mar 'dzin pas mtshan mar bzung nas /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sems kyis sems shing mtshan mar 'dzin pas mtshan mar bzung nas /
translated: When they think about those wholesome roots, they grasp at signs, and having grasped at signs,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo na /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo na /
translated: they dedicate them to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de ltar yongs su sngo bar byed pa'i 'du shes phyin ci log tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yongs su sngo bar byed pa'i 'du shes phyin ci log tu 'gyur ro //
translated: In that way, the perception of those who dedicate [merit] becomes distorted.

original: sems phyin ci log tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems phyin ci log tu 'gyur ro //
translated: The mind becomes distorted.

original: lta ba phyin ci log tu 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: lta ba phyin ci log tu 'gyur ro ;
translated: The view becomes distorted.

original: / gal te yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag la sems gang gis yang dag par sems shing 'di ltar zad pa la zad ces bya bar shes na gang zag des yongs su bsngo bar mi nus so //
analyzed: / gal te yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag la sems gang gis yang dag par sems shing 'di ltar zad pa la zad ces bya bar shes na gang zag des yongs su bsngo bar mi nus so //
translated: If, moreover, a bodhisattva great being thinks about those blessed buddhas and those wholesome roots with a mind that thinks, ‘When they are extinguished, they are extinguished,’ that person is unable to dedicate [merit].

original: sems gang gis yongs su bsngo @117a * //
analyzed: sems gang gis yongs su bsngo @117a * //
translated: The mind with which one dedicates

original: ba'i sems de nyid kyi chos nyid kyang de yin la /
analyzed: ba'i sems de nyid kyi chos nyid kyang de yin la /
translated: is also the reality of that mind.

original: der yongs su bsngo ba de yang chos nyid do zhes gal te de ltar yongs su bsngo na yang dag par yongs su bsngo ba ste /
analyzed: der yongs su bsngo ba de yang chos nyid do zhes gal te de ltar yongs su bsngo na yang dag par yongs su bsngo ba ste /
translated: If he dedicates in this way, it is a correct dedication,

original: log pa ma yin no //
analyzed: log pa ma yin no //
translated: not a mistaken one.🔽In this way, a bodhisattva great being should dedicate.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos yongs su bsngo bar bya'o //🔽gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis thugs dang po bskyed pa nas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar dang / dam pa'i chos nub pa'i bar dang /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos yongs su bsngo bar bya'o // gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis thugs dang po bskyed pa nas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar dang / dam pa'i chos nub pa'i bar dang /
translated: If a bodhisattva great being dedicates the roots of virtue in this way,🔽then all the roots of virtue of the past, future, and present buddhas, the blessed ones, from the time they first gave rise to the mind of awakening up until the complete nirvana of their true teachings,

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas de dag dang / so so'i skye bo mang pos dge ba'i rtsa ba gang ci snyed cig bskyed pa dang / chos bstan pa gang ci snyed cig thos pa dang / de dag tu lha dang / klu dang /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas de dag dang / so so'i skye bo mang pos dge ba'i rtsa ba gang ci snyed cig bskyed pa dang / chos bstan pa gang ci snyed cig thos pa dang / de dag tu lha dang / klu dang /

original: gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dag gis dge ba'i rtsa ba gang ji snyed cig bskyed pa dang / rgyal rigs s'a la chen po rnams sam /
analyzed: gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dag gis dge ba'i rtsa ba gang ji snyed cig bskyed pa dang / rgyal rigs s'a la chen po rnams sam /
translated: the roots of virtue that have been produced by the kṣatriya clans,

original: bram ze'i rigs s'a la chen po rnams sam /
analyzed: bram ze'i rigs s'a la chen po rnams sam /
translated: the roots of virtue that have been produced by the brahmin clans,

original: khyim bdag gi rigs s'a la chen po rnams sam /
analyzed: khyim bdag gi rigs s'a la chen po rnams sam /
translated: the roots of virtue that have been produced by the householder clans,

original: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams sam /
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams sam /
translated: the roots of virtue that have been produced by the devas of the Catur­mahā­rāja­kāyika realm,

original: 'og min gyi bar gyi lha rnams kyis dam pa'i chos thos pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa de thams cad mngon par bsdus te gcig tu btul nas bsnyams te /
analyzed: 'og min gyi bar gyi lha rnams kyis dam pa'i chos thos pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa de thams cad mngon par bsdus te gcig tu btul nas bsnyams te /
translated: up to the roots of virtue that have been produced by the devas of the Akaniṣṭha realm, after hearing the Dharma and producing roots of virtue, and arousing the mind of unsurpassed, complete enlightenment, all of that is gathered together, combined, and weighed,

original: rjes su yi rang ba'i bar gyis rjes su yi rang zhing rjes su yi rang ba dam pa /🔽gtso bo / mchog rab /
analyzed: rjes su yi rang ba'i bar gyis rjes su yi rang zhing rjes su yi rang ba dam pa / gtso bo / mchog rab /
translated: and with the rejoicing, one rejoices with the highest rejoicing,🔽the foremost, the best,

original: mchog / phul du phyin pa /
analyzed: mchog / phul du phyin pa /
translated: the supreme, the most excellent,

original: gong na med pa /
analyzed: gong na med pa /
translated: the unsurpassed,

original: mnyam pa med pa /🔽mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pas rjes su yi rang ste /
analyzed: mnyam pa med pa / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pas rjes su yi rang ste /
translated: equal to the unequaled,🔽and having rejoiced, he dedicates all that to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽If he dedicates in that way, he dedicates to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽If he dedicates in that way, he dedicates to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽If he dedicates in that way, he dedicates to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rjes su yi rang bar byas nas de thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo zhing gal te 'di ltar chos 'di dag ni zad do //🔽'gags so // med do //🔽rnam par gyur to //🔽gang du yongs su bsngo ba'i sems de yang rang bzhin gyis stong pa'o zhes shes par byas la /
analyzed: rjes su yi rang bar byas nas de thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo zhing gal te 'di ltar chos 'di dag ni zad do // 'gags so // med do // rnam par gyur to // gang du yongs su bsngo ba'i sems de yang rang bzhin gyis stong pa'o zhes shes par byas la /
translated: If he dedicates in that way, he dedicates to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽If he dedicates in that way, he dedicates to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽If he dedicates in that way, he dedicates to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽If he dedicates in that way, he dedicates to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: gal te de ltar yongs su bsngo na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa yin no //🔽gal te 'di ltar chos kyis chos yongs su bsngo bar mi bya ste /🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar yongs su bsngo na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa yin no // gal te 'di ltar chos kyis chos yongs su bsngo bar mi bya ste / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If he dedicates in that way, he dedicates to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽If he dedicates in that way, he dedicates to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽If he dedicates in that way, he dedicates to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽If he dedicates in that way, he dedicates to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽If he dedicates in that way, he dedicates to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽If he dedicates in that way, he dedicates to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽If he dedicates in that way, he dedicates to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽If he dedicates in that way, he dedicates to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽If he dedicates in that way, he dedicates to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽If he dedicates in that way, he dedicates to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽If he dedicates in that way, he dedicates to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽If he dedicates in that way, he dedicates to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽If he dedicates in that way, he dedicates to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽If he dedicates in that way, he dedicates to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽If he dedicates in that way, he dedicates to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽If he dedicates in that way, he dedicates to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de ni 'di ltar chos thams cad rang @117b bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar shes la /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar chos thams cad rang @117b bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar shes la /
translated: If he dedicates in that way, he dedicates to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽If he dedic

original: gal te de ltar yongs su bsngo na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te de ltar yongs su bsngo na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba yin no //
translated: If he dedicates in this way, it is a dedication to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽In this way, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: and similarly practicing the perfection of concentration, perfection of perseverance, perfection of patience,

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: perfection of morality, and perfection of giving,

original: 'du shes phyin ci log tu mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'du shes phyin ci log tu mi 'gyur ro //
translated: do not have distorted perception,

original: sems phyin ci log tu mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems phyin ci log tu mi 'gyur ro //
translated: do not have distorted thought,

original: lta ba phyin ci log tu mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lta ba phyin ci log tu mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and do not have distorted view.

original: de ci'i phyir zhen /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhen /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yongs su bsngo ba de la mngon par chags pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yongs su bsngo ba de la mngon par chags pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because the bodhisattva great beings do not settle down on that dedication.

original: gang du chags par 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag dang / byang chub kyi sems de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang du chags par 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag dang / byang chub kyi sems de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he does not see those wholesome roots and that thought of awakening in which he might become attached.🔽This is the bodhisattva great being’s unsurpassed dedication.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yongs su bsngo ba bla na med pa'o zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'i mtshan nyid kyis yongs su bsngo ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yongs su bsngo ba bla na med pa'o zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'i mtshan nyid kyis yongs su bsngo ba yin no //
translated: This is the dedication that has the defining characteristic of being unmistaken.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po mngon par 'du bya ba de phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams kyis dben par shes /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po mngon par 'du bya ba de phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams kyis dben par shes /
translated: If a bodhisattva great being knows that the performance of the thing to be done that consists in merit is empty of the aggregates, elements, and sense fields,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas dben par shes te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas dben par shes te /
translated: and knows that it is empty of the perfection of wisdom,

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas dben par shes /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas dben par shes /
translated: Similarly, they know that the transcendent perfection of meditative stability, the transcendent perfection of perseverance, the transcendent perfection of tolerance, the transcendent perfection of ethical discipline, and the transcendent perfection of generosity are void.

original: nang stong pa nyid kyis dben par shes /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid kyis dben par shes /
translated: They know that inner emptiness is void.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyis dben par shes /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyis dben par shes /
translated: They know that the other aspects of emptiness, up to and including the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities, are void.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyis dben par shes /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyis dben par shes /
translated: They know that the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment are void.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyis dben par shes na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyis dben par shes na /
translated: They know that the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four assurances, the four kinds of exact knowledge, and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas are void.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po mngon par 'du bya ba de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po mngon par 'du bya ba de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa yin no //
translated: In this way, the bodhisattva mahāsattva dedicates that activity that creates merit to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: @118a * // gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po de bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kyis dben par shes te /
analyzed: @118a * // gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po de bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kyis dben par shes te /
translated: “If the bodhisattva mahāsattva knows that activity that creates merit endowed with rejoicing is isolated in the intrinsic nature of that activity that creates merit,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag ni sangs rgyas kyi ngo bo nyid kyis dben no //🔽dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag ni dge ba'i rtsa ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis dben no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag ni sangs rgyas kyi ngo bo nyid kyis dben no // dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag ni dge ba'i rtsa ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis dben no //
translated: those lord buddhas are isolated in the intrinsic nature of a buddha,🔽those wholesome roots are isolated in the intrinsic nature of wholesome roots,

original: mngon par 'du bya ba de dag ni mngon par 'du bya ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis dben no //
analyzed: mngon par 'du bya ba de dag ni mngon par 'du bya ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis dben no //
translated: those activities are isolated in the intrinsic nature of activities,

original: byang chub kyi sems de ni byang chub sems kyi ngo bo nyid kyis dben no //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems de ni byang chub sems kyi ngo bo nyid kyis dben no //
translated: and that thought of awakening is isolated in the intrinsic nature of a thought of awakening,

original: yongs su bsngo ba'i sems ni yongs su bsngo ba'i sems kyi ngo bo nyid kyis dben no //
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba'i sems ni yongs su bsngo ba'i sems kyi ngo bo nyid kyis dben no //
translated: The thought of dedication is isolated from the thought of dedication by the emptiness of the thought of dedication.

original: byang chub kyang byang chub kyi ngo bo nyid kyis dben no //
analyzed: byang chub kyang byang chub kyi ngo bo nyid kyis dben no //
translated: Awakening is isolated from awakening by the emptiness of awakening.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis dben no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis dben no //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is isolated from the perfection of wisdom by the emptiness of the perfection of wisdom.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis dben no //🔽brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis dben no //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis dben no // brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis dben no //
translated: The perfection of concentration is isolated from the perfection of concentration by the emptiness of the perfection of concentration.🔽The perfection of perseverance is isolated from the perfection of perseverance by the emptiness of the perfection of perseverance.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis dben no //
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis dben no //
translated: The perfection of patience is isolated from the perfection of patience by the emptiness of the perfection of patience.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis dben no //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis dben no //
translated: The perfection of morality is isolated from the perfection of morality by the emptiness of the perfection of morality.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis dben no //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis dben no //
translated: The perfection of generosity is void of the perfection of generosity.

original: nang stong pa nyid ni nang stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis dben no //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid ni nang stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis dben no //
translated: The emptiness of internal phenomena is void of the emptiness of internal phenomena.

original: phyi stong pa nyid ni phyi stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis dben no //
analyzed: phyi stong pa nyid ni phyi stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis dben no //
translated: The emptiness of external phenomena is void of the emptiness of external phenomena.

original: phyi nang stong pa nyid ni phyi nang stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis dben no //
analyzed: phyi nang stong pa nyid ni phyi nang stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis dben no //
translated: The emptiness of both external and internal phenomena is void of the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyis dben no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyis dben no //
translated: Up to the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities is void of the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities.

original: de bzhin du byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang /
translated: In the same way, the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment, the noble truths, the immeasurables, the concentrations, the formless absorptions, the eight liberations,

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang /
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang /
translated: all the dhāraṇī gateways,🔽the ten powers,🔽the fearlessnesses,🔽the detailed and thorough knowledges,

original: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ni sangs @118b rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi ngo bo nyid kyis dben no zhes de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos dben pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par
analyzed: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ni sangs @118b rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi ngo bo nyid kyis dben no zhes de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos dben pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par
translated: and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are void of the intrinsic nature of the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.🔽In that way, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should practice the perfection of wisdom that is void.🔽This is the perfection of wisdom of bodhisattva great beings.”

original: bya ste / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni dben pa'i yongs su bsngo ba yin no //
analyzed: bya ste / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni dben pa'i yongs su bsngo ba yin no //
translated: That is the dedication of the void.

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag thams cad rjes su dran par byas nas 'di ltar yongs su bsngo bar bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag thams cad rjes su dran par byas nas 'di ltar yongs su bsngo bar bya ste /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva mahāsattva, having recalled all those roots of virtue of those blessed buddhas, should dedicate them in the following way:

original: yongs su bsngo ba ci 'dra ba kho nar gang gis yongs su sngo bar byed pa'i sems kyang de 'dra ba kho na ste /
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba ci 'dra ba kho nar gang gis yongs su sngo bar byed pa'i sems kyang de 'dra ba kho na ste /
translated: “Just as is the dedication, so is the mind that is dedicating.

original: de'i rigs can dang / de'i rang bzhin can no zhes gal te de ltar yongs su shes na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba yin /
analyzed: de'i rigs can dang / de'i rang bzhin can no zhes gal te de ltar yongs su shes na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba yin /
translated: If one understands it in this way, it is a dedication to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de ltar yongs su bsngo na 'du shes phyin ci log pa ma yin /
analyzed: de ltar yongs su bsngo na 'du shes phyin ci log pa ma yin /
translated: If one dedicates in this way, it is not a mistaken perception,

original: sems phyin ci log pa ma yin ;
analyzed: sems phyin ci log pa ma yin ;
translated: it is not a mistaken mind,

original: lta ba phyin ci log pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lta ba phyin ci log pa ma yin no //
translated: it is not a mistaken view.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mtshan ma'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mtshan ma'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
translated: If the bodhisattva mahāsattva practices the perfection of wisdom with the method of signs,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su shes na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su shes na /
translated: If they were to understand the wholesome roots of those Buddhas,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba ma yin no //🔽'das pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ji snyed pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa de dag kyang mtshan ma ma yin /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba ma yin no // 'das pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ji snyed pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa de dag kyang mtshan ma ma yin /
translated: the Blessed Ones, they would not dedicate them to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: yul ma yin no zhes gal te de ltar sems na yang mtshan mar byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: yul ma yin no zhes gal te de ltar sems na yang mtshan mar byed pa yin gyi /
translated: If they were to think, ‘Those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, who have passed into complete nirvāṇa, and those who are in the present—they are not signs, they are not objects,’ then even if they were to think that, they would be making a sign.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba ma yin te /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba ma yin te /
translated: They would not be dedicating those wholesome roots to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de ltar na de'i 'du shes phyin ci log pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de'i 'du shes phyin ci log pa ma yin no //
translated: In that case, their perception would not be distorted.

original: sems phyin ci log pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sems phyin ci log pa ma yin no //
translated: Their thought would not be distorted.

original: lta ba phyin ci log pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lta ba phyin ci log pa ma yin no //
translated: Their view would not be distorted.

original: gal te sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag dang / mngon par 'du bya ba de dag dang / sems bskyed pa de dag yongs su shes pa med cing mtshan mar mi byed par yongs su bsngo na dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba yin te /
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag dang / mngon par 'du bya ba de dag dang / sems bskyed pa de dag yongs su shes pa med cing mtshan mar mi byed par yongs su bsngo na dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba yin te /
translated: If they dedicate those roots of virtue without knowing those Blessed Buddhas, those acts of making the wholesome increase, and those arousings of the mind, and without taking them as a causal sign, then those roots of virtue are dedicated to full enlightenment.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'du shes phyin ci log pa ma yin /🔽sems @119a * //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'du shes phyin ci log pa ma yin / sems @119a * //
translated: In this way, the perception of the Bodhisattva, the great being, is not inverted,

original: phyin ci log pa ma yin /
analyzed: phyin ci log pa ma yin /
translated: his thought is not inverted,🔽and his view is not inverted.

original: lta ba phyin ci log pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi bsod nams kyi rigs dang rang bzhin rjes su dran pa'i yongs su bsngo ba yin no //
analyzed: lta ba phyin ci log pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi bsod nams kyi rigs dang rang bzhin rjes su dran pa'i yongs su bsngo ba yin no //
translated: This is the dedication that is a recollection of the nature of the Buddha’s merit.

original: byams pas smras pa /
analyzed: byams pas smras pa /
translated: Maitreya said:

original: btsun pa rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mtshan mar mi byed cing yongs su bsngo ba ma yin /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mtshan mar mi byed cing yongs su bsngo ba ma yin /
translated: Venerable Subhūti, how is it that bodhisattva great beings do not make signs and do not dedicate?

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dir thabs mkhas pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dir thabs mkhas pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: “Those bodhisattva great beings should train in the skill in means in this perfection of wisdom.

original: des na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i thabs mkhas par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: des na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i thabs mkhas par rig par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, this perfection of wisdom should be known as the skill in means of bodhisattva great beings.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ma brten par bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po yongs su bsngo bar mi nus so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ma brten par bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po yongs su bsngo bar mi nus so //
translated: Without relying on the perfection of wisdom, it is not possible to dedicate the bases of meritorious action.

original: byams pas smras pa /
analyzed: byams pas smras pa /
translated: Maitreya said,🔽“Venerable Subhūti, how is it that bodhisattva great beings do not make signs and do not dedicate?”

original: btsun pa rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag dang / mngon par 'du bya ba de dag dang / gang gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba'i sems bskyed pa de dag kyang med do zhes bya ba 'di ni skyon du smos par mi 'gyur ram /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag dang / mngon par 'du bya ba de dag dang / gang gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba'i sems bskyed pa de dag kyang med do zhes bya ba 'di ni skyon du smos par mi 'gyur ram /
translated: Venerable Subhūti, would it not be a fault to say that the blessed buddhas, those wholesome roots, those formative factors, and those instances of arousing the mind of awakening that are dedicated to unsurpassed and perfect awakening do not exist in the perfection of wisdom?

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied:

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “In that regard, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: bdag gi lus de dag dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag dang / mngon par 'du bya ba de dag dang / sems bskyed pa de dag 'gag par 'gyur du zin kyang /
analyzed: bdag gi lus de dag dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag dang / mngon par 'du bya ba de dag dang / sems bskyed pa de dag 'gag par 'gyur du zin kyang /
translated: even though their bodies, those wholesome roots, those formative factors, and those instances of arousing the mind of awakening cease,

original: mtshan mar byas nas rnam par rtog par mi bya'o zhes de ltar yongs su brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: mtshan mar byas nas rnam par rtog par mi bya'o zhes de ltar yongs su brtag par bya ste /
translated: they should not conceptualize them by reifying them.”

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag dang / mngon par 'du bya ba de dag dang / sems bskyed pa de dag la mtshan mar byas shing rnam par rtog pa de lta na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis ni de ltar mtshan ma'i tshul gyis yongs su bsngo ba la rjes su dgyes pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag dang / mngon par 'du bya ba de dag dang / sems bskyed pa de dag la mtshan mar byas shing rnam par rtog pa de lta na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis ni de ltar mtshan ma'i tshul gyis yongs su bsngo ba la rjes su dgyes pa dang /
translated: If they were to apprehend and conceptualize those lord buddhas, those wholesome roots, those formative activities, and those arousals of mind as signs, then the tathāgatas, arhats, and perfectly awakened buddhas would not delight in such a dedication that is a method of signs.🔽

original: mngon par bsngags pa mi mdzad do //
analyzed: mngon par bsngags pa mi mdzad do //
translated: The Thus-Gone Ones, the Blessed Ones, do not rejoice in or praise such a dedication that is made with signs and concepts in relation to those buddhas, those roots of virtue, those formative activities, and those arousals of the mind.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: da ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa rnams mtshan mar byas shing rnam par brtags te /
analyzed: da ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa rnams mtshan mar byas shing rnam par brtags te /
translated: Because the buddhas, the blessed ones, who have passed into parinirvāṇa are made into a sign, imagined, and apprehended.

original: dmigs pa ni de'i dmigs pa chen por 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa ni de'i dmigs pa chen por 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That is because it becomes a great object of apprehension.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' @119b sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo bar 'dod pas mi dmigs shing mtshan ma med par byas te yongs su bsngo bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' @119b sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo bar 'dod pas mi dmigs shing mtshan ma med par byas te yongs su bsngo bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who wishes to dedicate those wholesome roots should dedicate them without apprehending anything and without conceptualizing signs.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis ni dmigs pa'i 'du shes can dang / mtshan ma'i 'du shes can gyis yongs su bsngo ba de ni don che bar ma gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis ni dmigs pa'i 'du shes can dang / mtshan ma'i 'du shes can gyis yongs su bsngo ba de ni don che bar ma gsungs so //
translated: The tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas have not said that the dedication of those who have the notion of apprehending and the notion of signs is of great benefit.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?🔽Because that dedication is poisoned and has a thorn in it.

original: yongs su bsngo ba de ni dug can dang zug rdu can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni thabs mkhas pa'i yongs su bsngo ba yin no //
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba de ni dug can dang zug rdu can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni thabs mkhas pa'i yongs su bsngo ba yin no //
translated: This is the dedication with skillful means.

original: 'di lta ste dper na kha zas bsod pa kha dog phun sum tshogs pa dang / dri phun sum tshogs pa zhig yod kyang dug dang bsres par gyur na /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na kha zas bsod pa kha dog phun sum tshogs pa dang / dri phun sum tshogs pa zhig yod kyang dug dang bsres par gyur na /
translated: For example, suppose there were delicious food with perfect color and perfect smell, but it was mixed with poison.

original: kha dog dang dri dang / ros yid du 'ong ba yin mod kyi /
analyzed: kha dog dang dri dang / ros yid du 'ong ba yin mod kyi /
translated: It is indeed pleasant in color, smell, and taste.

original: 'on kyang de la skyes bu byis pa'i ngang tshul can bza' bar sems te /
analyzed: 'on kyang de la skyes bu byis pa'i ngang tshul can bza' bar sems te /
translated: But a foolish person thinks of eating it.

original: des de zos na yang kha dog dang / dri dang ro zhim por tshor mod kyi /
analyzed: des de zos na yang kha dog dang / dri dang ro zhim por tshor mod kyi /
translated: Even though he eats it, he experiences a pleasant color, smell, and taste.

original: zhu bar gyur pa na sdug bsngal gyi rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhu bar gyur pa na sdug bsngal gyi rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: But when it is digested, it has a painful ripening.

original: de bzhin du 'di la log par rig pa dang / log par shes pa dang / log par bslabs pa la don ma rtogs par mi shes shing 'di skad du ston te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di la log par rig pa dang / log par shes pa dang / log par bslabs pa la don ma rtogs par mi shes shing 'di skad du ston te /
translated: In the same way, here, those who have wrong knowledge, wrong understanding, and wrong training, not understanding the meaning, teach this:

original: tshur rigs kyi bu khyod kyis 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thugs dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: tshur rigs kyi bu khyod kyis 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thugs dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: “Come here, son of noble family! From the time you first gave rise to the mind of awakening until

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar dang / dam pa'i chos nub par ma gyur gyi bar du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad de /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar dang / dam pa'i chos nub par ma gyur gyi bar du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad de /
translated: and until they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, and until they pass into the realm of nirvāṇa without any remainder of the aggregates, and until the Dharma they have taught has disappeared, they practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba gang ji snyed cig mngon par 'du mdzad par gyur ba dang / de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba gang ji snyed cig mngon par 'du mdzad par gyur ba dang / de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: Whatever roots of virtue they have created, and similarly, they practice the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience,

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad de /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad de /
translated: the perfection of morality, and the perfection of generosity.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba gang ji snyed cig mngon par 'du mdzad pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang ldan pa dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang ldan pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang ldan pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba gang ji snyed cig mngon par 'du mdzad pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang ldan pa dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang ldan pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang ldan pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang ldan pa dang /
translated: the roots of virtue that he has manifested, the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions, the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa @120a * //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa @120a * //
translated: the four noble truths,

original: bzhi dang ldan pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang ldan pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang ldan pa dang / mngon par shes pa lnga dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: bzhi dang ldan pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang ldan pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang ldan pa dang / mngon par shes pa lnga dang ldan pa dang /
translated: emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness, the eight aspects of liberation, the nine serial steps of meditative absorption, the five kinds of supernormal knowledge,

original: stong pa nyid thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang ldan pa dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang ldan pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang ldan pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: stong pa nyid thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang ldan pa dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang ldan pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang ldan pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang ldan pa dang /
translated: the emptinesses, the dhāraṇī gateways, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba gang ji snyed cig mngon par 'du mdzad pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon par 'du mdzad pa gang dag gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa dang / sems can mang po yongs su smin par mdzad pa dang /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba gang ji snyed cig mngon par 'du mdzad pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon par 'du mdzad pa gang dag gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa dang / sems can mang po yongs su smin par mdzad pa dang /
translated: Whatever roots of virtue he has manifested and whatever roots of virtue he has manifested, through which he has purified a buddhafield, brought beings to maturity,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi tshul khrims kyi phung po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang / shes rab kyi phung po dang / rnam par grol pa'i phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi tshul khrims kyi phung po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang / shes rab kyi phung po dang / rnam par grol pa'i phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po dang /
translated: the aggregates of their discipline,🔽concentration, wisdom, liberation, and the wisdom and vision of liberation;

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / bsnyel ba mi mda' ba'i chos nyid kyi ye shes dang / rtag tu btang snyoms su gnas pa dang / der nyan thos gang dag gis dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon par 'du byas pa dang /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / bsnyel ba mi mda' ba'i chos nyid kyi ye shes dang / rtag tu btang snyoms su gnas pa dang / der nyan thos gang dag gis dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon par 'du byas pa dang /
translated: their knowledge of omniscience, their knowledge of the nature of nonforgetfulness, their constant state of equanimity, and the roots of virtue that were created by their śrāvakas;

original: gang yang rang sangs rgyas rnams nyid lung bstan pa dang / der lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po gang dag gis dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon par 'du byas pa de dag thams cad mngon par bsdus te gcig tu btul zhing bsnyams te /
