analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba dang / tshul khrims kyi phung po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang ; shes rab kyi phung po dang /
translated: the perfection of diligence, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom, and the aggregate of discipline, the aggregate of concentration, the aggregate of wisdom,

original: rnam par grol ba'i phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos gzhal du med pa gzhan dag kyang rung ste /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos gzhal du med pa gzhan dag kyang rung ste /
translated: the aggregate of liberation, the aggregate of the vision of the wisdom of liberation, and the other immeasurable qualities of a buddha,

original: de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus nas dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo @126b ba bas /
analyzed: de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus nas dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo @126b ba bas /
translated: and dedicating all of them together to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening by way of an objective mental support.

original: rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Son of a good family or

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs par gyur te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs par gyur te /
translated: daughter of a good family who has set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening

original: des 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang bcas pa de dag gi sems dang po bskyed pa nas /
analyzed: des 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang bcas pa de dag gi sems dang po bskyed pa nas /
translated: should dedicate to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening the wholesome roots of the past, future, and present lord buddhas together with the śrāvaka saṅghas and the pratyekabuddhas, beginning with the first production of the thought of

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i bar dang / phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar dang / dam pa'i chos gnas pa'i bar gyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de rnams dang /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i bar dang / phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar dang / dam pa'i chos gnas pa'i bar gyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de rnams dang /
translated: from their first arousal of the mind of awakening up through their manifest, perfect buddhahood in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, and from there up through their parinirvāṇa in the element of nirvāṇa without any remainder of the skandhas, and from there up through the duration of their sacred Dharma,

original: nyan thos de rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas de rnams dang / de las gzhan pa'i sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: nyan thos de rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas de rnams dang / de las gzhan pa'i sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: and the roots of virtue of those śrāvakas, those pratyekabuddhas, and all other sentient beings—the roots of virtue of their perfections of generosity, of ethical conduct, of patience,

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos gzhal du med pa'i bar de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus shing gcig tu bsdoms te /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos gzhal du med pa'i bar de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus shing gcig tu bsdoms te /
translated: the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, the perfection of wisdom, up to the immeasurable qualities of the Buddha, and having combined and gathered them all together,

original: gzhal nas dmigs su med pa'i tshul dang / gnyis su med pa'i tshul dang / mtshan ma med pa'i tshul dang / chags pa med pa'i tshul dang / byed pa med pa'i tshul dang / rjes su yi rang ba'i bar gyis rjes su yi rang zhing rjes su yi rang nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo na /🔽rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: gzhal nas dmigs su med pa'i tshul dang / gnyis su med pa'i tshul dang / mtshan ma med pa'i tshul dang / chags pa med pa'i tshul dang / byed pa med pa'i tshul dang / rjes su yi rang ba'i bar gyis rjes su yi rang zhing rjes su yi rang nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo na / rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: having measured them in a way that is not apprehended, in a way that is nondual, in a way that is signless, in a way that is free of attachment, in a way that is free of action, up to rejoicing, and having rejoiced, dedicates them to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽If that son of a good family or

original: rigs kyi bu mo de ni rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de ni rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: daughter of a good family

original: rigs kyi bu mo snga ma de dag pas bsod nams ches mang du 'phel te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo snga ma de dag pas bsod nams ches mang du 'phel te /
translated: increases much more merit than those previous sons of a good family or🔽daughters of a good family,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di la ni dge ba'i rtsa ba snga ma des brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di la ni dge ba'i rtsa ba snga ma des brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro /
translated: This root of merit is not even a hundredth part of the former root of merit.

original: rgyu'i bar du yang mi bzod de /
analyzed: rgyu'i bar du yang mi bzod de /
translated: It is not even a thousandth part, or a hundred thousandth part, or a one with a hundred zeros after it part, or a one with a thousand zeros after it part, or a one with a hundred thousand zeros after it part, or any number, fraction, or comparison of the former root of merit.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dmigs su med pa'i tshul gyis yongs su bsngo ba 'di ni rab ces bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dmigs su med pa'i tshul gyis yongs su bsngo ba 'di ni rab ces bya'o //
translated: The dedication of the bodhisattva mahāsattva, which is without reference point, is the best.

original: bla na med pa'i bar gyis zhes bya ba ni yongs su bsngo ba'i byed pa yin te /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i bar gyis zhes bya ba ni yongs su bsngo ba'i byed pa yin te /
translated: The phrase “up to unsurpassed” indicates the function of dedication.

original: 'di dag gis ni yongs su bsngo ba yid la byed pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni yongs su bsngo ba yid la byed pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: These lines explain the mental activity of dedication.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Su­bhūti said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: “Blessed One, a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang gis rjes su yi rang ba dang / yongs su @127a * //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang gis rjes su yi rang ba dang / yongs su @127a * //
translated: who rejoices in this way and dedicates

original: bsngo ba'i bsod nams kyi phung po'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus shing bsdoms te gzhal nas rjes su yi rang ba'i bar gyis rjes su yi rang na /
analyzed: bsngo ba'i bsod nams kyi phung po'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus shing bsdoms te gzhal nas rjes su yi rang ba'i bar gyis rjes su yi rang na /
translated: If they were to gather together and add up all those roots of virtue, the mass of merit of the dedication, and rejoice in them,

original: bcom ldan 'das ji tsam gyis rjes su yi rang bar rab tu 'gyur /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji tsam gyis rjes su yi rang bar rab tu 'gyur /
translated: Blessed One, how much would their rejoicing be?

original: rjes su yi rang ba gong na med pa'i bar du 'gyur ba lags /
analyzed: rjes su yi rang ba gong na med pa'i bar du 'gyur ba lags /
translated: How would it be the highest rejoicing?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: nam rigs kyi bu'am /🔽rigs kyi bu mo de 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas dang bcas pa dang /
analyzed: nam rigs kyi bu'am / rigs kyi bu mo de 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas dang bcas pa dang /
translated: “When a son of noble family🔽or a daughter of noble family does not take up or give up the roots of virtue of the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas of the past, future, and present, together with their saṅgha of hearers and their solitary buddhas,

original: gzhan yang sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag mi len mi gtong ba dang / mi rlom zhing dmigs pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag mi len mi gtong ba dang / mi rlom zhing dmigs pa yang ma yin la /
translated: and of all sentient beings, and does not think of them or observe them,

original: de 'di snyam du 'di la chos gang yang skye ba yang med /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du 'di la chos gang yang skye ba yang med /
translated: He thinks, “Here, there is no arising of any phenomenon.

original: 'gag pa yang med /
analyzed: 'gag pa yang med /
translated: There is no cessation.

original: kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba yang med /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba yang med /
translated: There is no affliction.

original: rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba yang med de /
analyzed: rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba yang med de /
translated: There is no purification.

original: chos de dag la 'grib pa yang med /
analyzed: chos de dag la 'grib pa yang med /
translated: There is no decrease in those phenomena.

original: 'phel ba yang med /🔽'ong ba yang med /
analyzed: 'phel ba yang med / 'ong ba yang med /
translated: There is no increase.🔽There is no coming.

original: 'gro ba yang med /
analyzed: 'gro ba yang med /
translated: There is no going.

original: phung por 'gyur ba yang med /
analyzed: phung por 'gyur ba yang med /
translated: There is no aggregation.

original: dngos po yang med /
analyzed: dngos po yang med /
translated: There is no entity.🔽There is no nonentity.”

original: dngos po med pa yang med do zhes rnam grangs de lta bus 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang /
analyzed: dngos po med pa yang med do zhes rnam grangs de lta bus 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang /
translated: In this way, he understands the suchness, the unmistaken suchness, the unaltered suchness, the dharma-constituent, the establishment of dharmas, the certification of dharmas of past, future, and present phenomena.

original: chos nyid dang / chos kyi gnas nyid dang / chos skyon med pa nyid ji lta ba de ltar bdag gis rjes su yi rang bar bya'o rjes su yi rang nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba'o zhes de ltar yongs su bsngo ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems
analyzed: chos nyid dang / chos kyi gnas nyid dang / chos skyon med pa nyid ji lta ba de ltar bdag gis rjes su yi rang bar bya'o rjes su yi rang nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba'o zhes de ltar yongs su bsngo ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems
translated: “I rejoice in the way things really are, in the real nature of things, in the dharma-constituent, in the dharma-element, and in the establishment of dharmas, and having rejoiced, I dedicate it to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: dpa' chen po'i rjes su yi rang ba de ni rab tu 'gyur ba /
analyzed: dpa' chen po'i rjes su yi rang ba de ni rab tu 'gyur ba /
translated: Subhūti, that rejoicing of bodhisattva great beings who dedicate in that way is the best,

original: rjes su yi rang ba gong na med pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rjes su yi rang ba gong na med pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: up to the highest rejoicing.

original: rab 'byor rjes su yi rang ba 'di la ni de ma yin pa'i rjes su yi rang ba gzhan thams cad kyis brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro /
analyzed: rab 'byor rjes su yi rang ba 'di la ni de ma yin pa'i rjes su yi rang ba gzhan thams cad kyis brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro /
translated: Subhūti, all other kinds of rejoicing do not approach even a hundredth part of that rejoicing,

original: rgyu'i bar du yang nye bar mi bzod de /
analyzed: rgyu'i bar du yang nye bar mi bzod de /
translated: up to do not stand up to a fraction of it.

original: rjes su yi rang ba 'di ni de ma yin pa'i rjes su yi rang ba gzhan yang dag pas rab ces bya'o //
analyzed: rjes su yi rang ba 'di ni de ma yin pa'i rjes su yi rang ba gzhan yang dag pas rab ces bya'o //
translated: This rejoicing is the best of all other kinds of rejoicing,

original: gtso bo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gtso bo zhes bya'o //
translated: is the foremost,

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /🔽rigs kyi bu mo 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par @127b rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa dang / rang sangs rgyas su bcas pa de dag gis sems dang po bskyed pa nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i bar dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'i rigs kyi bu'am / rigs kyi bu mo 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par @127b rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa dang / rang sangs rgyas su bcas pa de dag gis sems dang po bskyed pa nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i bar dang /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family who is a beginner in the vehicle should, with regard to the wholesome roots of the past, future, and present tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas together with their śrāvaka saṅghas and together with their pratyekabuddhas, from the time they first produced the thought of awakening up to the complete buddhahood in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,🔽from the time they fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening up to the time they fully passed into the nirvāṇa without any remainder of the aggregates, and from the time the true Dharma remained up to the time the true Dharma disappeared, should, with regard to the wholesome roots of the bodhisattvas, the great beings, from the time they first produced the thought of awakening up to the time they fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,🔽from the time they fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening up to the time they fully passed into the nirvāṇa without any remainder of the aggregates, and from the time the true Dharma remained up to the time the true Dharma disappeared, should, with regard to the wholesome roots of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, from the time they first produced the thought of awakening up to the time they fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,🔽from the time they fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening up to the time they fully passed into the nirvāṇa without any remainder of the aggregates, and from the time the true Dharma remained up to the time the true Dharma disappeared, should, with regard to the wholesome roots of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, from the time they first produced the thought of awakening up to the time they fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar dang / dam pa'i chos gnas pa'i bar gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa dang / de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar dang / dam pa'i chos gnas pa'i bar gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa dang / de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: from the time they fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening up to the time they fully passed into the nirvāṇa without any remainder of the aggregates, and from the time the true Dharma remained up to the time the true Dharma disappeared, should, with regard to the wholesome roots of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, from the time they first produced the thought of awakening up to the time they fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,🔽from the time they fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening up to the time they fully passed into the nir

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos gzhal du med pa'i bar dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos gzhal du med pa'i bar dang ldan pa dang /
translated: the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom, and with the immeasurable qualities of the Buddha,

original: de las gzhan pa'i sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba sbyin pa las byung ba dang / tshul khrims las byung ba dang / bsgom pa las byung ba ji snyed pa de dag thams cad rjes su yi rang bar 'dod na 'di ltar rjes su yi rang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba sbyin pa las byung ba dang / tshul khrims las byung ba dang / bsgom pa las byung ba ji snyed pa de dag thams cad rjes su yi rang bar 'dod na 'di ltar rjes su yi rang bar bya'o //
translated: and all the wholesome roots of all other sentient beings, which are produced by generosity, produced by morality, and produced by meditation, if you wish to rejoice in all of them, you should rejoice in them like this:

original: rnam par grol ba ji lta ba de lta bu ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba ji lta ba de lta bu ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: Just as liberation is, so is the perfection of generosity.

original: rnam par grol ba ji lta ba de lta bu ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba ji lta ba de lta bu ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: Just as is liberation, so is the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: and the perfection of wisdom.

original: rnam par grol ba ji lta ba de lta bu ni gzugs so //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba ji lta ba de lta bu ni gzugs so //
translated: Just as is liberation, so is form.

original: rnam par grol ba ji lta ba de lta bu ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba ji lta ba de lta bu ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Just as is liberation, so is feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness.

original: rnam par grol ba ji lta ba de lta bu ni skye mched rnams dang / khams rnams so //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba ji lta ba de lta bu ni skye mched rnams dang / khams rnams so //
translated: Just as is liberation, so is the sense-spheres and the elements.

original: rnam par grol ba ji lta ba de lta bu ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba ji lta ba de lta bu ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'o //
translated: Just as is liberation, so is dependent origination.

original: rnam par grol ba ji lta ba de lta bu ni nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar re //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba ji lta ba de lta bu ni nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar re //
translated: Just as is liberation, so are the emptiness of non-observation, the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics, the emptiness of all phenomena, the emptiness of non-entities, the emptiness of essential nature, and the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities.🔽Just as is liberation, so are the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path.🔽Just as is liberation, so are the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.🔽Just as is liberation, so are the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment.

original: rnam par grol ba ji lta ba de lta bu ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams so //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba ji lta ba de lta bu ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams so //
translated: Just as is liberation, so are the perfections.🔽Just as is liberation, so are the emptinesses.🔽Just as is liberation, so are the dhāraṇī gateways.🔽Just as is liberation, so are the gateways of meditative stability.🔽Just as is liberation, so are the gateways of meditative absorption.

original: rnam par grol ba ji lta ba de lta bu ni tshad med pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams so //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba ji lta ba de lta bu ni tshad med pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams so //
translated: Just as is liberation, so are the unentangled dhāraṇī gateways.🔽Just as is liberation, so are the ten tathāgata powers.🔽Just as is liberation, so are the four fearlessnesses.🔽Just as is liberation, so are the four detailed and thorough knowledges.🔽Just as is liberation, so are the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.🔽Just as is liberation, so are the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment.

original: rnam par grol ba ji lta ba de lta bu ni 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams so //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba ji lta ba de lta bu ni 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams so //
translated: Just as is liberation, so are the perfections.🔽Just as is liberation, so are the emptinesses.🔽Just as is liberation, so are the dhāraṇī gateways.🔽Just as is liberation, so are the gateways of meditative stability.🔽Just as is liberation, so are the gateways of meditative absorption.🔽Just as is liberation, so are the unentangled dhāraṇī gateways.🔽Just as is liberation, so are the ten tathāgata powers.🔽Just as is liberation, so are the four fearlessnesses.🔽Just as is liberation, so are the four detailed and thorough knowledges.

original: rnam par grol ba ji lta ba de lta bu ni rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu po'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba ji lta ba de lta bu ni rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu po'o //
translated: Just as is liberation, so are the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: rnam par @128a * //
analyzed: rnam par @128a * //
translated: Just

original: grol ba ji lta ba de lta bu ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa drug rnams so //
analyzed: grol ba ji lta ba de lta bu ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa drug rnams so //
translated: The liberation is the emptiness gate of liberation, the signless gate of liberation, the wishless gate of liberation, and the six superknowledges.

original: rnam par grol ba ji lta ba de lta bu ni ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams so //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba ji lta ba de lta bu ni ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams so //
translated: The liberation is the meditative stabilizations and the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: rnam par grol ba ji lta ba de lta bu ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad do //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba ji lta ba de lta bu ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad do //
translated: The liberation is the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: rnam par grol ba ji lta ba de lta bu ni rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba ji lta ba de lta bu ni rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'o //
translated: The liberation is the seeing of the wisdom of liberation.

original: rnam par grol pa ji lta ba de lta bu ni rjes su yi rang ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol pa ji lta ba de lta bu ni rjes su yi rang ba'o //
translated: The liberation is rejoicing.

original: rnam par grol ba ji lta ba de lta bu ni 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams so //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba ji lta ba de lta bu ni 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams so //
translated: Just as is liberation, so are the qualities of the Buddhas of the past, future, and present.

original: rnam par grol ba ji lta ba de lta bu ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dag go //🔽rnam par grol ba ji lta ba de lta bu ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba ji lta ba de lta bu ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dag go // rnam par grol ba ji lta ba de lta bu ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'o //
translated: Just as is liberation, so are the Blessed Buddhas.🔽Just as is liberation, so is the full enlightenment of the Blessed Buddhas.

original: rnam par grol ba ji lta ba de lta bu ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams de dag gi yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba ji lta ba de lta bu ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams de dag gi yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Just as is liberation, so is the parinirvana of the Blessed Buddhas.

original: rnam par grol ba ji lta ba de lta bu ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi nyan thos rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams so //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba ji lta ba de lta bu ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi nyan thos rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams so //
translated: Just as is liberation, so are the disciples and individual Buddhas of those Buddhas.

original: rnam par grol ba ji lta ba de lta bu ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas de dag gi yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba ji lta ba de lta bu ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas de dag gi yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Just as is liberation, so is the parinirvana of those disciples and individual Buddhas.

original: rnam par grol ba ji lta ba de lta bu ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi chos nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba ji lta ba de lta bu ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi chos nyid do //
translated: The nature of those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, is just like that of complete liberation.

original: rnam par grol ba ji lta ba de lta bu ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas de dag gi chos nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba ji lta ba de lta bu ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas de dag gi chos nyid do //
translated: The nature of those śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas is just like that of complete liberation.

original: rnam par grol ba ji lta ba de lta bu ni chos rnams dang / sems can rnams dang / ma grol ba dang / ma zhi ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa dang / rnam par ma dag pa'i chos rnams kyi chos nyid dang /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba ji lta ba de lta bu ni chos rnams dang / sems can rnams dang / ma grol ba dang / ma zhi ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa dang / rnam par ma dag pa'i chos rnams kyi chos nyid dang /
translated: The nature of phenomena, sentient beings, the unliberated, the unpeaceful, the unafflicted, and the impure phenomena is just like that of complete liberation.

original: ma skyes pa dang / yongs su ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba dang / ma 'gags pa'i chos rnams ni chos nyid ji lta ba bzhin du 'pho ba med pa dang / 'jig pa med par nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: ma skyes pa dang / yongs su ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba dang / ma 'gags pa'i chos rnams ni chos nyid ji lta ba bzhin du 'pho ba med pa dang / 'jig pa med par nye bar bzung ste /
translated: Unarisen, unproduced, unoriginated, and unceasing phenomena are just like the nature of phenomena, without transference and without destruction.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ste /
translated: They dedicate [the roots of virtue] to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rab 'byor 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi rjes su yi rang ba'i bar dang / bla na med pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi rjes su yi rang ba'i bar dang / bla na med pa'i bar ro //
translated: “Subhūti, this is the bodhisattva great beings’ rejoicing, up to the unsurpassed.

original: rab 'byor rjes su yi rang ba de dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen @128b po ni myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor rjes su yi rang ba de dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen @128b po ni myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings endowed with that rejoicing quickly fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang phyogs bcu'i phyogs re re zhing 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang phyogs bcu'i phyogs re re zhing 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, in each of the ten directions in world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa gang ji snyed cig bzhugs pa dang / 'tsho skyong ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa de dag la theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa gang ji snyed cig bzhugs pa dang / 'tsho skyong ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa de dag la theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: To all the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, as many as there are, together with their assemblies of śrāvakas, and to those Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones, together with their assemblies of śrāvakas, who are present, who are living, and who are maintaining themselves in worlds in the ten directions, to those Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones, together with their assemblies of śrāvakas, and to those Bodhisattvas, those great beings, who are present, who are living, and who are maintaining themselves in worlds in the ten directions, to those Bodhisattvas, those great beings, and to the Dharma, which is well-expounded by the Blessed One, to the Dharma, which is well-expounded by the Blessed One, to those Pratyekabuddhas, to those Pratyekabuddhas, and to those Arhats, and to those Arhats, and to those Non-returners, and to those Non-returners, and to those Once-returners, and to those Once-returners, and to those Stream-enterers, and to those Stream-enterers, and to those who have gone forth, and to those who have gone forth, and to those who are householders, and to those who are householders, and to all sentient beings, to all sentient beings, and to all the worlds, I pay homage, I pay homage.

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang la la zhig gis nam 'tsho'i bar du chos gos dang / bsod snyoms dang / gzims cha dang / snyun gyi rkyen rtsi dang / yo byad mang po dang / bde ba'i yo byad thams cad kyis rim gror byas /🔽bla mar byas /🔽bsti stang du byas /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang la la zhig gis nam 'tsho'i bar du chos gos dang / bsod snyoms dang / gzims cha dang / snyun gyi rkyen rtsi dang / yo byad mang po dang / bde ba'i yo byad thams cad kyis rim gror byas /🔽bla mar byas /🔽bsti stang du byas /
translated: To those who are in the Bodhisattva vehicle, to those who are in the Bodhisattva vehicle, and to those who are in the Śrāvaka vehicle, and to those who are in the Śrāvaka vehicle, and to those who are in the Pratyekabuddha vehicle, and to those who are in the Pratyekabuddha vehicle, and to those who are in the vehicle of the Buddhas, and to those who are in the vehicle of the Buddhas, and to those who are in the vehicle of the Pratyekabuddhas, and to those who are in the vehicle of the Pratyekabuddhas, and to those who are in the vehicle of the Śrāvakas, and to those who are in the vehicle of the Śrāvakas, and to those who are in the vehicle of the gods, and to those who are in the vehicle of the gods, and to those who are in the vehicle of the humans, and to those who are in the

analyzed: mchod par byas pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas kyang nyin mtshan du so sor me tog dang ; spos dang / dri dang / phreng ba dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / na bza' dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan mang pos rim gror byed pa dang / bla mar byed pa dang / bsti stang du byed pa dang / mchod par byed pa dang / dmigs pa'i tshul gyis tshul khrims srung ba dang / bzod pa sgom pa dang /
translated: and after the parinirvāṇa of those buddha bhagavāns, they make offerings to the relics of those tathāgatas with flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, cloths,🔽parasols, banners, and flags, and they honor, venerate, praise, and make offerings to them, and they guard their morality, cultivate patience,

original: rigs kyi bu mo bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs pa gang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa sa spyod pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs pa gang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa sa spyod pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang /
translated: “Son of a good family or daughter of a good family who has set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, who practices the perfection of giving, practices the perfection of morality,

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos na bsod nams mngon par 'du bya ba 'di dang /
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos na bsod nams mngon par 'du bya ba 'di dang /
translated: practices the perfection of patience, practices the perfection of perseverance, practices the perfection of concentration, and practices the perfection of wisdom without apprehending anything, if they dedicate those wholesome roots to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, compared to the merit produced by that,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon par 'du bya ba 'di la bsod nams mngon par 'du bya ba snga ma des brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon par 'du bya ba 'di la bsod nams mngon par 'du bya ba snga ma des brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro /
translated: this production of merit does not approach even a hundredth part of it.

original: rgyu'i bar du yang mi bzod de yongs su bsngo ba de nyid rab ces bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i bar du yang mi bzod de yongs su bsngo ba de nyid rab ces bya'o //
translated: It is not even able to bear the cause, and that very dedication is called “supreme.”

original: gong na med pa'i bar zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gong na med pa'i bar zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “unsurpassed” up to “not being able to bear.”

original: @129a * // rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: @129a * // rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang /
translated: Thus, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings are practicing the perfection of generosity, practicing the perfection of morality, practicing the perfection of patience,

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: practicing the perfection of perseverance, practicing the perfection of concentration, and practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: thabs mkhas pas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni rjes su yi rang ba'i yid la byed pa yin no //
analyzed: thabs mkhas pas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni rjes su yi rang ba'i yid la byed pa yin no //
translated: they should, with skillful means, dedicate those wholesome roots to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening using the method of nonapprehending. This is the mental attention of rejoicing.

original: 'dis ni rjes su yi rang ba'i yid la byed pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dis ni rjes su yi rang ba'i yid la byed pa gsungs so //
translated: This is the mental attention to rejoicing.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni snang bar bgyid pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni snang bar bgyid pa'o //
translated: “Lord, the perfection of wisdom is the illuminator.

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni phyag bgyi bar 'os pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni phyag bgyi bar 'os pa ste /
translated: Lord, the perfection of wisdom is the one to whom homage should be paid.

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Lord, homage to the perfection of wisdom!

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni khams gsum pa thams cad kyis ma gos pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni khams gsum pa thams cad kyis ma gos pa'o //
translated: Lord, the perfection of wisdom is unsoiled by all the three world systems.

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni nyon mongs pa dang / lta ba'i mun pa thams cad spong ba'i slad du rab rib ma mchis par bgyid pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni nyon mongs pa dang / lta ba'i mun pa thams cad spong ba'i slad du rab rib ma mchis par bgyid pa'o //
translated: Lord, the perfection of wisdom is the one that removes the blindness of all the afflictions and views.”

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyi nang na mchog tu bgyid pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyi nang na mchog tu bgyid pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is the most excellent of all the factors of awakening.

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'jigs pa dang / gnod pa dang 'tshe ba thams cad rab tu spong ba'i slad du bde bar bgyid pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'jigs pa dang / gnod pa dang 'tshe ba thams cad rab tu spong ba'i slad du bde bar bgyid pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom brings happiness because it eliminates all fear, harm, and violence.

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni sems can thams cad kyi mig lnga yongs su 'thob par bgyi ba'i slad du snang bar bgyid pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni sems can thams cad kyi mig lnga yongs su 'thob par bgyi ba'i slad du snang bar bgyid pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom illuminates because it causes all beings to attain the five eyes.

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni sems can lam log par zhugs pa rnams mtha' gnyis las bzlog pa'i slad du shul ston pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni sems can lam log par zhugs pa rnams mtha' gnyis las bzlog pa'i slad du shul ston pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom shows the way because it turns beings who have entered wrong paths away from the two extremes.

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spong ba'i slad du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du bgyid pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spong ba'i slad du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du bgyid pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is the mother of the bodhisattva great beings because it gives rise to the qualities of the buddhas.

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos bskyed pa'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi ma'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos bskyed pa'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi ma'o //
translated: Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is the mother of the bodhisattva great beings because it gives rise to the qualities of the buddhas.

original: bcom @129b ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi slad du ma skyas ma 'gags pa'o //
analyzed: bcom @129b ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi slad du ma skyas ma 'gags pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is unborn and unceasing because of the emptiness of its own mark.

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni tshogs par gnas pa 'jig pa'i slad du 'khor ba'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni tshogs par gnas pa 'jig pa'i slad du 'khor ba'i gnyen po'o //
translated: Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is the antidote to saṃsāra because it destroys the abode of the aggregates.

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni chos rin po che thams cad stobs pa'i slad du sems can mgon ma mchis pa rnams kyi mgon bgyid pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni chos rin po che thams cad stobs pa'i slad du sems can mgon ma mchis pa rnams kyi mgon bgyid pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is the protector of beings without a protector because it bestows all precious Dharmas.

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni brdzi ba ma mchis pa'i slad du stobs bcu bgyid pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni brdzi ba ma mchis pa'i slad du stobs bcu bgyid pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is the ten powers because it is invincible.

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'gro ba dang ldog pa ma mchis pa'i slad du rnam pa bcu gnyis lan gsum du 'khor ba'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'gro ba dang ldog pa ma mchis pa'i slad du rnam pa bcu gnyis lan gsum du 'khor ba'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'o //
translated: Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is the turning of the wheel of Dharma in the three times and twelve aspects because it does not go or come.🔽Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is the true teacher of the nature of all dharmas because of the emptiness of the nature of non-existing things.

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi slad du chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid yang dag par ston par bgyid pa'o zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi slad du chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid yang dag par ston par bgyid pa'o zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: This is the nature.

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bgyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bgyi /
translated: “Blessed One, how should one abide in the perfection of wisdom?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: sh'a ri'i bu ston pa la ji lta ba bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu ston pa la ji lta ba bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya'o //
translated: “Śāriputra, one should abide in the perfection of wisdom just as one would abide in a teacher.

original: ston pa la ji ltar phyag bya ba de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la phyag bya'o //
analyzed: ston pa la ji ltar phyag bya ba de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la phyag bya'o //
translated: One should pay homage to the perfection of wisdom just as one would pay homage to a teacher.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid ston pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid ston pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because this perfection of wisdom itself is the teacher.

original: ston pa yang gzhan ma yin la /
analyzed: ston pa yang gzhan ma yin la /
translated: The teacher is not one thing,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang gzhan ma yin gyi /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang gzhan ma yin gyi /
translated: and the perfection of wisdom another.

original: ston pa nyid kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyang ston pa'o //
analyzed: ston pa nyid kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyang ston pa'o //
translated: The teacher is the perfection of wisdom itself,🔽and the perfection of wisdom is the teacher itself.”

original: sh'a ri'i bu de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad 'byung ba'o //
translated: Therefore, Śāriputra, from the perfection of wisdom come forth all the tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / dgra bcom pa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / rgyun du zhugs pa rnams 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / dgra bcom pa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / rgyun du zhugs pa rnams 'byung ba'o //
translated: From it come forth the bodhisattva great beings, the pratyekabuddhas, the worthy ones, the non-returners, the once-returners, and the stream enterers.

original: de'i phyir dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams 'byung ba'o //
translated: From it come forth the ten wholesome actions.

original: bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi 'byung ba'o //
translated: From it come forth the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, and the four formless absorptions.

original: mngon par shes pa lnga dang / nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos @130a * //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga dang / nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos @130a * //
translated: From it come forth the five clairvoyances, the emptiness of internal phenomena, the emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena, the emptiness of emptiness, the emptiness of great extent, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, the emptiness of the unlimited, the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end, the emptiness of non-dispersal, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of all things, the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics, the emptiness of non-apprehension, the emptiness of non-entities, the emptiness of essential nature, the emptiness of other-entity, the emptiness of the non-existence of essential nature, the emptiness of the existence of other-entity, the emptiness of non-dispersal, the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics, the emptiness of all things, the emptiness of non-apprehension, the emptiness of non-entities, the emptiness of essential nature, the emptiness of other-entity, the emptiness of the non-existence of essential nature, the emptiness of the existence of other-entity, the emptiness of non-dispersal, the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics, the emptiness of all things, the emptiness of non-apprehension, the emptiness of non-entities, the emptiness of essential nature, the emptiness of other-entity, the emptiness of the non-existence of essential nature, the emptiness of the existence of other-entity, the emptiness of non-dispersal, the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics, the emptiness of all things, the emptiness of non-apprehension, the emptiness of non-entities, the emptiness of essential nature, the emptiness of other-entity, the emptiness of the non-existence of essential nature, the emptiness of the existence of other-entity, the emptiness of non-dispersal, the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics, the emptiness of all things, the emptiness of non-apprehension, the emptiness of non-entities,

original: po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang /
analyzed: po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang /
translated: the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence, up to the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment, the noble truths, emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, the eight liberations,

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang ; pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang ; pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu 'byung ba'o //
translated: the nine serial absorptions, all the perfections, all the meditative stabilizations, all the dhāraṇī gateways, and the ten bodhisattva stages arise.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad 'byung ba'o //
translated: The ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha arise.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du 'byung ba'o //
translated: up to the knowledge of all aspects arises.

original: de nas lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin 'di snyam du gyur te /
analyzed: de nas lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin 'di snyam du gyur te /
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, had this thought:

original: btsun pa sh'a ri'i bu ci'i phyir 'di 'dri bar 'gyur snyam mo //
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a ri'i bu ci'i phyir 'di 'dri bar 'gyur snyam mo //
translated: “Why does the Venerable Śāriputra ask this?”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyi sems kyi rnam par rtog pa sems kyis yongs su shes nas lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyi sems kyi rnam par rtog pa sems kyis yongs su shes nas lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the Venerable Śāriputra, knowing with his mind the thoughts occurring to Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said this to Śakra, Lord of the Gods:

original: koo shi ka de ltar tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu ci'i phyir 'di 'dri bar 'gyur snyam du rnam par rtog par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: koo shi ka de ltar tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu ci'i phyir 'di 'dri bar 'gyur snyam du rnam par rtog par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni /
translated: “Kauśika, why do you think that the Venerable Śāriputra asks this?”

original: koo shi ka byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su bzung ba rnams ni thabs mkhas pas 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis thugs dang po bskyed pa nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i bar dang /
analyzed: koo shi ka byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su bzung ba rnams ni thabs mkhas pas 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis thugs dang po bskyed pa nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i bar dang /
translated: “Kauśika, those bodhisattva great beings who are taken hold of by the perfection of wisdom, through skillful means, dedicate the wholesome roots of the past, future, and present lord buddhas from their first production of the thought of awakening up to their full awakening to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: dam pa'i chos gnas pa'i bar gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba gang cung zad yod pa de dag rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo ste /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos gnas pa'i bar gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba gang cung zad yod pa de dag rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo ste /
translated: and up to the abiding of the good Dharma, to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de'i phyir 'dri bar gyur to //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dri bar gyur to //
translated: Therefore, you have asked about it.

original: koo shi ka byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dis ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zil gyis gnon to //
analyzed: koo shi ka byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dis ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zil gyis gnon to //
translated: “Kauśika, this perfection of wisdom of bodhisattva great beings surpasses the perfection of giving,

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa zil gyis gnon to //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa zil gyis gnon to //
translated: Similarly, they surpass the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, and the perfection of concentration.

original: koo shi ka 'di lta ste dper na /🔽dmus long brgya'am /
analyzed: koo shi ka 'di lta ste dper na / dmus long brgya'am /
translated: “Kauśika, it is like this:🔽a hundred,

original: stong ngam / brgya phrag stong yang rung ste /
analyzed: stong ngam / brgya phrag stong yang rung ste /
translated: a thousand, or a hundred thousand blind people

original: yongs su 'dren pa med pas @130b lam du 'jug pa yang skal ba med na /
analyzed: yongs su 'dren pa med pas @130b lam du 'jug pa yang skal ba med na /
translated: cannot set out on a road without a guide,

original: grong khyer du 'gror bar lta ga la nus /
analyzed: grong khyer du 'gror bar lta ga la nus /
translated: let alone go to a town.

original: koo shi ka de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po 'di dag ni dmus long lta bur gyur pa ste /
analyzed: koo shi ka de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po 'di dag ni dmus long lta bur gyur pa ste /
translated: Kauśika, in the same way, these five perfections are like blind people

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med na yongs su 'dren pa med pas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med na yongs su 'dren pa med pas /
translated: without the perfection of wisdom to guide them,

original: lam du 'jug pa'i skal ba yang med na /
analyzed: lam du 'jug pa'i skal ba yang med na /
translated: they do not have the good fortune to set out on the path,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi grong khyer chen por 'jug par lta ga la nus /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi grong khyer chen por 'jug par lta ga la nus /
translated: let alone enter the great city of omniscience.”

original: koo shi ka pha rol tu phyin pa lnga nam shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin par gyur pa de'i tshe mig dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: koo shi ka pha rol tu phyin pa lnga nam shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin par gyur pa de'i tshe mig dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: Kauśika, when the five perfections are taken hold of by the perfection of wisdom, then they have eyes.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i ming yang rab tu 'thob po //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i ming yang rab tu 'thob po //
translated: They also obtain the name ‘perfections.’

original: brgya byin gyis smras pa /🔽btsun pa sh'a ri'i bu gang yang pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su bzung na pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i ming yang 'thob po zhes zer ba de ltar /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis smras pa / btsun pa sh'a ri'i bu gang yang pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su bzung na pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i ming yang 'thob po zhes zer ba de ltar /
translated: Śakra said:🔽Venerable Śāriputra, you said, ‘When the five perfections are taken hold of by the perfection of wisdom, they obtain the name “perfections.”’

original: btsun pa sh'a ri'i bu pha rol tu phyin pa lnga sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su bzung yang pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i ming mi 'thob po //
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a ri'i bu pha rol tu phyin pa lnga sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su bzung yang pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i ming mi 'thob po //
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, when the five perfections are taken hold of by the perfection of generosity, they do not obtain the name “perfections.”

original: de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga ni tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su bzung yang pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i ming mi 'thob po //
analyzed: de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga ni tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su bzung yang pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i ming mi 'thob po //
translated: In the same way, the five perfections, when not held by the perfection of wisdom and not supported by the perfection of wisdom, do not get the name ‘perfections.’

original: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
translated: Śāriputra said,

original: koo shi ka de de bzhin no //
analyzed: koo shi ka de de bzhin no //
translated: “Exactly so, Kauśika!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: Exactly so!

original: koo shi ka pha rol tu phyin pa lnga sbyin pas yongs su bzung yang pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i ming 'thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: koo shi ka pha rol tu phyin pa lnga sbyin pas yongs su bzung yang pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i ming 'thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Kauśika, the five perfections, when held by giving, do not get the name ‘perfections.’

original: koo shi ka de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su bzung yang pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i ming 'thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: koo shi ka de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su bzung yang pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i ming 'thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Kauśika, in the same way, the five perfections, when held by morality, patience, perseverance, and concentration, do not get the name ‘perfections.’

original: koo shi ka de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa kho na pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po 'di dag gi rab ces bya'o //🔽dam pa zhes bya'o //🔽gtso bo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: koo shi ka de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa kho na pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po 'di dag gi rab ces bya'o // dam pa zhes bya'o // gtso bo zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, Kauśika, it is just this perfection of wisdom which is called the best of these five perfections.🔽It is called the highest.

original: mchog ces bya'o /🔽rab mchog ces bya'o //🔽phul du phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mchog ces bya'o / rab mchog ces bya'o // phul du phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the foremost.🔽It is called the supreme.

original: shin tu phul du phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shin tu phul du phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the most excellent.🔽It is called the ultimate.🔽It is called the very ultimate.

original: mi mnyam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the unequalled.🔽It is called the equal of the unequalled.

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni mchog nyid yin no //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni mchog nyid yin no //
translated: This is the supremacy.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the Venerable Śāriputra said to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ji ltar mngon par bsgrub par bgyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ji ltar mngon par bsgrub par bgyi /
translated: Blessed One, how should one accomplish the perfection of wisdom?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽sh'a ri'i bu gzugs mngon par bsgrub @131a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / sh'a ri'i bu gzugs mngon par bsgrub @131a * //
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: pa med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: pa med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Śāriputra, the perfection of wisdom should be accomplished because form is not to be accomplished.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa mngon par bsgrub pa med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa mngon par bsgrub pa med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: and similarly, for the non-establishment of feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness, the perfection of wisdom should be accomplished.🔽And similarly, for the non-establishment of the sense spheres, elements, and factors of dependent origination,

original: de bzhin du skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag rnams dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag rnams dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: and for the non-establishment of the perfection of generosity,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: the perfection of wisdom should be accomplished.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub pa med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub pa med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: And similarly, for the non-establishment of the perfections of morality, patience, diligence, and concentration, the perfection of wisdom should be accomplished.

original: nang stong pa nyid mngon par bsgrub pa med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid mngon par bsgrub pa med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: For the accomplishment of inner emptiness, the perfection of wisdom should be accomplished.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du mngon par bsgrub pa med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du mngon par bsgrub pa med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: For the accomplishment of up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature, the perfection of wisdom should be accomplished.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun mngon par bsgrub pa med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun mngon par bsgrub pa med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: For the accomplishment of the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, the perfection of wisdom should be accomplished.

original: stobs bcu po rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams mngon par bsgrub pa med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: stobs bcu po rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams mngon par bsgrub pa med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: For the accomplishment of the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, the perfection of wisdom should be accomplished.

original: chos thams cad mngon par bsgrub pa med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad mngon par bsgrub pa med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom should be accomplished because all dharmas are not accomplished.

original: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du mngon par bsgrub pa med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du mngon par bsgrub pa med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the perfection of wisdom should be accomplished because the knowledge of all aspects up to and including the knowledge of paths is not accomplished.

original: sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa /
translated: Śāriputra then asked,

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar gzugs mngon par bsgrub pa ma mchis pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bgyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar gzugs mngon par bsgrub pa ma mchis pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bgyi /
translated: “Lord, how should the perfection of wisdom be accomplished because form is not accomplished?

original: ji ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du mngon par bsgrub pa ma mchis pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du mngon par bsgrub pa ma mchis pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bgyi /
translated: How should the perfection of wisdom be accomplished because the knowledge of all aspects up to and including the knowledge of paths is not accomplished?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord replied,🔽“Śāriputra, the perfection of wisdom should be accomplished because form is not accomplished.

original: gzugs mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / dngos po med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa dang / dmigs pa med pa dang / 'jig @131b pa med pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang /
analyzed: gzugs mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / dngos po med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa dang / dmigs pa med pa dang / 'jig @131b pa med pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang /
translated: “The perfection of wisdom should be accomplished by the non-production, non-existence, non-arising, non-apprehension, and non-destruction of form, up to the non-production, non-existence, non-arising, non-apprehension, and non-destruction of the knowledge of all aspects.”

original: skye ba med pa dang / dngos po med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa dang / dmigs pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad la mngon par 'du mi byed pa yin no //
analyzed: skye ba med pa dang / dngos po med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa dang / dmigs pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad la mngon par 'du mi byed pa yin no //
translated: This is the non-production of all phenomena.

original: sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa /
translated: Śāriputra said,

original: bcom ldan 'das de ltar mngon par bsgrubs pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chos gang zhig gtod par bgyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ltar mngon par bsgrubs pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chos gang zhig gtod par bgyi /
translated: “Blessed One, what phenomena does the perfection of wisdom, which is accomplished in this way, reveal?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Śāriputra, the perfection of wisdom does not reveal any phenomena at all.

original: sh'a ri'i bu de ltar mngon par bsgrubs pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni chos gang yang gtong par mi byed de /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu de ltar mngon par bsgrubs pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni chos gang yang gtong par mi byed de /
translated: “Śāriputra, the perfection of wisdom that is practiced in that way does not give up any dharma.

original: nam chos gang yang gtod par mi byed pa de'i tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i grangs su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: nam chos gang yang gtod par mi byed pa de'i tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i grangs su 'gro ba'o //
translated: When it does not give up any dharma, then it is counted as the perfection of wisdom.”

original: sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa /
translated: Śāriputra asked,

original: chos gang zhig gtod par mi bgyid pa lags /
analyzed: chos gang zhig gtod par mi bgyid pa lags /
translated: “What dharma does it not give up?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: mi dge ba'i chos rnams gtod par byed pa ma yin /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos rnams gtod par byed pa ma yin /
translated: “It does not give up unwholesome dharmas.

original: dge ba'i chos rnams gtod par byed pa ma yin /🔽de bzhin du kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i ma yin /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams gtod par byed pa ma yin / de bzhin du kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i ma yin /
translated: It does not give up wholesome dharmas.

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa'i ma yin /🔽zag pa dang bcas pa'i ma yin /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa'i ma yin / zag pa dang bcas pa'i ma yin /
translated: Similarly, it does not give up dharmas that are reprehensible or dharmas that are irreproachable.

original: zag pa med pa'i ma yin /🔽'dus byas kyi ma yin /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i ma yin / 'dus byas kyi ma yin /
translated: It does not give up dharmas with defilement or dharmas without defilement.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi ma yin /🔽kun nas nyon mongs pa'i ma yin /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi ma yin / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i ma yin /
translated: It does not give up compounded dharmas or uncompounded dharmas.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i ma yin /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i ma yin /
translated: It does not give up afflicted dharmas or unafflicted dharmas.

original: 'jig rten pa'i ma yin /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i ma yin /
translated: It does not give up mundane dharmas or supramundane dharmas.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ma yin /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ma yin /
translated: not of the supramundane,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi ma yin /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi ma yin /
translated: not of the afflicted,

original: rnam par byang ba'i ma yin /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i ma yin /
translated: not of the purified,

original: 'khor ba'i ma yin /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i ma yin /
translated: not of saṃsāra,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos rnams gtod par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos rnams gtod par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: and not of nirvāṇa.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na ;
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na ;
translated: And why is that?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni chos gang la yang dmigs pa'i tshul gyis nye bar mi gnas pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni chos gang la yang dmigs pa'i tshul gyis nye bar mi gnas pa ste /
translated: Because the perfection of wisdom does not stand by way of apprehending any dharma at all.

original: de'i phyir chos gang yang gtod par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos gang yang gtod par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it does not cause any dharma to be bestowed.

original: de nas lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then Śatakratu, head of the gods, asked the Lord,

original: bcom ldan 'das ci lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci lags /
translated: “Lord, is it the case that

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang gtod par mi bgyid dam /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang gtod par mi bgyid dam /
translated: this perfection of wisdom does not cause even the knowledge of all aspects to be bestowed?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: koo shi ka gang de skad du ci lags /
analyzed: koo shi ka gang de skad du ci lags /
translated: “Kauśika, as to that, is it the case that

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang gtod par mi bgyid dam /🔽zhes zer ba ni koo shi ka de de @132a * //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang gtod par mi bgyid dam / zhes zer ba ni koo shi ka de de @132a * //
