original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la brtson par bgyid pa de yun ring po ji srid cig nas spyod pa lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la brtson par bgyid pa de yun ring po ji srid cig nas spyod pa lags /
translated: “Blessed One, for how long have bodhisattva great beings who strive in this profound perfection of wisdom been practicing?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: rab 'byor 'di ni rnam par phye nas lung bstan par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ni rnam par phye nas lung bstan par bya ba yin te /
translated: “Subhūti, this is to be explained in detail.

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis brtson par byed pa dang / de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis brtson par byed pa dang / de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings who, from the time they first give rise to the mind of awakening, strive in this profound perfection of wisdom without apprehending anything, and likewise in the perfection of concentration,

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par byed cing 'phel ba dang / 'grib par mthong ba med pa de ltar @136b thabs mkhas pas chos gang yang mi spong ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par byed cing 'phel ba dang / 'grib par mthong ba med pa de ltar @136b thabs mkhas pas chos gang yang mi spong ste /
translated: In this way, with skillful means, they do not reject any phenomenon.

original: nam yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mchod pa'i khyad par gang gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la rim gro dang / bla ma dang / bsti stang dang / mchod par bya bar 'dod pa'i mchod pa'i khyad par de dag kyang sems bskyed pa tsam gyis 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nam yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mchod pa'i khyad par gang gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la rim gro dang / bla ma dang / bsti stang dang / mchod par bya bar 'dod pa'i mchod pa'i khyad par de dag kyang sems bskyed pa tsam gyis 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: They never part from the six perfections, and they accomplish the special offerings that they wish to make to the blessed buddhas, the special offerings with which they wish to serve, venerate, respect, and worship the blessed buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro zhing nam yang ma'i mang la du mi skye la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro zhing nam yang ma'i mang la du mi skye la /
translated: They go from buddha realm to buddha realm, and they are never born in the animal realms.

original: nam yang mngon par shes pa rnams dang mi 'bral zhing nyon mongs pa rnams dang lhan cig mi 'grogs la /
analyzed: nam yang mngon par shes pa rnams dang mi 'bral zhing nyon mongs pa rnams dang lhan cig mi 'grogs la /
translated: They are never separated from the superknowledges, and they do not associate with the afflictions.

original: nyan thos kyi sems dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sems dang lhan cig mi gnas shing sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed cing sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro ba de lta bu'i rnam grangs yod de /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sems dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sems dang lhan cig mi gnas shing sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed cing sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro ba de lta bu'i rnam grangs yod de /
translated: They do not dwell together with the thought of a śrāvaka or the thought of a pratyekabuddha, and they ripen beings and purify a buddhafield, and they go from buddhafield to buddhafield.

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de lta bu dag ni sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de lta bu dag ni sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings like that, from the first production of the thought,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la brtson par byed do zhes bya ba ni thabs la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la brtson par byed do zhes bya ba ni thabs la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: strive at this deep perfection of wisdom.”

original: rab 'byor theg pa chen po pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor theg pa chen po pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: “Subhūti, sons of a good family in the Great Vehicle

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang gis sangs rgyas brgya phrag mang po dang / sangs rgyas stong phrag mang po dang / sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig stong phrag mang po mthong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang gis sangs rgyas brgya phrag mang po dang / sangs rgyas stong phrag mang po dang / sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig stong phrag mang po mthong bar 'gyur te /
translated: “There are, son of a good family, those sons of a good family and daughters of a good family who will see many hundreds of Buddhas, many thousands of Buddhas, many hundreds of thousands of Buddhas, many millions of millions of Buddhas,

original: de dag gi drung du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa sbyin par 'gyur ba dang / tshul khrims bsrung ba dang / bzod pa bsgom pa dang / brtson 'grus brtsam pa dang / bsam gtan bskyed pa dang / shes rab bsgom pa la slob par 'gyur ba yod de /
analyzed: de dag gi drung du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa sbyin par 'gyur ba dang / tshul khrims bsrung ba dang / bzod pa bsgom pa dang / brtson 'grus brtsam pa dang / bsam gtan bskyed pa dang / shes rab bsgom pa la slob par 'gyur ba yod de /
translated: and who, in the presence of those Buddhas, will practice generosity, will guard morality, will cultivate patience, will make an effort at perseverance, will create meditative stabilization, and will cultivate wisdom, with the method of taking them as a reference.

original: de dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ston par 'gyur ba'i tshe 'khor de nas gud du 'dong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ston par 'gyur ba'i tshe 'khor de nas gud du 'dong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But when this perfection of wisdom is being taught, they will leave that assembly.

original: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ston par 'gyur ba'i tshe gus pa med pas sangs rgyas bcom 'das de dag gi drung nas gud du 'dong bar 'gyur te /🔽theg pa chen po pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ston par 'gyur ba'i tshe gus pa med pas sangs rgyas bcom 'das de dag gi drung nas gud du 'dong bar 'gyur te / theg pa chen po pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: “Those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family will, when this deep perfection of wisdom is being taught, go away from the presence of those lord buddhas because of disrespect.

original: rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di nyid ston par 'gyur ba'i tshe 'khor de nas gud du 'dong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di nyid ston par 'gyur ba'i tshe 'khor de nas gud du 'dong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family in the Great Vehicle will, when this deep perfection of wisdom is being taught, go away from that assembly.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i @137a * //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i @137a * //
translated: Why is that?

original: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni sngon gyi mthar yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bstan pa'i tshe 'khor de nas gud du 'dong 'dong ba ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni sngon gyi mthar yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bstan pa'i tshe 'khor de nas gud du 'dong 'dong ba ste /
translated: It is because those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family in the Bodhisattva Vehicle have previously, when this deep perfection of wisdom was being taught, gone away from that assembly.

original: de dag ni da ltar byung ba'i tshe yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bstan pa'i tshe 'khor de nas gud du 'dong bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de dag ni da ltar byung ba'i tshe yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bstan pa'i tshe 'khor de nas gud du 'dong bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: And when this profound perfection of wisdom is being taught, they will leave that assembly.

original: lus dang sems kyi mthun par spyod par mi 'gyur bar shes rab 'chal par 'gyur pa'i las bsog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus dang sems kyi mthun par spyod par mi 'gyur bar shes rab 'chal par 'gyur pa'i las bsog par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not be able to practice in accordance with the body and mind, and they will accumulate karma that leads to having bad wisdom.

original: de dag shes rab 'chal par 'gyur ba'i las byas shing bsags pa des shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bstan pa'i tshe spong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag shes rab 'chal par 'gyur ba'i las byas shing bsags pa des shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bstan pa'i tshe spong bar 'gyur te /
translated: Because of the karma that they have created and accumulated that leads to having bad wisdom, when this profound perfection of wisdom is being taught, they will reject it.

original: de spangs pas 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid spangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de spangs pas 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid spangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: By rejecting it, they will reject the knowledge of all aspects of the past, future, and present lord buddhas.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de spangs nas /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de spangs nas /
translated: Having rejected the knowledge of all aspects,

original: chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba'i las byas shing bsags pa des lo mang po dang / lo brgya phrag mang po dang / lo stong phrag mang po dang / lo bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag mang po'i bar du sems can dmyal ba chen por 'phen par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba'i las byas shing bsags pa des lo mang po dang / lo brgya phrag mang po dang / lo stong phrag mang po dang / lo bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag mang po'i bar du sems can dmyal ba chen por 'phen par 'gyur ro //
translated: By that karma that is the cause of being bereft of the Dharma, they will be hurled into the great hells for many years, many hundreds of years, many thousands of years, many hundreds of thousands of years.

original: de dag sems can dmyal ba chen po nas sems can dmyal ba chen por 'dong ba'i tshe /🔽mes yongs su 'jig pa'am ;🔽chus yongs su 'jig pa'am /
analyzed: de dag sems can dmyal ba chen po nas sems can dmyal ba chen por 'dong ba'i tshe / mes yongs su 'jig pa'am ; chus yongs su 'jig pa'am /
translated: When they go from one great hell to another great hell,🔽there will be a conflagration,🔽or a great flood,

original: rlung gis yongs su 'jig pa 'byung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: rlung gis yongs su 'jig pa 'byung bar 'gyur la /
translated: or a great wind.

original: de rnams de dag gis yongs su 'jig pa 'byung ba'i tshe /
analyzed: de rnams de dag gis yongs su 'jig pa 'byung ba'i tshe /
translated: When those great hells are destroyed,

original: yang 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag gi sems can dmyal ba chen po de dag tu 'phen par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag gi sems can dmyal ba chen po de dag tu 'phen par 'gyur ro //
translated: they will be hurled into the great hells in other world systems.

original: de dag der skye ste dmyal ba chen po nas dmyal ba chen por 'dong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag der skye ste dmyal ba chen po nas dmyal ba chen por 'dong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be born there, and will go from one great hell to another great hell.

original: de dag dmyal ba chen po nas dmyal ba chen por 'dong ba'i tshe yang yongs su 'jig pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag dmyal ba chen po nas dmyal ba chen por 'dong ba'i tshe yang yongs su 'jig pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: When they go from one great hell to another great hell, there is a complete destruction.

original: de dag yongs su 'jig pa de dag 'byung ba'i tshe yang shar phyogs kyi dmyal ba chen po de dag tu 'phen par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag yongs su 'jig pa de dag 'byung ba'i tshe yang shar phyogs kyi dmyal ba chen po de dag tu 'phen par 'gyur ro //
translated: When that complete destruction occurs, they are hurled into the great hells in the east.

original: lho dang / nub dang ; byang dang / mtshams rnams dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs rnams kyi dmyal ba chen po de dag tu 'phen par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lho dang / nub dang ; byang dang / mtshams rnams dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs rnams kyi dmyal ba chen po de dag tu 'phen par 'gyur ro //
translated: They are hurled into the great hells in the south, west, north, the intermediate directions, below, and above.

original: de dag tu yang yongs su 'jig pa 'byung ba'i tshe yang 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag gi dmyal ba chen po de dag tu 'phen par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag tu yang yongs su 'jig pa 'byung ba'i tshe yang 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag gi dmyal ba chen po de dag tu 'phen par 'gyur ro //
translated: When those complete destructions occur, they are hurled into the great hells in other world systems.

original: de dag 'jig rten gyi @137b khams de rnams las yongs su 'jig pa 'byung ba'i tshe yang dmyal ba chen po rnams nas shi 'phos nas chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba'i las de ma zad pas yang 'dir skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag 'jig rten gyi @137b khams de rnams las yongs su 'jig pa 'byung ba'i tshe yang dmyal ba chen po rnams nas shi 'phos nas chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba'i las de ma zad pas yang 'dir skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: When the destruction of the world occurs, they will die in the great hells and, because the karma that leads to the loss of the Dharma has not yet been exhausted, they will be reborn here.

original: de dag dmyal ba chen po nas dmyal ba chen por 'dong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag dmyal ba chen po nas dmyal ba chen por 'dong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will go from one great hell to another great hell.

original: de dag dmyal ba chen po de rnams su skyes nas dmyal ba chen po'i sdug bsngal shin tu drag la bzod par dka' ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag dmyal ba chen po de rnams su skyes nas dmyal ba chen po'i sdug bsngal shin tu drag la bzod par dka' ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When they are born in those great hells, they will experience the extremely intense and unbearable suffering of the great hells.

original: de dag gis yang ji srid yongs su 'jig pa ma byung gi bar du dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal de dag nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gis yang ji srid yongs su 'jig pa ma byung gi bar du dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal de dag nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will experience that hell suffering until the destruction of the world occurs.

original: de dag yongs su 'jig pa byung nas kyang de dag nas shi 'phos nas yang 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag rnams su dmyal ba chen por skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag yongs su 'jig pa byung nas kyang de dag nas shi 'phos nas yang 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag rnams su dmyal ba chen por skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the destruction of the world occurs, they will die and transmigrate from there and will be reborn in the great hells in other worlds.

original: de bzhin du yang de dag chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba'i las byas shing bsags pa des phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams dag tu byol song gi skye gnas rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang de dag chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba'i las byas shing bsags pa des phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams dag tu byol song gi skye gnas rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, they will be reborn in the animal realm in the world systems of the ten directions due to the karma of creating and accumulating the causes of the loss of the Dharma.

original: de dag tu yang phyogs bcu kun gyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi gshin rje'i 'jig rten du skyes nas shin tu drag cing bzod par dka' ba'i sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba nyams su myong bar byas nas las de zad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag tu yang phyogs bcu kun gyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi gshin rje'i 'jig rten du skyes nas shin tu drag cing bzod par dka' ba'i sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba nyams su myong bar byas nas las de zad par 'gyur te /
translated: And in those places, they will be reborn in the world of Yama in the world systems of the ten directions and experience the extremely intense and unbearable feelings of suffering until that karma is exhausted.

original: de dag gi sdug bsngal mang po nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba'i las zad par byas nas ci ste brgya la mir skye ba thob par gyur na yang gang dang gang du skyes pa de dang der dmus long du 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag gi sdug bsngal mang po nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba'i las zad par byas nas ci ste brgya la mir skye ba thob par gyur na yang gang dang gang du skyes pa de dang der dmus long du 'gyur /
translated: Having exhausted the karma that causes them to experience much suffering, if they should somehow attain a human birth, then wherever they are born, they will be blind.

original: dmus long gi rigs su skye bar 'gyur /🔽gdol pa'i rigs rnams sam /
analyzed: dmus long gi rigs su skye bar 'gyur / gdol pa'i rigs rnams sam /
translated: They will be born in a family of the blind.

original: g-yung po'i rigs rnams sam /
analyzed: g-yung po'i rigs rnams sam /
translated: They will be born in a family of outcastes.🔽They will be born in a family of untouchables.

original: bya ba'i rigs rnams sam /🔽phag 'tshong gi rigs rnams sam /
analyzed: bya ba'i rigs rnams sam / phag 'tshong gi rigs rnams sam /
translated: or in the class of butchers,🔽or in the class of pig-butchers,

original: shan pa'i rigs rnams sam /🔽dmangs rigs rnams sam /
analyzed: shan pa'i rigs rnams sam / dmangs rigs rnams sam /
translated: or in the class of bird-butchers,🔽or in the class of outcastes,

original: phyag dar ba'i rigs rnams sam /
analyzed: phyag dar ba'i rigs rnams sam /
translated: or in the class of sweepers,

original: dman pa'i spyod pa byed pa rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dman pa'i spyod pa byed pa rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: or in the class of those who do the most base deeds.

original: de dang der skyes nas kyang long ba'am /
analyzed: de dang der skyes nas kyang long ba'am /
translated: And having been born there, they will be blind,

original: zhar ba'am / lce med pa'am /
analyzed: zhar ba'am / lce med pa'am /
translated: or one-eyed, or without tongues,

original: lag pa med pa'am /
analyzed: lag pa med pa'am /
translated: or without hands,

original: rkang pa med pa'am /
analyzed: rkang pa med pa'am /
translated: or without feet,

original: rna ba med pa'am /
analyzed: rna ba med pa'am /
translated: or without ears,

original: sna med par 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: sna med par 'gyur ba yin /
translated: or without noses.🔽They will not hear the word ‘Buddha,’🔽they will not hear the word ‘Dharma,’🔽they will not hear the word ‘Saṅgha,’🔽they will not hear the word ‘bodhisattva,’

original: gang las sangs rgyas kyi sgra mi thos par 'gyur ba dang / chos kyi sgra med pa dang / dge 'dun gyi sgra med pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sgra med pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sgra thos pa med par 'gyur ba dang /🔽dgra bcom pa'i sgra thos pa med @138a * //
analyzed: gang las sangs rgyas kyi sgra mi thos par 'gyur ba dang / chos kyi sgra med pa dang / dge 'dun gyi sgra med pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sgra med pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sgra thos pa med par 'gyur ba dang / dgra bcom pa'i sgra thos pa med @138a * //
translated: they will not hear the word ‘pratyeka­buddha,’

original: par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: and they will not hear the word ‘arhat.’🔽Then the venerable Śāriputra said to the Blessed One:

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: “Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das mtshams ma mchis pa lngas ni chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba'i sug las bgyis pa dang / bsags pa 'di'i gzugs brnyan tsam du yang mi spyod do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mtshams ma mchis pa lngas ni chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba'i sug las bgyis pa dang / bsags pa 'di'i gzugs brnyan tsam du yang mi spyod do //
translated: Blessed One, the five heinous actions are not even a pale reflection of the actions that lead to the loss of the Dharma and the accumulation of demerit.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: sh'a ri'i bu des ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bshad pa'i tshe phyir spang bar sems shing 'di la bslab par mi bya ste /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu des ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bshad pa'i tshe phyir spang bar sems shing 'di la bslab par mi bya ste /
translated: “Śāriputra, when this profound perfection of wisdom is being taught, they will think of rejecting it and will not train in it.

original: 'di ni chos ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni chos ma yin no //
translated: They will say, ‘This is not the Dharma,

original: 'di ni 'dul ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dul ba ma yin no //
translated: this is not the Vinaya,

original: 'di ni ston pa'i bstan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni ston pa'i bstan pa ma yin no //
translated: this is not the Teacher’s doctrine.

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa ma yin no zhes zer zhing /
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa ma yin no zhes zer zhing /
translated: This has not been taught by the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One.’

original: de bdag nyid kyang phyir spang bar bya bar sems la /
analyzed: de bdag nyid kyang phyir spang bar bya bar sems la /
translated: They will think of rejecting it themselves,

original: sems can gzhan yang mos pa med par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can gzhan yang mos pa med par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: and they will also cause other sentient beings to lose interest in it.

original: bdag gi rgyud nyams par byas nas gzhan gyi rgyud nyams par byed pa dang / bdag gi rgyud dug can du byas nas gzhan gyi rgyud dug can du byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gi rgyud nyams par byas nas gzhan gyi rgyud nyams par byed pa dang / bdag gi rgyud dug can du byas nas gzhan gyi rgyud dug can du byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will corrupt their own mindstreams and then corrupt the mindstreams of others; they will poison their own mindstreams and then poison the mindstreams of others.

original: bdag kyang chud gson zhing gzhan chud gson par byed par 'gyur ba dang / bdag nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di mi shes mi rig pas phyir spang bar 'dod la gzhan yang de bzhin du 'dzin du 'jug par 'gyur pa de'i gzugs brnyan tsam du yang 'gyur re skan /
analyzed: bdag kyang chud gson zhing gzhan chud gson par byed par 'gyur ba dang / bdag nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di mi shes mi rig pas phyir spang bar 'dod la gzhan yang de bzhin du 'dzin du 'jug par 'gyur pa de'i gzugs brnyan tsam du yang 'gyur re skan /
translated: They will be lost themselves and will cause others to be lost; they will not understand this deep perfection of wisdom, will not know it, and will want to reject it, and they will also cause others to take it up in the same way.

original: sh'a ri'i bu ngas ni gang zag de lta bu thos par bya bar yang ma gnang la smra ba dang phrad par yang mi bya ste /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu ngas ni gang zag de lta bu thos par bya bar yang ma gnang la smra ba dang phrad par yang mi bya ste /
translated: “Śāriputra, I do not allow such persons to hear it, and they should not meet with those who speak it.

original: 'grogs pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: 'grogs pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: What need is there to mention associating with them?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sh'a ri'i bu gang zag de lta bu dag ni chos la skyon 'dogs par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu gang zag de lta bu dag ni chos la skyon 'dogs par rig par bya ste /
translated: Śāriputra, you should know that such persons are criticizing the Dharma.

original: sh'a ri'i bu gang zag de lta bu dag ni lo 'dab rul ba'i tshul can nag po'i phyogs kyi tshul can du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu gang zag de lta bu dag ni lo 'dab rul ba'i tshul can nag po'i phyogs kyi tshul can du rig par bya'o //
translated: Śāriputra, you should know that such people are like rotten leaves, like the dark side.

original: sh'a ri'i bu gang zag de lta bu dag gi ngag mnyan par sems pa'am /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu gang zag de lta bu dag gi ngag mnyan par sems pa'am /
translated: Śāriputra, those who think to listen to the speech of such people,

original: de dag la yid ches par bya bar sems pa de dag kyang phung bar 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: de dag la yid ches par bya bar sems pa de dag kyang phung bar 'gyur ro ;
translated: or who think to have confidence in them, will also be ruined.

original: / sh'a ri'i bu gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la skyon 'dogs pa de ni chos la skyon 'dogs pa'i gang zag tu rig par bya'o //
analyzed: / sh'a ri'i bu gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la skyon 'dogs pa de ni chos la skyon 'dogs pa'i gang zag tu rig par bya'o //
translated: Śāriputra, those who find fault with the perfection of wisdom should be known as people who find fault with the Dharma.

original: sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa /
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: bcom ldan 'das chos la skyon 'dogs pa'i gang zag der skyes pa de'i lus kyi tshad bcom ldan 'das kyis da dung ma gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das chos la skyon 'dogs pa'i gang zag der skyes pa de'i lus kyi tshad bcom ldan 'das kyis da dung ma gsungs so //
translated: Blessed One, the Blessed One has not yet said how big the body of the person who is born there, who finds fault with the Dharma, will be.

original: bcom @138b ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom @138b ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: sh'a ri'i bu chos la skyon 'dogs pa'i gang zag de'i der skyes pa'i lus kyi tshad ni zhog shig / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu chos la skyon 'dogs pa'i gang zag de'i der skyes pa'i lus kyi tshad ni zhog shig / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Śāriputra, put aside the size of the body of the person who is born there, who finds fault with the Dharma. And why?

original: gang zag chos la skyon 'dogs pa de'i lus kyi tshad thos na mod la khrag skyug par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: gang zag chos la skyon 'dogs pa de'i lus kyi tshad thos na mod la khrag skyug par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: If one hears the size of the body of a person who faults the Dharma, one will immediately vomit blood,

original: 'chi ba'am / srog la bab pa'i sdug bsngal ba'am /
analyzed: 'chi ba'am / srog la bab pa'i sdug bsngal ba'am /
translated: die, or experience the suffering of death,

original: mya ngan gyi zug rdu skye ba'am /
analyzed: mya ngan gyi zug rdu skye ba'am /
translated: or the pain of grief will arise,

original: ldum bu brdas pa ltar bskam pa'am /
analyzed: ldum bu brdas pa ltar bskam pa'am /
translated: or one will wither like a cut plant,

original: dri ma can nam /
analyzed: dri ma can nam /
translated: or become filthy,

original: sngon po'am / sngo skyar 'gyur du 'ong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: sngon po'am / sngo skyar 'gyur du 'ong ba'i phyir te /
translated: or turn blue or bluish-green.

original: gang zag chos la skyon 'dogs pa de'i lus kyi tshad de 'dra ba thos na yang nyes pa de lta bu mod pas /
analyzed: gang zag chos la skyon 'dogs pa de'i lus kyi tshad de 'dra ba thos na yang nyes pa de lta bu mod pas /
translated: Because if one hears the size of the body of a person who faults the Dharma, such faults will immediately arise.

original: de'i lus kyi tshad ni 'di yin no zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la skabs dbye ba ma mdzad do //
analyzed: de'i lus kyi tshad ni 'di yin no zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la skabs dbye ba ma mdzad do //
translated: Therefore, the Blessed One did not give permission to Venerable Śāriputra to say, The size of their body is like this.

original: sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa /
translated: Śāriputra said,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan du gsol /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan du gsol /
translated: Blessed One, please teach.

original: chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba'i sug las bgyis shing bsags pa des chos la skyon 'dogs pa'i gang zag lus 'di 'dra ba yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes bgyi bas ni ma byung ba'i ngo bo rnams la snang pa bgyis par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba'i sug las bgyis shing bsags pa des chos la skyon 'dogs pa'i gang zag lus 'di 'dra ba yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes bgyi bas ni ma byung ba'i ngo bo rnams la snang pa bgyis par 'gyur ro //
translated: “By the karma of creating and accumulating the causes of being bereft of the Dharma, I will take on a body that criticizes the Dharma.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: sh'a ri'i bu 'dis chos kyis phongs par gyur pa'i las byas pa dang / bsags pa 'dis dmyal ba chen po'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu 'dis chos kyis phongs par gyur pa'i las byas pa dang / bsags pa 'dis dmyal ba chen po'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “Śāriputra, by creating and accumulating the causes of being bereft of the Dharma, he will experience the suffering of the great hells.🔽He will experience suffering for a long time, with immeasurable suffering like this.”

original: sdug bsngal tshad med pa mang po 'di lta bu dus ring por sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de gnyis kyis kyang ma byung ba'i skye bo rnams la snang bar byas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal tshad med pa mang po 'di lta bu dus ring por sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de gnyis kyis kyang ma byung ba'i skye bo rnams la snang bar byas par 'gyur te /
translated: Those two will make it appear to future generations that

original: dkar po'i cha dang ldan pa'i gang zag rnams nged kyis kyang de lta bu'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur du 'ong zhes sog gi don du yang dam pa'i chos mi spong zhing de dag chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba'i lam rnams las bzlog par 'gyur ro
analyzed: dkar po'i cha dang ldan pa'i gang zag rnams nged kyis kyang de lta bu'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur du 'ong zhes sog gi don du yang dam pa'i chos mi spong zhing de dag chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba'i lam rnams las bzlog par 'gyur ro
translated: I will not abandon the holy Dharma even for the sake of such suffering. I will turn them away from the paths that lead to the deprivation of the Dharma.”

original: // de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: // de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa de lta bu myong du 'ong ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa de lta bu myong du 'ong ngo //
translated: “Lord, such an experience of suffering will come!

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mi mthong ba dang / chos mi thos pa dang / dge 'dun mi mthong bar 'gyur du 'ong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mi mthong ba dang / chos mi thos pa dang / dge 'dun mi mthong bar 'gyur du 'ong ngo //
translated: It will come that they will not see the Tathāgata, will not hear the Dharma, and will not see the Saṅgha.

original: sangs rgyas 'byung ba med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du skyes bu 'ong ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung ba med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du skyes bu 'ong ngo //
translated: They will come to be born in a buddhafield where a buddha has not arisen.

original: mi phongs par 'gyur du 'ong ngo //
analyzed: mi phongs par 'gyur du 'ong ngo //
translated: They will come to be deprived.”

original: ngag mi btsun par 'gyur du 'ong ngo zhes bgyi bar lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las shin tu bsdams par bgyi'o //🔽bcom @139a * //
analyzed: ngag mi btsun par 'gyur du 'ong ngo zhes bgyi bar lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las shin tu bsdams par bgyi'o // bcom @139a * //
translated: We will be very careful in our physical, verbal, and mental actions so that we do not become vulgar.

original: ldan 'das chos spong ba'i tshig gi las bgyis shing bsags pa 'dis ni chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba'i las bgyis shing bsags par 'gyur ro //🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: ldan 'das chos spong ba'i tshig gi las bgyis shing bsags pa 'dis ni chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba'i las bgyis shing bsags par 'gyur ro // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Buddha said, By committing and accumulating the verbal action of rejecting the Dharma, you commit and accumulate the action of being deprived of the Dharma.

original: rab 'byor dam pa'i chos spong ba'i tshig gi las byas shing bsags pa 'dis chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba'i las byas shing bsags par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rab 'byor dam pa'i chos spong ba'i tshig gi las byas shing bsags pa 'dis chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba'i las byas shing bsags par 'gyur te /
translated: The Buddha said, Subhūti, by committing and accumulating the verbal action of rejecting the Dharma, you commit and accumulate the action of being deprived of the Dharma.

original: rab 'byor skyes bu glen pa de ni rang nyid kyis dam pa'i chos 'dul ba de nyid las rab tu 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor skyes bu glen pa de ni rang nyid kyis dam pa'i chos 'dul ba de nyid las rab tu 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Subhūti, that foolish person will himself go forth in that very Dharma and Vinaya.

original: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la skyon 'dogs par bya bar sems bar 'gyur /
analyzed: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la skyon 'dogs par bya bar sems bar 'gyur /
translated: Subhūti, they will think of criticizing the perfection of wisdom.

original: phyir spang bar bya bar sems par 'gyur /
analyzed: phyir spang bar bya bar sems par 'gyur /
translated: They will think of rejecting it.

original: phyir brgal bar sems par 'gyur ba de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la skyon 'dogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: phyir brgal bar sems par 'gyur ba de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la skyon 'dogs par 'gyur /
translated: He will be one who criticizes the perfection of wisdom.

original: phyir rgol bar 'gyur /
analyzed: phyir rgol bar 'gyur /
translated: He will be one who opposes it.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi byang chub la skyon 'dogs shing phyir rgol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi byang chub la skyon 'dogs shing phyir rgol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He will be one who criticizes and opposes the enlightenment of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones.

original: sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la skyon 'dogs shing phyir spangs pas 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la skyon btags shing phyir spang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la skyon 'dogs shing phyir spangs pas 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la skyon btags shing phyir spang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By criticizing and opposing the enlightenment of the Buddhas, he will criticize and oppose the knowledge of all modes of the Buddhas of the past, future, and present.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la skyon btags shing phyir spangs pas /🔽chos phyir spang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la skyon btags shing phyir spangs pas / chos phyir spang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By criticizing and opposing the knowledge of all modes,🔽he will criticize and oppose the Dharma.

original: chos phyir spangs pas dge 'dun phyir spang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos phyir spangs pas dge 'dun phyir spang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By criticizing and opposing the Dharma, he will criticize and oppose the Community.

original: dge 'dun phyir spangs pas 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba phyir spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: dge 'dun phyir spangs pas 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba phyir spangs pa yin no //
translated: By rejecting the Saṅgha, he rejects the worldly right view and the supramundane right view.

original: de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams phyir spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams phyir spangs pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, he rejects the six perfections, the thirty-seven factors of awakening, the four noble truths, the immeasurables, the concentrations, and the formless absorptions.

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / mngon par shes pa rnams phyir spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / mngon par shes pa rnams phyir spangs pa yin no //
translated: He rejects emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, the eight liberations, the nine serial absorptions, and the superknowledges.

original: nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad phyir spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad phyir spangs pa yin no //
translated: the emptiness of internal phenomena, the emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena, up to the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities, all the meditative stabilizations, and all the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: de bzhin gshegs @139b pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad phyir spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs @139b pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad phyir spangs pa yin no //
translated: He has rejected the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four assurances, the four kinds of exact knowledge, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du phyir spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du phyir spangs pa yin no //
translated: He has rejected omniscience.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du phyir spangs pas bsod nams ma yin pa'i phung po tshad med grangs med gzhal du med pa yongs su gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du phyir spangs pas bsod nams ma yin pa'i phung po tshad med grangs med gzhal du med pa yongs su gzung ba yin no //
translated: By rejecting omniscience, he has taken up an immeasurable, incalculable, and limitless mass of demerit.

original: bsod nams ma yin pa'i phung po tshad med grangs med gzhal du med pas yongs su bzung ba des sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba tshad med grangs med gzhal du med pa myong ba yin no zhes bya ba ni chos kyis phongs pa'i las yin no //
analyzed: bsod nams ma yin pa'i phung po tshad med grangs med gzhal du med pas yongs su bzung ba des sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba tshad med grangs med gzhal du med pa myong ba yin no zhes bya ba ni chos kyis phongs pa'i las yin no //
translated: This is the karma of being deprived of Dharma.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said:

original: bcom ldan 'das skyes bu glen pa gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di slar spong bar 'gyur ba de rnam pa du zhig gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di slar spong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das skyes bu glen pa gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di slar spong bar 'gyur ba de rnam pa du zhig gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di slar spong bar 'gyur /
translated: Blessed One, in how many ways do those foolish people reject this perfection of wisdom?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: rab 'byor skyes bu glen pa de dag rnam pa bzhis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa phyir spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor skyes bu glen pa de dag rnam pa bzhis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa phyir spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Subhūti, those foolish people reject the perfection of wisdom in four ways.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: skyes bu glen pa de dag ni bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs par 'gyur ba dang / chos zab mo rnams la mos pa med par 'gyur zhing rab tu dad par mi 'gyur ba dang / phung po lnga la sogs pa la mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: skyes bu glen pa de dag ni bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs par 'gyur ba dang / chos zab mo rnams la mos pa med par 'gyur zhing rab tu dad par mi 'gyur ba dang / phung po lnga la sogs pa la mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: Those foolish people will be possessed by Māra, and they will not be interested in and will not have faith in the profound Dharma. They will cling to the five aggregates and so on,

original: sdig pa'i grogs po'i lag tu song bas zhe sdang gi spyod pa can bdag la stod cing gzhan la smod par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: sdig pa'i grogs po'i lag tu song bas zhe sdang gi spyod pa can bdag la stod cing gzhan la smod par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: and they will fall into the hands of evil companions. They will be given to angry behavior, praising themselves and disparaging others.

original: rab 'byor rnam pa bzhi po de dag dang ldan na skyes bu glen pa de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di phyir spang bar 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: rab 'byor rnam pa bzhi po de dag dang ldan na skyes bu glen pa de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di phyir spang bar 'gyur ro ;
translated: Subhūti, if those foolish people have those four aspects, they will reject this profound perfection of wisdom.

original: / rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: / rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni brtson 'grus chung ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mi ldan zhing sdig pa'i grogs po'i sug par mchis pa rnams kyis mos par dka'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni brtson 'grus chung ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mi ldan zhing sdig pa'i grogs po'i sug par mchis pa rnams kyis mos par dka'o //
translated: “Blessed One, it is difficult for those with little diligence, those who do not have roots of virtue, and those who have fallen into the hands of evil companions to have conviction in this profound perfection of wisdom.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said:

original: rab 'byor de de bzhin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor de de bzhin te /
translated: “So it is, Subhūti.🔽This perfection of wisdom is hard to believe for those who have little🔽faith, who are not endowed with wholesome roots, and who have fallen

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni brtson 'grus chung ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mi ldan zhing sdig pa'i grogs po'i lag tu lhung ba rnams kyis mos par dka'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni brtson 'grus chung ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mi ldan zhing sdig pa'i grogs po'i lag tu lhung ba rnams kyis mos par dka'o //
translated: into the hands of bad friends.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: ” Subhūti said:

original: bcom ldan 'das de ltar mos par dka' ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ji @140a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ltar mos par dka' ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ji @140a * //
translated: “Lord, how deep is this perfection of wisdom, which is so hard to

original: tsam du zab pa lags /
analyzed: tsam du zab pa lags /
translated: believe?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” The Lord said:

original: rab 'byor gzugs ni ma bcings ma grol ba ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs ni ma bcings ma grol ba ste /
translated: “Subhūti, form is neither bound nor liberated.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: rab 'byor gzugs la rang bzhin med pa de ni gzugs yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽tshor ba la rang bzhin med pa de ni tshor ba yin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs la rang bzhin med pa de ni gzugs yin pa'i phyir ro // tshor ba la rang bzhin med pa de ni tshor ba yin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because, Subhūti, that intrinsic nature of form is form.🔽Because, Subhūti, that intrinsic nature of feeling is feeling.

original: /'du shes la rang bzhin med pa de ni 'du shes yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: /'du shes la rang bzhin med pa de ni 'du shes yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, Subhūti, that intrinsic nature of perception is perception.

original: 'du byed rnams la rang bzhin med pa de ni 'du byed rnams yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams la rang bzhin med pa de ni 'du byed rnams yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the absence of an intrinsic nature of compounded phenomena is compounded phenomena.

original: rnam par shes pa ni ma bcings ma grol ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni ma bcings ma grol ba ste /
translated: Consciousness is neither bound nor liberated.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: rnam par shes pa la rang bzhin med pa ni rnam par shes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la rang bzhin med pa ni rnam par shes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the absence of an intrinsic nature of consciousness is consciousness.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni ma bcings ma grol ba ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni ma bcings ma grol ba ste /
translated: “Subhūti, in the same way, the perfection of giving is neither bound nor liberated.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la rang bzhin med pa de ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la rang bzhin med pa de ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the absence of an intrinsic nature of the perfection of giving is the perfection of giving.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ma bcings ma grol ba ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ma bcings ma grol ba ste /
translated: “Subhūti, in the same way, the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom are neither bound nor liberated.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rang bzhin med pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rang bzhin med pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Su­bhūti, it is because the perfection of wisdom is the perfection of wisdom, since it is without entity.

original: rab 'byor nang stong pa nyid ni ma bcings ma grol ba ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor nang stong pa nyid ni ma bcings ma grol ba ste /
translated: “Su­bhūti, the emptiness of internal phenomena is neither fettered nor liberated.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽rab 'byor nang stong pa nyid la rang bzhin med pa ni nang stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / rab 'byor nang stong pa nyid la rang bzhin med pa ni nang stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If you ask why,🔽Su­bhūti, it is because the emptiness of internal phenomena is the emptiness of internal phenomena, since it is without entity.

original: rab 'byor dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la rang bzhin med pa ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la rang bzhin med pa ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Su­bhūti, the other aspects of emptiness, up to and including the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities, are without entity.

original: rab 'byor dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams ni ma bcings ma grol ba ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams ni ma bcings ma grol ba ste /
translated: Su­bhūti, the applications of mindfulness are neither fettered nor liberated.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: rab 'byor dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la rang bzhin med pa ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la rang bzhin med pa ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Su­bhūti, it is because the applications of mindfulness are the applications of mindfulness, since they are without entity.

original: rab 'byor lam rnams kyi bar du ma bcings ma grol ba ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor lam rnams kyi bar du ma bcings ma grol ba ste /
translated: up to the paths are neither fettered nor liberated.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: rab 'byor lam rnams la rang bzhin med pa ni lam rnams yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor lam rnams la rang bzhin med pa ni lam rnams yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Subhūti, it is because the paths are the paths because of the absence of an intrinsic nature in the paths.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du stobs bcu rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad rnams dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni ma bcings ma grol ba ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du stobs bcu rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad rnams dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni ma bcings ma grol ba ste /
translated: Subhūti, in the same way, the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, and the knowledge of all aspects are neither fettered nor liberated.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: rab 'byor @140b rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la rang bzhin med pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor @140b rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la rang bzhin med pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Subhūti, it is because the knowledge of all aspects is the knowledge of all aspects because of the absence of an intrinsic nature in the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor gzugs kyi sngon gyi mtha' ni ma bcings ma grol ba ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs kyi sngon gyi mtha' ni ma bcings ma grol ba ste /
translated: Subhūti, the prior limit of form is neither fettered nor liberated.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: rab 'byor sngon gyi mtha' dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin ni gzugs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor sngon gyi mtha' dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin ni gzugs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Subhūti, it is because the prior limit is form because of the absence of an intrinsic nature in the prior limit.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i sngon gyi mtha' ni ma bcings ma grol ba ste /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i sngon gyi mtha' ni ma bcings ma grol ba ste /
translated: The past limit of feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness is not bound and is not freed.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor sngon gyi mtha' dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin ni rnam par shes pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor sngon gyi mtha' dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin ni rnam par shes pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Subhūti, it is because the past limit, the intrinsic nature of the absence of an existent thing, is not consciousness.

original: rab 'byor rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi sngon gyi mtha' ni ma bcings ma grol ba ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi sngon gyi mtha' ni ma bcings ma grol ba ste /
translated: Subhūti, the past limit of the knowledge of all aspects is not bound and is not freed.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor sngon gyi mtha' dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor sngon gyi mtha' dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Subhūti, it is because the past limit, the intrinsic nature of the absence of an existent thing, is the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor gzugs kyi phyi ma'i mtha' ni ma bcings ma grol ba ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs kyi phyi ma'i mtha' ni ma bcings ma grol ba ste /
translated: Subhūti, the future limit of form is not bound and is not freed.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor phyi ma'i mtha' dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin ni gzugs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor phyi ma'i mtha' dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin ni gzugs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Subhūti, it is because the future limit, the intrinsic nature of the absence of an existent thing, is form.

original: rab 'byor tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i phyi ma'i mtha' ni ma bcings ma grol ba ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i phyi ma'i mtha' ni ma bcings ma grol ba ste /
translated: “Subhūti, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not bound and are not freed.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor phyi ma'i mtha' dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin ni rnam par shes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor phyi ma'i mtha' dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin ni rnam par shes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Subhūti, the future intrinsic nature of things that are not existent is consciousness.

original: rab 'byor rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi phyi ma'i mtha' ni ma bcings ma grol ba ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi phyi ma'i mtha' ni ma bcings ma grol ba ste /
translated: “Subhūti, up to the knowledge of all aspects is not bound and is not freed.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor phyi ma'i mtha' dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor phyi ma'i mtha' dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Subhūti, the future intrinsic nature of things that are not existent is the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor gzugs kyi da ltar byung ba ni ma bcings ma grol ba ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs kyi da ltar byung ba ni ma bcings ma grol ba ste /
translated: “Subhūti, present form is not bound and is not freed.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na ;
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na ;
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor da ltar byung ba'i dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin ni gzugs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor da ltar byung ba'i dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin ni gzugs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Subhūti, the present intrinsic nature of things that are not existent is form.

original: rab 'byor tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i da ltar byung ba ni ma bcings ma grol ba ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i da ltar byung ba ni ma bcings ma grol ba ste /
translated: “Subhūti, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness that are present are neither fettered nor liberated.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor da ltar byung ba'i dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin ni rnam par shes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor da ltar byung ba'i dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin ni rnam par shes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Subhūti, it is because the intrinsic nature of the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature of that which is present is consciousness.

original: rab 'byor rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi da ltar byung ba ni ma bcings ma grol ba ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi da ltar byung ba ni ma bcings ma grol ba ste /
translated: “Subhūti, up to the knowledge of all aspects that is present is neither fettered nor liberated.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor da ltar byung ba'i dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin ni rnam par thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor da ltar byung ba'i dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin ni rnam par thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Subhūti, it is because the intrinsic nature of the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature of that which is present is the knowledge of all aspects.”

original: rab 'byor gyis @141a * //
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis @141a * //
translated: Subhūti then said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni brtson 'grus chung ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba ma skyes pa /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni brtson 'grus chung ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba ma skyes pa /
translated: “Lord, the perfection of wisdom is for those of little effort, those who have not produced wholesome roots,

original: sdig pa'i grogs po'i lag tu ltung ba /
analyzed: sdig pa'i grogs po'i lag tu ltung ba /
translated: those who have fallen into the hands of bad friends,

original: bdud kyi dbang du gyur pa /
analyzed: bdud kyi dbang du gyur pa /
translated: those who have come under the power of Māra,

original: le lo can /
analyzed: le lo can /
translated: lazy,

original: brtson 'grus btang ba /
analyzed: brtson 'grus btang ba /
translated: negligent,

original: dran pa nyams pa shes bzhin dang mi ldan pa rnams kyis mos par dka'o //
analyzed: dran pa nyams pa shes bzhin dang mi ldan pa rnams kyis mos par dka'o //
translated: and lacking in mindfulness and vigilance.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor de de bzhin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor de de bzhin te /
translated: “Subhūti, it is so!

original: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni brtson 'grus chung ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa dang / sdig pa'i grogs po'i lag tu ltung ba dang / bdud kyi dbang du gyur pa dang / le lo can dang /🔽brtson 'grus btang ba /
analyzed: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni brtson 'grus chung ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa dang / sdig pa'i grogs po'i lag tu ltung ba dang / bdud kyi dbang du gyur pa dang / le lo can dang / brtson 'grus btang ba /
translated: Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom is difficult to believe for those with little diligence, those who have not planted the roots of virtue, those who have fallen into the hands of bad friends, those under the power of Māra, the lazy,🔽negligent,

original: dran pa nyams pa /
analyzed: dran pa nyams pa /
translated: and lacking in mindfulness and vigilance.
